loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Irineo  es socio del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Irineo es casado tiene 53 años, cuatro hijos de 21, 16,14 y 12 años, los tres últimos están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Trabajaba en construcción civil pero no siempre tenia trabajo, terminaban de construir y se quedaba sin trabajo, eso era mortificante para el. Hace ocho años se puso a criar animales y con las ganancias de los animales junto y se decidió comprar una moto-car  para dar servicio.  
Irineo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para el arreglo de su moto.
Desde que esta en Finca recibe orientación para sus negocio  a través de charlas, le a ayudado a administrar mejor su negocio, le gusta el compañerismo que hay entre las socias.    
El sueño de Irineo luchar por sus hijos y darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Irineo is a member of the Mercedes Virgin Community Bank. He is a married father of four children, ages 21, 16, 14 and 12. The youngest three are studying at a state school. He had a job in civil construction, but there was not always work and he eventually lost his job and was unemployed, which was mortifying for him. He started raising livestock eight years ago, and with the earnings from that he bought a moto-car to do a taxi service.

Irineo is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to fix his vehicle. Since he is a member with Kiva partner Finca, he has received his orientation for his business and it has helped him administer his business better. He enjoys the companionship with the other members. Irineo's dream is to work hard for his children and give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs on his moto-car

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora María C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de caramelos y pan siendo comercializados por ella misma en su localidad a diario.

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir más productos para comercializarlos y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y así adquirir sus productos para continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, María C. is dedicated to her business selling candy and bread, products she sells in her area on a daily. Currently she sees the necessity of adding more products to sell, and it's for this reason she came to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan so she can continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, bread and other products

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por 10 personas todas viven cerca al lugar de reunión que es la casa de la señora Matilde P., quien es la líder del grupo por ello la nombraron presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de material escolar en la feria de su zona “Munaypata”;  tiene 4 hijos y esta casada con el señor Omar B. quien trabaja como administrador en la tienda de la fabrica de Stabilo en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz, la señora Matilde es una persona perseverante y ante todo  muy leal con la institución, porque ya antes trabajo en otro grupo donde sus excompañeras crearon algunos problemas, por ello ella se propuso formar  otro grupo con personas de mas con fianza y en su zona y así seguir trabajando con Emprender.
Otra líder del grupo es la señora Danitza B. quien se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 2 hijos y manifiesta el querer seguir trabajando con Emprender y mas Lugo obtener un crédito mas alto para  aperturar su pensión.
También son parte del grupo  el señor Ivan tito Q. Q. quien es protesista dental.
Giovanna Daysi P., ella es soltera estudia la carrera de Derecho pero también es una joven emprendedora que se dedica al tejido de prendas de bebe a maquina.
Marcelo Victor P. también se dedica al tejido de gorritos y ropa de bebe.
Eugenia M. Velásquez  se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su domicilio.
Angelica C. Rioja ella es parte de la mesa directiva del grupo tiene el cargo de Tesorera, su negocio es el de repostería.
Tereza Manuela S. N., ella tiene un taller de producción de zapatos de cholita, trabaja junto a su esposo Jaime Gonzales.
Adriana Q. B. se dedica a la  venta de cosméticos.
Fabiana Domitila M. ella vende comida “pescado frito” en el mercado Uruguay también vende al por mayor ropa que trae desde Chile.
texts.en:
This group has 10 members, all of whom live close to where the group meets - Señora Matilde P.'s house. She is the group's leader, the person they have named as their president, and she sells school supplies at the area's market: Munaypata. She is married to Señor Omar Barrerahas, who works in the offices of a clothing store in middle of the city of La Paz. The couple have 4 children. More than anything, Matilde is very determined and very loyal to the group. Earlier, she was part of a different group but the other members were difficult to work with, so Matilde founded a new group, this group, with people who were more reliable and lived in her neighbourhood. In this way, was able to continue working with Emprender. Another very active member of the group is Señora Danitza B., who sells meals. She has 2 children. She is looking forward to her future work with the communal bank and especially, to realizing her goal of opening a little hostel. Other group members include Señor Ivan tito Q. Q., who is a dental prosthetician; Eugenia M. Velásquez, who sells meals from his home; Adriana Q. B., who sells cosmetics; Fabiana Domitila M., who sells fried fish in Uruguay market, as well as importing and selling clothing from Chile; Giovanna Daysi P., who is single and studies law, but who also makes and sell babies' clothing; Marcelo Victor P., who also makes clothing for babies; Angelica C. Rioja, who is the group's treasurer and who runs a pastry shop; and finally, Tereza Manuela S. N. and Jaime Gonzales, who are married and run a traditional shoe making business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a bookstore

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the "Las Triunfadoras" ("Triumphant Women") Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes. Francisca is 29 years old and lives with her one-year-old baby and five-year-old child. Francisca sells disposable plastic containers and wrappers, pots, pans, and small animals door-to-door around the Cusco area. The plastics are frequently used by food vendors. She buys guinea pigs and rabbits when they are full-grown but have little meat on them; she then fattens them up and sells them for a profit. For example, if she buys a rabbit for 10 soles, she can sell it for anywhere from 18 to 25 soles just a few weeks later.

Francisca is requesting a loan of 1,800 soles to buy plastic plates and containers to sell. She plans to buy them in bulk, usually in boxes containing 1,000 to 6,000 units each. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full.

Francisca’s goal for the future is to buy a motorcycle taxi for her husband to drive: motorcycle taxis are one of the main forms of passenger transport in her area. She estimates that this will cost about 6,000 soles.

loans.use: To buy plastic plates and containers in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La sra. Ana tiene su librería bazar cerca del  colegio 26 de Junio, con ocho años de antigüedad, es muy conocida por la zona, tiene dos niños, su esposo es docente de una universidad privada, ambos se ocupan de los gastos de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materiales para la librería, como polietileno, hojas, folders, plastoformo. Cliente Muy puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana has run a bookstore and stationer's near the 26 de Junio College for 8 years, and is very well known in the neighbourhood. She is married to a professor at a private university and the couple have two children. Both she and her husband contribute to the household income. The loan will be used to buy products for Ana's bookstore, including paper, folders, binders, and duotangs. Ana is a very punctual and responsible client of the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a bookstore

loans.name: Puca Puca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Puca Puca que significa Rojo Rojo, las socias son del barrio D. Puca Puca, el Banco inicia su primer ciclo con 13 socias, muchas D. las socias fueron invitadas por la promotora para integrar este nuevo banco Comunal..

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, frutas, leña, abarrotes en general, golosinas, ropa, cereales, artesanía.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, haciendo un total D. 4,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. ropa, manzana, plátano, arroz, azúcar, fideo y leña.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Puca Puca (Red Red) Community Bank are from the Puca Puca neighborhood. The bank started its first loan with 13 members, many of whom were invited by the founder to make up this new community bank. The members have different businesses, such as selling food, fruits, firewood, general groceries, snacks, cloths, grains and crafts. The members need different loan amounts, 300 soles, 450 soles for instance, making a total of 4,800 soles in loans for the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of clothing, apples, bananas, rice, sugar, noodles and firewood. The members' dreams are to expand their businesses, have their own homes and proviD. their children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, apples, bananas, rice, sugar, noodles and firewood

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Luzmila es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Luzmila vende calzados en la feria de las Américas, actividad que realiza los días domingos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Luzmila viaja a las ferias en donde compra ganado ovino que vende en la feria dominical del distrito de San Juan.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Luzmila sueña con tener un negocio que genere mas ingresos, sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Ayni Community Bank, which means Help in Quechua. She is a 28-year-old mother of three and lives with her partner. Luzmila sells footwear at the flea market of the Americas on Sundays. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Furthermore, she also travels to the other flea markets, where she purchases sheep and sells them at the Sunday market in the district of San Juan. Luzmila is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles, which she will use to purchase shoes. Her dreams are to have a business that generates more income, for her children to become professionals and to improve her improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Leiloa

texts.en: Leiloa M., 53, is married with 8 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 3 days per week. She had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Leiloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy more tools and chemicals for her business and also to help with kids school fees and home improvement.

loans.use: To buy tools, chemicals to kill insects

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Juana es separada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, alquiler de vestidos de novia, ternos, su tienda se llama la Casa de los Novios, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de una persona.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para vestidos.
Los sueños de Juana son ampliar su negocio, descansar y relajarse.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Ayni Community Bank, which means Help in Quechua. Juana is a 65-year-old mother of two and separated from her husband. She has a sowing shop that makes dress and rents bridal gowns and suits. Her shop is called Casa de los Novios (Home of the Couple), and she is assisted by another person. Juana is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to use to purchase fabrics for dresses. Her dreams are to expand her business, rest and relax.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: La sra. Ingrid tiene su restaurante en la zona de Villa Copacabana, atiende los fines de semana (sábado y domingo),  ofrece platos típicos del departamento de La Paz, como fricasé, plato con trozos de cerdo acompañados con mote y chuño (papa deshidratada) servidos con su mismo caldo sazonado con ají amarillo; chicharrón, plato de trozos de cerdo retostados acompañado de mote y chuño; lechón, plato con trozos de carne de cerdo cocido al horno, sazonado con ají, acompañado de ensalada de lechuga, tomate y cebolla, camote, papa y plátano, cocidos también al horno, por la zona su restaurante ya es muy conocido. Ella vive con su esposo que se dedica al servicio de electrónica, y su hijo que está en edad escolar, sus otros hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Cliente muy responsable y puntual, invertirá el crédito en la compra de juegos de mesas y sillas, un extractor de grasa y un juego de ollas, ya que por la demanda que tiene debe aumentar la cantidad de platos a servir.
texts.en:
Ingrid owns a restaurant in the Villa Copacana zone, which is open on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) and offers dishes typical of the La Paz region, such as fricasé, a pork dish accompanied by mote (boiled corn) and chuño (a type of dehydrated potato) and served in its own broth seasoned with yellow ají pepper; chicharrón, roasted and slow-simmered pork rinds accompanied by mote and chuño; lechón, roasted beef and pork seasoned with ají and served with a salad of lettuce, tomato and onion, and roasted sweet potatoes, potatoes, and plantains. Her restaurant is already very well known in the area. She lives with her husband, who works in electronics repair, and one son who is of school-age; her other children are older and independent. Ingrid is a very responsible and punctual client. She will invest her loan in sets of tables and chairs, a stove exhaust fan, and a set of pots, since the high demand at her restaurant will require her to increase the number of dishes served.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will be invested in the purchase of kitchen furnishings for her business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Benita es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Benita vende comida actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas, la comida lo vende en la universidad a los obreros.
Benita necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Benita son mejorar su negocio, comprar una casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of Ayni Community Bank, which means Help in Quechua. She is a 50-year-old married mother of seven. She sells food to the workers at the local university, which she does with the help of her daughters. Benita is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which she will use to purchase rice and noodles. Her dreams are to improve her business, buy a home and for her children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and noodles

loans.name: Victoria Pascuala

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Victoria es separada,  tiene 43 años y 3 hijas, Victoria tiene un restaurante polleria en la ciudad de Pichary que se ubica a 8 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 5 personas. Además Victoria tiene carros con los cuales realiza transporte interprovincial.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas y carne.
Victoria sueña con comprar otro carro mas y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Ayni Community Bank. Ayni means “help” in Quechua. She is 43 years old, separated, and has 3 daughters. Victoria has a chicken restaurant with 5 employees in Pichary city, located 8 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She also owns vehicles which she uses for long-distance transportation. Victoria needs a loan for 3000 soles that she will invest in drinks and meat. She hopes to buy another car and dreams of seeing her children finish school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: drinks and meat

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Teodora es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Teodora venD. leña en su casa, la leña los compra D. los productores, también en algunas oportunidades viaja a los pueblos D. la región donD. compra cereales y luego los venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Teodora necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Los sueños D. Teodora son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Ayni Community Bank. Ayni means “help” in Quechua. She is 45 years old, married and has 7 children. Teodora sells firewood from her home, which she buys from a producer. Ocassionaly she also travels to different towns in the region where she buys grains that she then sells in the city of Ayacucho. Teordora needs a loan of 1050 soles that she will invest in more firewood. Teodora hopes to expand her business and dreams of seeing her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: firewood

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Freddy M. Alarcón se dedica a la elaboración de calzados para damas. Don Freddy tiene su pareja con la cual solo son convivientes, además de tener una hija de 18 años que le ayuda a vender en su puesto de la calle comercio.
Don Freddy es bastante responsable, ya que supo invertir cada uno de sus créditos, pues actualmente cuenta con tres máquinas y dos ayudantes, lo que le permite producir en mayor cantidad para satisfacer la demanda de su principal cliente Calzart Bolivia.
La manera en la cual vende los calzados es mediante sus dos puestos que tiene; una en la galeria ISMAR y la otra en la PEREZ VELAZCO, en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz, otra forma de vender es a tráves de la venta ambulante.
texts.en:
Freddy M. Alarcón makes womens’ footwear. He has a common law wife and an 18 year old daughter. His daughter helps him sell in the stall on the business street. Freddy is responsible. He knew how to invest each one of his loans. He now has three machines and two helpers. This allows him to produce more and meet the needs of his main client, Calzart Bolivia. He sells the shoes from two stalls that he has. One is in the Galeria Ismar, and the other is in the Perez Velazo in the center of La Paz city. Another way to sell is as a traveling vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and a scrutch (tool used when making shoes)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Paula es casada, tiene 75 años y 5 hijos, Paula tiene un horno rustico en donD. elabora panes típicos D. la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos y nietos, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado y reparte a las tiendas.
Paula necesita un préstamo D. 500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y leña.
El sueño D. Paula es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 75 years old, married, with 5 children. With the help of her children and grandchildren, Paula bakes typical breads of the region in her rustic oven. She sells the bread in the local market and to stores. Paula needs a loan of 500 soles that she will invest in flour and firewood. Paula hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: flour and firewood

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Herminia es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Herminia venD. carne D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad, los animales los compra en las feria y luego los beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad.
Herminia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. animales.
Los sueños D. Herminia son construir su casa y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Herminia sells meat as a traveling vendor in the market in her city. She buys the animals at an animal market and then takes them to the slaughterhouse. Herminia needs a loan of 2000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of more animals. Herminia dreams of building her own home and having her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: animals

loans.name: Julia America

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Julia es soltera, tiene 58 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además los días sábados viaja a la feria de San Miguel en donde vende ropa variada.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosa.
Los sueños de Julia son construir su casa de material noble y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 58 years old, single, and has 4 children. Julia has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, and on Saturdays she travels to the San Miguel market where she sells a variety of clothing. Julia needs a loan of 1600 soles that she will invest in rice, sugar, beer and soda. Julia dreams of building her own home with sturdy materials and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice sugar, beer, soda

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Vilma junto a su esposo son artesanos y realizan trabajos en telar como individuales, pisos, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de la ciudad.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana y urdiembre.
Los sueños de Vilma son construir su casa, e incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her son. Vilma and her husband are artisans who both make weavings and sell them in the city market. Vilma needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will invest in wool and warp threads. Vilma dreams of building her own home and of increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wool

loans.name: Yolda

texts.es:
Yolda es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Yolda es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Yolda tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende agroquímicos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, durante todos los días.
Yolda necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos veterinarios.
Los sueños de Yolda son ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolda is a member of the Alondras (The Larks) Communal Bank. She is 27 years old, married and has two children. Yolda has a store in some rented space where she sells agricultural chemicals. She does this every day, with the help of her sister. Yolda needs a loan of 1,200 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of veterinary products. She dreams of being able to build up her business and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy veterinary products.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Julia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado F: Vivanco, en donde vende verdura actividad que realiza todos los días, además por las tardes vende ropa a pedido.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de blusas, chompas.
Los sueños de Julia son comprar una casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Alondras (The Larks) Communal Bank. Julia is 36 years of age, married and has four children. She has a stand in the F: Vivanco market where she sells vegetables. She does this every day and later in the afternoon she sells clothing to order. Julia needs a loan of 1,200 Sols which will be invested in purchasing blouses and sweaters. Julia's dreams are of buying a house and that her children will complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Lusmila es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha que significa Árbol Grande en quechua.
Lusmila es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Lusmila junto a su esposo realizan transporte urbano a diferentes ferias y en algunas oportunidades compra frutas que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Lusmila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas y camote.
Los sueños de Lusmila son tener mas capital, aumentar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lusmila is a partner of Ccatun Sacha Communal Bank which means "Big Tree" in Quechua. Lusmila, who is 22 years old, lives with her partner and one son. With her husband, she runs a taxi service to different markets and, in some cases, she buys fruits that she sells comercially in the wholesale food market in the city. Lusmila needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of fruits and sweet potatoes. Lusmila dreams of having more capital, increasing her business and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Juanita De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Juanita de la Cruz Meave vive con su hija que esta en colegio, gracias a su habilidad la señora esta trabajando varios años como profesora de manualidades, además dedica su tiempo libre a un taller de costura y artesanías que abrió con su amiga la señora Lotty,  ella hace edredones, vestidos ,trajes, almohadones, mandiles  y manteles. Los manteles los realiza a mano poniendo mucho amor y dedicación a su trabajo, la mayor parte de sus clientes son personas extranjeras que aprecian mucho su trabajo.
En un futuro la señora piensa exportar sus productos, y así demostrar que si una mujer desea salir adelante lo puede hacer.
texts.en:
Señora Juanita de la Cruz Meave lives with her daughter who is still in school. Thanks to her skills she has worked for several years as an instructor of handicrafts. She also spends her time in a workshop for clothing and artisan crafts that she opened with her friend, Señora Lotty. She makes comforters, clothing, suits, cushions, aprons and tablecloths. The tablecloths are made by hand, with great love and dedicated work. Most of her customers are tourists who really appreciate her work. In the future she is thinking about exporting her products, and demonstrating that if a woman wants to get ahead, she can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her crafts.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 33 años, vive con sus dos hijos Kalin de 12 y Yan de 2 años en un cuarto alquilado, ella es una buena madre de familia, siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y es que desea darles lo que ella no pudo tener. Cuando Beatriz puso su tienda de abarrotes hace un año, tenía mucha fe en que le iría bien, por eso decidió trabajar duro y sin descanso para alcanzar sus metas. Abre su bodega a las 5:30 de la mañana todos los días y brinda una atención muy cordial a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, es muy buena vendedora, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar sus actividades. Beatriz espera más adelante mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes, ella es conciente de que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de lograrlo. Beatriz se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 33 years old and lives with her two sons, Kalin, age 12, and Yan who is 2 years old, in a rented room. She is a good mother, always worrying about the well-being of her children and she wishes to give them what she could not have. When Beatriz started her grocery store a year ago she had a lot of faith that it would go well for her, which is why she decided to work hard and tirelessly to reach her goals. She opens her shop at 5:30 a.m. everyday and provides cordial service to her customers. What she most likes about her job is to sell as she is a very good salesperson and her customers always leave her store very happy. But what she likes least is to have to be inside of her shop all day without being able to go outside to carry out her activities. Beatriz hopes in the future to improve her store and make it grow to be able to better serve her customers. She is aware that the path to her goals in long and with sacrifices, but she is prepared to work very hard to accomplish it. Beatriz is in her first loan with MFP and she hope to be punctual with her payments as she does not want to harm the other members in her communal bank where she is very loved and respected. With the thousand nuevos soles that she is requesting she will buy more products to better operate her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Norma Victoria

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha que significa Árbol Grande en quechua.
Norma es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos, Norma junto a su esposo tienen una sastrería en donde confeccionan ropa a medida, también confeccionan ropa típica que reparte por mayor a las tiendas.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Norma sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Ccatun Sacha Communal Bank, which means Big Tree in Quechua. Norma is married, is 48 years old and has 7 children. Norma and her husband have a tailor shop where they make made-to-measure clothing and also make traditional clothing that they sell wholesale to stores. Norma needs a loan of 1600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of fabric. Norma dreams of her children finishing their studies and diversifying her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 32 años es una madre muy preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos Gabriel de 7 y Midwar de 16, vive en cuarto alquilado y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. Lleva más de 5 años en la venta de sobreros y gorras de segunda mano, ha encontrado en esta actividad la mejor manera de sostener económicamente a su familia, compra las gorras usadas de sus proveedores, para luego arreglarlas y el día domingo, en la ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, las vende de manera ambulatoria. Para Celia lo más divertido de su trabajo es vender, disfruta de convencer a sus clientes de comprarle algo y así acabar con su mercadería, espera en el futuro tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, puesto que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que caminar todo el día por la calles en busca de clientes. Celia sabe que el camino a sus metas es duro, pero no decae en su afán de lograr alcanzarlas. Este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más participativas y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más gorras y sombreros, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Celia, 32 years old, is a mother who is very worried about the well-being of her sons Gabriel, age 7 and Midwar, 16. She lives in a rented room and has great desire to get ahead in life. For more than 5 years she has been selling second-hand hats. She found this activity to be the best way to support her family economically. She buys the used hats from suppliers to then repair them and on Sundays, in the markets of the city of Juliaca, she sells them as an ambulatory salesperson. For Celia, the most fun part of her job is to sell as she enjoys convincing her customers to buy something and sell out of her merchandise. In the future she hopes to have a clothing store where she can sell with greater comfort and provide better service to her customers. What she likes least about her work is having to walk all day long through the streets in search of clients. Celia knows that the path to her goals is difficult, but this does not decrease her eagerness to accomplish them. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels very happy about this opportunity for a loan. She hopes to be able to repay it on time and in her communal bank she is one of the most participatory and responsible members. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy more hats to increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Cecilia es casada, tienen 48 años y 6 hijos, Cecilia vende golosinas variadas de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, su negocio esta ubicado al frente de una universidad. Además los fines de semana viaja a las ferias en donde vende verduras.
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y golosinas.
Los sueños de Cecilia son techar su casa para alquilar y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Cecilia is married, is 48 years old and has 6 children. Cecilia sells varied sweets as a traveling salesperson in a centrally located street in the city of Ayacucho. Her business is located in front of a university. In addition, on the weekends she travels to markets where she sells vegetables. Cecilia needs a loan of 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of vegetables and sweets. Cecilia's dreams are to put a roof on her house in order to rent it and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of vegetables and sweets.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Antonia es casada, tiene 63 años y 4 hijos, Antonia venD. buzos, ropa variada, calzados, sus ventas son a pedido y a crédito a amigos familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima. Además alquila su casa que le genera algunos ingresos.
Antonia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mayólicas para su casa.
Los sueños D. Antonia son mejorar su negocio, distraerse y descansar ya que sus hijos son mayores.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Antonia is married, is 63 years old and has 4 children. Antonia sells shawls, varied clothing, and shoes. Her sales are by order and on credit to friends and relatives. She gets her products in the city of Lima. In addition, she rents her house to generate additional income. Antonia needs a loan of 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of floor tiles for her house. Antonia's dreams are to improve her business, have leisure time and rest now that her children are older.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase floor tiles for her house.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Mirian es una mujer muy alegre, a sus 30 años ha logrado construir con mucho esfuerzo su casa propia, vive con su único hijo, Yeron de 6 años, a quien quiere darle buenos estudios. Para Mirian las abejas en vez de causarle miedo le causan felicidad, ya que gracias a la miel que producen ella puede llevar el dinero necesario a su familia para mantener a su hogar, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y la miel que vende es rápidamente comprada por las tiendas a quienes provee con este delicioso néctar. Mirian disfruta de su trabajo, ya que cuando tiene hambre no duda en abrir unos de sus recipientes de plástico y saborear el producto que vende, pero lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto durante todo el día para vender su producto. Aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar duro y espera poder abrir un negocio más estable como una tienda de abarrotes o una librería, puesto que el barrio donde vive está recién formándose y aun carece de estos servicios. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y se siente en la responsabilidad de hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy solidaria y preocupada. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar más miel para poder tener el dinero necesario para abrir el negocio propio que tanto ansía.
texts.en:
Mirian is a very happy woman and at 30 years of age she has managed with much effort to build her own house. She lives with her only son, Yeron who is 6 years old, to whom she wants to give a good education. For Mirian, bees, instead of scaring her, cause her happiness as thanks to the honey that they produce she can bring home to her family the money necessary to support her household. She has been involved in this activity for 4 years and the honey that she sells is quickly purchased by the stores to which she supplies this delicious nectar. Mirian enjoys her work as when she is hungry she does not hesitate to open some of her plastic containers and taste the product that she sells. But what she likes least is having to walk so much during the day to sell her product. Despite this she knows that she has to work hard and hopes to be able to open a more stable business such as a grocery store or a bookstore as the neighborhood where she lives is new and still lacks these services. This is her second loan with MFP and she knows that she has to pay it on time and feels the responsibility to do it. In her communal bank she acts with solidarity and concern. With the funds that she is requesting she plans to increase her working capital and purchase more honey to be able to have the money necessary to open her own business that see so much wants.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general y de las ferias compra carne, queso que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Felicitas tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Felicitas son mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Maria Antonieta community bank. Felicitas, 38, is married and has 3 children. Felicitas travels to the different regional fairs where they sell general groceries. She buys meat and cheese to later sell in the Ayacucho wholesale food market. Felicitas also has a small store in her house. Felicitas needs a loan of 900 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Felicitas dreams of improving her businesses and her children completing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Epi

texts.en: Epi M., 28, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Chip/Plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 6 days per week. She has had 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD). SPBD loans are Epi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for plantation and tank of oil, oven, plastic papers, and sacks of salt for chip business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Delfina es soltera, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Delfina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que vende de casa en casa.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, queso.
Delfina sueña con educar a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Alborada community bank. Delfina, 50, is single and has 3 children. Delfina travels to the different regional fairs where they sell groceries. She buys cereal and cheese, and she sells them door to door. Delfina needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy rice and cheese. Delfina’s dream is to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and cheese

loans.name: Nancy Lucila

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Nancy tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
Los sueños de Nancy es tener una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Alborada community bank. Nancy, 24, is in a common law marriage and has a son. Nancy has a stall at the 12 de Mayo market. She sells clothes every day. She gets the clothes in Lima. Nancy needs a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy pants. Nancy’s dreams are to have a clothing store and for her children to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants

loans.name: Juana Leonor

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Juana es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, gas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de una persona.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, leche, azúcar.
Juana sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Alborada community bank. Juana, 40, is married and has 4 children. Juana has a grocery store; she sells meat, vegetables and gas. She works every day and has one helper. Juana needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy rice, milk and sugar. Juana’s dream is for her children to become professionals and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa es madre soltera, tiene 46 años y vive en su propia casa junto a sus 4 hijos; Glenda de 22, Paola de 19, Anais de 18 y Diego de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos y sacrificios. Santusa tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, vende de todo, pero su principal fuente de ingresos son por la venta de menestras, su puesto es uno de los más concurridos del mercado, ya que las menestras que vende son muy deliciosas, además que las ofrece a un precio muy accesible. Lo más difícil para Santusa es permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta tratando de contrarrestar el intenso frió que hace dentro del mercado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, esto hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Santusa espera mejorar su negocio e implementarlo mejor para brindarles una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, al igual como lo hizo en su primer crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre está preocupada por el bienestar del resto de sus compañeras. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Santusa is a single mother. She is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her four children: Glenda (22 years old), Paola (19), Anais (18), and Diego (11). Her children are the driving force behind all her efforts and sacrifices. Santusa has a stall in the Santa Bárbara market in the city of Juliaca. She sells all sorts of things, but her main source of income is from selling a variety of vegetables. Her stall is one of the busiest ones in the market, since the vegetables she sells are very delicious and offered at a very affordable price. The hardest thing for Santusa is to stay in her stall all day, trying to stave off the intense frio there inside. She's been working at this for 10 years, and what she likes most is talking to her customers, which makes her long workdays more enjoyable. Santusa hopes to improve her business and be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products, and increase her income. This is her second loan with MFP, and she plans to make all her payments on time, as she did with her first loan. She is very beloved among the members of her community bank, since she's always concerned abut her partners' wellbeing. She plans to use the money requested to increase the quantity of merchandise available at her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth de 27 años es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la apoyaron para que pueda sobresalir en la vida, tiene una hija de 4 años, a quien desea darle buenos estudios. Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, Yaneth está sentada en su puesto, vende quesos en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus clientes la buscan porque es una vendedora muy carismática y siempre les brinda una sonrisa cuando compra uno de sus deliciosos quesos, aunque es algo tímida, ya que no pudimos lograr que nos brinde una sonrisa para la foto. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, desea hacer progresar su negocio e implementar mejor su puesto. Lo que menos le gusta es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace dentro del mercado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacer todo lo que esté a su alcance para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer préstamo de Yaneth con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, por la alegría que brinda. Con el dinero que está solicitando planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para así poder implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 27 years old, is a cheerful young woman. She lives in her parents' house, and they have always supported her so she could be successful in life. She has a four-year-old daughter, and hopes to be able to give her a good eduction. From the wee hours of the morning, Yaneth sits at her stall in the Santa Bárbara market in Juliaca, selling cheeses. Her customers seek her out because she is a charismatic saleswoman and always offers them a small when they buy one of her delicious cheeses. She is somewhat shy, though, and we couldn't get her to smile for a photo. She's been working in the market 15 years, and what she likes best about her job is chatting with the women at the neighboring stalls. She wants to develop her business and better supply her stall. What she likes least is withstanding the intense cold inside the market, but she is nevertheless aware that she has to do anything she can to improve her quality of life. This is Yaneth's first loan with MFP, and she hopes to make all her payments on time, since she doesn't want to hurt the other members of her community bank, where she is cherished for the happiness she brings. She will use the requested loan to increase her working capital and be able to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene cuenta con 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una hija, ella vive y estudia en la ciudad, Irene y su esposo se quedaron en su tierra natal por ser agricultores. Su esposo labora en sus tierras de cultivo, mientras ella prepara los almuerzos, y enseguida acude a la chacra para compartir los trabajos agrícolas. Por el trabajo sacrificado del campo planificaron tener sólo una hija, y con las ganancias de esta labor la educaron, ahora es una cosmetóloga muy reconocida en la ciudad de Tarma. Ya solos, no tienen muchos gastos, entonces siembran en cantidades menores a comparación de los años pasados, están sembrando papa y alverjas. Adicionalmente a esto, Irene se dedica al hilado de lana de carnero y teje en el telar de uno de sus vecinos mantas y frazadas, especialmente para cubrirse de la lluvia y el frío, muchos de sus paisanos le hacen pedidos de hilado o le compran sus mantas, con esto obtiene ingresos extras, sintiéndose muy feliz porque le gusta lo que hace. Este es 4to crédito con MFP, es la presidenta de su banco comunal, y durante su permanencia ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable con sus pagos y con el cargo que desempeña. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para abonar a sus chacras de papa, el resto lo derivará para adquirir lana de pellejo de carnero y anilinas para teñir las lanas y matizar de diversos colores.
texts.en:
Irene is 46 years old. She lives with her husband, with whom she's had one daughter. Their daughter lives and studies in the city, while Irene and her husband stayed in the region where they were born, in order to work as farmers. Her husband works out in the fields, while she prepares lunches and goes to the farms to share them with the laborers. Because of how difficult it is to work the fields, they planned to have only one daughter, and with their earnings they gave her an education. She is now a well-known cosmetologist in the city of Tarma. Her parents, now by themselves, have few expenses, so they don't sow as much seed as in previous years. They cultivate potatoes and peas. In addition, Irene spins lambswool and uses a neighbor's loom to weave blankets and ponchos to guard against rain and cold. Many people in the area order yarn from her or buy her ponchos, so she has some extra income and is very happy because she enjoys what she does. This is her fourth loan from MFP. She is the president of her community bank, and during her term has proven to be very responsible with her payments and with the responsibilities she has. The money requested is for the purchase of fertilizer for her potato fields, and the rest will be used to acquire lambswool and dyes for the wool, to produce many colors.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lambswool and fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos ya no viven en su casa. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales como vacunos y ovinos, asimismo aprendió a elaborar queso, actividad heredada de su madre. Cada viernes a las 6.00am sale a comprar leche, ya que sus vacas no abastecen para la cantidad de pedidos que tiene y los quesos que elabora son a base de leche de corderito, y son muy solicitados ya que tienen un sabor muy natural e inconfundible. Una vez con los ingredientes básicos procede a colocarlos en lo horma de ichu que nos muestra en la foto, para que siga su proceso de prensado, luego los guarda en cubetas para que escurra el suero, y cada domingo los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad. Gracias a este negocio pudo educar a sus hijos, sin contar con el apoyo del padre. Victoria es una cliente muy responsable, las veces que tiene que llevar los quesos no puede asistir a las reuniones, pero deja su cuota encargada con sus vecinas o familiares para que paguen la cantidad fijada. Este es su 4to crédito con MFP, y durante este tiempo no ha caído en  morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de avena en chacras sembradas y plantas de maíz, esto le sirve para el alimento de sus vacas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and has 8 children, 3 of which no longer live at home. From the time she was a little girl, she has raised animals like cows and sheep, and her mother also taught her to make cheese. Every Friday at 6 a.m. she goes to buy milk, since her cows don't produce enough for the number of orders she receives. She makes her cheeses from cow's milk, and they have a very natural and unmistakable flavor. Once she has the basic ingredients, she places them in a mold made of ichu (a grass native to the Andean altiplano), which she's displaying in the photo, so the cheese can be pressed. Then she puts them on trays so the whey can drain off. She sells them every Sunday in her town's market. Thanks to this business, she's been able to educate her children without any support from their father. Victoria is a very responsible client. When she has to transport the cheeses she can't attend meetings, but she leaves her payments with her neighbors or family members so they can pay them for her. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she hasn't fallen into despair. The money requested will be used to buy oats and corn to feed her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her cows

loans.name: Breny

texts.es: Breny tiene 35 años y es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. Para su negocio de vender zapatos es una distracción, más que un trabajo, desde muy niña siempre le gustaron los zapatos y ahora que trabaja con ellos se siente muy feliz, es una vendedora muy alegre y conversadora, siempre está viendo la mejor manera de vender su mercadería y agotar su stock. Breny disfruta de aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los zapatos que están de moda o los que mejor combinarán con su ropa. Lleva 18 años en este negocio y espera tener una tienda más grande donde también pueda vender ropa, lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer dentro de su puesto todo el día sin poder salir a la calle para realizar sus actividades. Este es el primer préstamo de Breny con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy alegre. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más zapatos para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Breny is 35 years old, and a very happy, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her two children, and longs to be successful. Her work selling shoes is a hobby as much as it is a job. Ever since she was a little girl she's loved shoes, and now that she's working with them she's very happy. She's a cheerful, talkative saleswoman, and she's always looking for the best way to sell her merchandise and deplete her stock. She enjoys advising her customers on what shoes are in fashion or which go best with their outfits. She's been working in the business 18 years and hopes to have a larger store where she can also sell clothing. What she likes least is having to stay inside all day without being able to go out to take care of other things. This is Breny's first loan with MFP, and she knows she has to make her payments on time and is prepared to do so, since she wants to receive other loans in the future. She's very happy with her community bank. She will use the requested loan to buy more shoes and better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es: Ludith es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 55 años y vive en su propia casa, es soltera y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. A lo largo de su vida ha tenido muchos trabajos, los cuales le han permitido sostenerse y tener un vida tranquila, actualmente aprovechando el gran patio que tiene en su casa, ha puesto una cochera donde sus vecinos guardan sus carros, este negocio le es muy rentable debido a que la mayoría de sus vecinos prefieren guardar sus autos con ella, por la confianza que le tienen. Lleva 8 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es que al mismo tiempo que cuida su negocio puede realizar sus tareas domésticas, ahorrándole tiempo para hacer otras actividades; pero lo que más le disgusta es que a veces tiene que levantarse en la madrugada para atender a las personas que desean utilizar su cochera. Ludith espera tener más adelante una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le brinde otros ingresos económicos y mejore su situación. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a sus compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con el dinero que solicita planea arreglar su cochera para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ludith is a very hardworking woman. She is 55 years old and lives in her own home. She's single, and what she most desires is to have a quiet old age. Throughout her life she's had many jobs, which have allowed her to support herself and live well. Currently, taking advantage of a large patio in her house, she has installed a carport where her neighbors store their vehicles. This is a very profitable business since most of her neighbors prefer to store their cars with her because they trust her. She's been doing this for 8 years, and what she likes most is that while she takes care of her business, at the same time she can do her housework, saving her time for doing other activities. What she likes least is getting up at dawn to attend to people who want to use the carport. Ludith hopes in the future have a grocery store, which would provide more income and improve her situation. This is her first loan with MFP, and she plans to make her payments on time so as not to cause her partners in her community bank any trouble. She is very respected by the other members because she helps organize the group. With the requested loan she plans to repair the carport in order to offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her carport

loans.name: Salud Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Salud (“Health”) Village Bank is a well-established group that has completed seven previous loan cycles with Asociacion Arariwa. The twenty group members all live in the city of Cusco and dedicate themselves to a variety of different businesses.

Fernando P. G. is 33 years old and single. He works independently as a systems engineer and works for the international NGO Worldvision, the SIS computing company, and the Hotel San Agustin. His three employers keep him pretty busy as he usually has jobs all through the week. He has been in this line of work for the past six or seven years. Fernando is requesting a loan of $150 to install ceramic tiles on the staircase of his house. He will hire someone to do the job, which will cost 1000 soles in total (US$300); he will pay for the rest of the job out of his salary. This is Fernando’s first loan cycle with the Salud Village Bank.

Four of the group members work at a local nursery school run by PRONOEI, a government institution that provides daycare/nursery schooling to children between the ages of 3 and 5 from low-income families. The women are paid very little (one of the women refers to her salary as “a tip”), so they all have side businesses to generate more income. They each earn 300 soles per month (US $95). Hermila V. V. and Maria Elena P. C. both sell stuffed animals at a Saturday market in the Santiago neighborhood of Cusco; each says that on a good day she earns as much as 250 soles in profits. Filomena C. M. works at the same market selling second hand clothing. She travels to Puno once a week to buy the clothing, and says she earns as much as 300 soles on a good weekend. These three women will invest their Kiva loans in purchasing more merchandise for their respective businesses at the Baratillo market.

Sonia P. H. is 47 years old and married. She has one son who is 15; she also lost a child to medical negligence. She runs a small business with her husband selling communications devices to municipal offices in small towns in the countryside around Cusco. These devices generate radio and television signals. She handles the administrative end of this while her husband is in charge of the technical part.

The couple has been in this business for the past 18 years, so they are well known in the area and use word of mouth to advertise their services. Most of the equipment has to be special ordered from Lima or Arequipa, says Sonia, though some of the smaller parts can be found and assembled in Cusco. The couple works alone most of the time, though they occasionally hire someone to work on transmission towers. Sonia will use her loan of $700 to buy part of a larger piece of equipment. $700 is enough to buy the cables and connectors, she says; the entire piece of equipment will cost about $1500. Sonia’s goal for the future is to expand her business from a micro-enterprise to a larger company.

The group is requesting a total of $4,400. The members have all pledged to repay their Kiva loans in full and on time.

loans.use: Install ceramic tiles, buy stuffed animals, used clothing, cables and connectors for satellite

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili I., 52, is married with six children. She has four years of experience in crop planting. She sells to the village people and the public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

Because she was never able to qualify for a loan through the traditional banks, SPBD loans are Faafili’s only access to capital. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She needs the loan to buy equipment and chemicals for her business as well as to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy equipment and chemicals for her business as well as to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en:
Vineta V. F., 51, is married with six children. She has four years of experience in the sewing business and sells to the village people and the public six days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).

SPBD loans are Vineta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She needs the loan to buy another sewing machine and more fabric for puletasi and kids' clothes.

loans.use: Purchase to buy material and another sewing machine, and to continue her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace más de 30 años, proviene de una familia agrícola que le enseñó estas actividades. Cada día se levanta temprano para atender a sus animales y de esta manera mantenerlos saludables, después de un tiempo los vende a vender, o sino ella mismas los sacrifica para vender su carne, que es aun más rentable. Esta labor la realiza con ayuda de sus hijos, pues es muy agotadora. Dora desea continuar con este trabajo para seguir sosteniendo las necesidades de sus hijos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha notado logros positivos en su vida a lo largo de este periodo trabajando en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganando y el pago para desparasitar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Dora is 41 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She's been raising animals for more than 30 years, since she comes from a farming family that taught her the trade. Every day she gets up early to take care of her animals and keep them healthy. After a while she sells them, or slaughters them and sells their meat, which is even more profitable. Her children help her with the slaughtering, since it's quite exhausting. Dora hopes to continue this work in order to continue to provide for her children's needs. This is her second loan from MFP, and she's noticed positive developments in her life during the time she's been working with her community bank. She will use the requested loan to buy feed for her livestock and to treat her animals for parasites.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and care for her animals

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es: Fiorella tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 6 meses vende verduras, la idea de implementar este negocio se la dio una de sus tías, para que ella pueda generar más ingresos ante sus necesidades económicas. Cada día trabaja de preferencia en las mañanas porque en este horario tiene más clientes y por las tardes  se dedica enteramente a la atención de sus pequeños hijos. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que sólo  ocupa medio tiempo y le permite atender los asuntos de su casa, además tiene buenas ganancias, con las que poco a poco se ha propuesto hacer crecer su negocio hasta que sea más solvente. Es la segunda vez que Fiorella tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por lo que ha logrado, ya que en su banco comunal aprende muchas cosas. Fiorella va a comprar más mercadería, consistente en varios sacos de papa, zanahoria y otras verduras.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 21 years old, lives with her husband and her 2 children in a rented home. She has sold vegetables for 6 months. One of her aunts gave her the idea to start this business so that she could generate more income to address her financial needs. Each day she prefers to work in the mornings because on this schedule she has more clients. During the afternoons, she dedicates herself entirely to caring for her young children. What’s good about her work is that it only takes half the day, and it allows her to attend to household matters. Additionally, she has good earnings with which, little by little, she has proposed to grow her business until it is more solvent. This is the second time that Fiorella has requested a loan with MFP. She is very grateful for what she has achieved, given that she learns many things in her community bank. Fiorella is going to buy more merchandise, consisting of various sacks of potatoes, carrots and other vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es: Janeth tiene 25 años, vive en casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de vaca con papas) y otras comidas en una esquina cerca de su casa. Cada día trabaja todas las tardes, sin ayuda de nadie, sin embargo ver crecer su negocio la llena de satisfacción, ya que antes vendía al aire libre, y ahora dispone de una carpa donde puede atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Con esta innovación que ella misma ha implementado ha notado que la clientela ha aumentado y eso le da más ánimos para continuar. El gran anhelo de Janeth es tener un local estable para su negocio. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, por ello que se siente bien porque paga del producto de su arduo trabajo. Janeth esta solicitando este dinero para la compra de carbón al por mayor, ya que es básico en su negocio. También adquirirá sacos de arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and lives in her mother-in-law’s home with her husband and their 2 children. She sells kebabs (skewers of cow’s heart with potatoes”) and other foods on a corner near her house. Each day, she works every afternoon without anyone’s help. However, seeing her business grow fills her with satisfaction. Before, she sold in the open air, and now she has a tent where she can tend to her clients with more comfort. With this innovation, which Janeth herself implemented, she has noticed that her clientele has expanded, and this gives her more energy to continue. Janeth’s great desire is to have an established locale for her business. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP. She is very punctual in [paying] her installments. For this reason, she feels good because she pays with the product of her hard work. Janeth is asking for this money to buy charcoal, which is necessary for her business. She will also purchase sacks of rice, sugar and vegetable stew.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal for her grill

loans.name: Leonidas Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 43 años, vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace uno año vende pescado en un triciclo y una carpa para cubrirse, siempre quiso aventurarse por tener un ingresos propios, así decidió implementar este negocio, que en la actualidad es el motor de la economía familiar. Todas las mañanas compra su pescado fresco en el mercado de su zona. Que su producto esté fresco es el sello de garantía de sus ventas, además de la calidad y peso exacto que ofrece, ha podido adquirir clientes regulares, por lo que sus ventas son estables. Es la  segunda vez que Margarita está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, está muy decidida a seguir progresando y ha notado que su banco comunal está siendo un espacio desarrollo personal y empresarial. El dinero requerido lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, además de cuchillos nuevos para poder cortar mejor la carne de pescado.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children in their own house. For the past year, she has sold fish on a tricycle and a tent to cover her. She always wanted to challenge herself to have her own income, so she decided to start this business, which is currently the motor of the family economy. Every morning, she buys her fresh fish at the market in her neighborhood. The freshness of her product is the guarantee of her sales. In addition to the quality and exact weight that she offers, she has been able to acquire regular clients, so that her sales are stable. This is the second time that Margarita has asked for a loan through MFP. She is very determined to continue progressing and has noticed that her community bank is a space for personal and business development. She will invest the requested money in the purchase of more merchandise, in addition to new knives to be able to better cut the meat of the fish.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Toàn Nguyễn is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two adult children. To making a living, Toàn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Toàn has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Toàn joined Kiva's partner TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Toàn has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Toàn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Lừng Nguyễn, 46, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lừng works in a family member's business venture, running a general store in the retail sector. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lừng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2004, Lừng joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services, so that she can improve her living conditions and her ability to continue to engage in business activities. Lừng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Lừng is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this TYM Fund borrower. Lừng plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her grocery store business.

loans.name: Sinatala

texts.en: Sinatala O., 23, is married and has one child. She has five years of experience in the elei and printing business. She sells to the village people and the public five days per week. SPBD loans are Sinatala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her fifth SPBD loan. She wants to buy elei board, painting brushes, and paint for her business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). The loan is to be used for buying tools and equipment as well as for home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase elei board, painting brushes, and paint for her business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Tân Phan, 57, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, T. works in a family member's business venture running a general store in the retail sector. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Tân has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2004, Tân joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tân has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Tân is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this TYM Fund borrower. Tân plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Hồng Phạm (1432071501) is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, Hồng operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Hồng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $140) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hồng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Hồng is now requesting a second loan of 7,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy breeding livestock

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Tằn hoàng (1432050959) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has 5 adult children. To making a living, Tằn operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Tằn has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $224) a month from these activities.

In 2005, Tằn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tằn has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Tằn is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Tằn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Raw materials for manufacturing wood products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy C. is 48 years old and lives in Purok Bonifacio, Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is a micro-entrepreneur and a new member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC – Ozamiz Branch. She is married and blessed with 3 sons and 1 daughter. Her husband is a driver and at the same time does some carpentry work. She decided to engage in business to provide support for their daily needs. She has an existing Sari-sari store that has been located in their house since 2000.

For the past 9 years, her business has been getting better and better. She is hoping that someday she can build a stall for her Sari-sari store and be able to send her children to school for a better future. She is applying for a loan of 5,000.00 Philippine Pesos as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store

loans.name: Lam Thi

texts.en:
H. Lâm is a 37 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, H. raises livestock.
