He travels through all the streets of his town, offering this service to anyone who requests it. He gets up early in order to gain more clients. This way he obtains the income necessary to cover the expenses for his youngest son’s education. Leoncio is very devoted to the functionality of his vehicle, on which his work depends. Currently, there is a lot of demand for this service, and although the number of “motocarros” in his area has increased, he continues to work, confident in his ability to beat the competition. For the future, Leoncio is thinking of a acquiring another vehicle of the same type that he can rent to another driver and increase his earnings. This is the first time that he has had a loan with MFP. He was invited to be a part of its current team because they knew of him and he had good references. For his part, Leoncio promises to be a partner and to positively support his community bank. The money that he is requesting is to buy a new cover for his vehicle and to pay for the maintenance of his “moto”.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle and to buy a new cover

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su madre. Se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas desde hace 2 años, pero hace un año consiguió la oportunidad de trabajar en el cafetín escolar de un colegio de su localidad, donde no sólo vende golosinas, sino también gaseosas y comida para los maestros. Paola atiende todo el día de lunes a viernes y cada día está más entusiasmada de continuar con este trabajo para solventar las necesidades de su familia. En ocasiones su madre la apoya y distribuye parte de su tiempo en la atención de sus hijos mientras Paola no está, para más adelante quiere progresar en su negocio incrementando los productos que vende y las porciones de comida que ofrece. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque a pesar de los problemas que ha tenido su grupo, han sabido sobrellevarlos y seguir adelante. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de vidrios para su nueva vitrina de exhibición, además de incrementar la cantidad de golosinas que vende.
texts.en:
Paola is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her 2 children in her mother’s house. She has sold sweets and candies for 2 years, but 1 year ago she obtained the opportunity to work in the high school cafeteria of her town, where she not only sells sweets, but also sodas and food for the teachers. Paola works all day Monday through Friday, and each day, she is more enthusiastic about continuing this work to cover her family’s expenses. On occasion, her mother helps her and spends part of her time caring for the children when Paola isn’t there. In the future, Paola would like to improve her business, increasing the number of products that she sells and the portions of food that she offers. This is the second time the she has had a loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a part of her community bank because, in spite of the problems that her groups has had, they have known how to overcome them and to move forward. The money that she is requesting is to buy the glass for her new showcase, in addition to increasing the quantity of sweets that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy glass for her new showcase

loans.name: Roland

texts.es: Roland tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres. Se dedica al alquiler de equipos de sonido para eventos sociales y musicales, esto lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años de manera independiente. Todos los días atiende su  establecimiento donde siempre alquila pidiendo como garantía el documento de identidad del contratante. Sus  equipos son constantemente revisados y los mantiene en perfecto estado para brindar un buen servicio. Roland está siempre alerta ante las nuevas innovaciones que puedan salir en equipos y aunque muchas veces los precios son altos, se esfuerza para ahorrar de sus ganancias hasta adquirir ese nuevo equipo. Para más adelante está pensando en mejorar su local para que tenga una mejor apariencia. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los más jóvenes integrantes de su banco comunal, quien transmite buena energía para hacer bien las cosas y se siente muy a gusto de ser parte de ese equipo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de nuevos parlantes valorizados en 1500 soles, lo que falta del monto del préstamo, él pondrá de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Roland is 26 years old, is single and lives with his parents. He rents out sound equipment for social events and concerts. He has been doing this independently for 3 years. Everyday he runs his shop where he always rents while asking for identification from the contracting party. His equipment are constantly checked and he keeps them in perfect condition, in order to offer good service. Roland is always aware of new innovations in equipment and often the prices are high. He is working to save the earnings to acquire this new equipment. For the future, he is thinking of improving his location, in order to have a better appearance. It's the second time that he has had a loan with MFP. He is one of the youngest involved in his community bank. He transmits good energy to do good things, and feels enthusiastic to be part of the team. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of new speakers for 1500 soles, which he lacks and is the total of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new speakers

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 46 años, vive con sus hijas mayores. Hace 5 años que se dedica a vender dulces y frutas en una esquina cerca de su casa, debido a no contar con un puesto fijo ha estado rotando constantemente su lugar de ventas. Pero ahora se ha instalado en un lugar cercano a un centro educativo, donde sus principales clientes son los escolares, y las personas que transitan por esa calle. Gracias a la constancia, y ha saber administrar sus ganancias, en la actualidad maneja el dinero suficiente para sostener sus gastos. Además es el apoyo de sus hijas en sus necesidades económicas, para un futuro próximo está planeando implementar su negocio con otros productos y poder tener un lugar fijo para su negocio. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y esto le permite ser emprendedora para su desarrollo personal y el de los demás integrantes.  El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de frutas, gaseosas y dulces, con esto aumentará su capital y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabina is 46 years old and lives with her grown daughters. For 5 years she has been selling sweets and fruits in a corner near her house. Since she doesn't have a permanent place, she has moved where she does her sales. Now, however, she has settled in a place near an education center, where her main customers are the students and the people who are walking down the street. Thanks to her steadfastness, and her knowledge of administrating earnings, now she handles money well enough to support her expenses. Moreover, this is possible from the support of her daughters in her economic needs. In the future she plans to implement other products in her business and have a permanent place for the business. This is her second loan with MFP. She is one of the most active members in her community bank and this allows her to be enterprising in her own development and that of others. The money of the requested loan is to buy fruits, sodas and sweets, with this she will increase her capital and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing of inventory

loans.name: Yimmy

texts.es: Yimmy tiene 24 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. Desde hace un año se dedica a ser transportista con su motocarro, el cubre la ruta interna de su localidad a precios módicos, de esa manera el trabaja todos los días durante todo el día, dándose tiempo sólo para almorzar. Para Yimmy, recorrer las calles es toda una aventura, ya que disfruta del trabajo que realiza y a menudo tiene la oportunidad de entablar amistades con sus clientes. Él ha notado que durante este tiempo de trabajo sus ganancias son estables, pero para más adelante quiere tener un auto para ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Es la primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a formar parte de su actual banco comunal porque han visto en él, cualidades de un joven emprendedor.  Con el dinero que requerido invertirá en la reparación de su motocarro y compra de llantas nuevas para el mismo.
texts.en:
Yimmy is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. For a year he has been operating motorbike transport, doing a route in his area for modest prices. He works everyday and all day, taking time off just for lunch. For Yimmy, to travel the streets is always an adventure, because of this he enjoys his work. He also has opportunities to be friends with his customers. He has said that, for now, his earnings have been stable, but, in the future, he wants to have a car to offer a taxi service. This is the first time that he is asking for a loan with MFP, he was invited to be a part of his community bank because we have seen good qualities of a young entrepreneur in him. With this money he will invest in repair and buy new tires for his motorbike.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparación y compra de llantas para su motacarro

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is married with 3 children. She works as a trader in Siwdo, selling cooked rice. Abena is an experienced business woman and has been involved in her trade since 1997. While Abena is selling her goods, her husband works as a driver in the surrounding areas. She uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses, primarily that of food.

Abena will use the loan to purchase additional rice which she will cook and then sell. With her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest the profits back into her enterprise in order to further her success.

loans.use: To purchase rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es una joven que desea salir adelante, tiene 26 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares. Desde que tenía 15 años decidió trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, actualmente trabaja para una empresa de transportes, ella es la encargada de vender los boletos a los usuarios de la empresa. Es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre les saca una sonrisa a las personas que adquieren un boleto. Luisa disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre donde irán más cómodos en el viaje, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y anhela poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para que sus padres la puedan administrar, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que la mayoría de veces se tiene que amanecer vendiendo los pasajes, ya que la empresa brinda servicio las 24 horas del día. Este es el tercer préstamo de Luisa con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas y solidarias. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar sus ahorros para poder instalar la tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a young woman who wants to move forward in life. She is 26 years old and lives in her parents' house, who she wants to help with the family expenses. Since she was 15 years old she has worked to help her parents with expenses of the home, right now she works in transportation. She sells tickets to the customers of the business. She is a very friendly salesperson and always has a smile for the customers. Luisa enjoys having conversations with her customers and helps them have a comfortable trip. She has done this for 2 years and longs to have a grocery store in her house that her parents can manage. What she likes least about her job is that most of the time she has to arrive at the break of day to help customers, because the business runs 24 hours. This is Luisa's 3rd loan with MFP, she has always been very punctual with her payments and hopes to do so now as well. In her community bank she is one of the most active and independent members. With this money she plans to increase her savings in order to be able to start a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds for starting a store

loans.name: Maisa

texts.es: Maisa tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la ayudaron para salir adelante. Aunque es muy joven, se siente en la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, tiene actualmente un restaurante en la casa de ellos, el cual ella misma atiende y administra, su establecimiento es uno de los más concurridos de su barrio, puesto que tiene una muy buena sazón. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, pero le es muy difícil atender ella sola a todos sus clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro su restaurante pueda crecer más y le genere mejores ingresos, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el tercer préstamo de Maisa con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos espera pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se lleguen en las reuniones. Con el dinero solicitado planea mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante y comprar más ingredientes para cocinar.
texts.en:
Maisa is 23 years old, is a hardworking young woman and lives with her parents, who always help her to move forward. Even though she is very young, she feels responsible in helping her parents with family expenses. She has a restaurant in their house, which is managed and run by Maisa herself. Her restaurant is one of the busiest in her neighborhood because she has very good seasonings. What she likes most about her job is cooking, but it is very difficult to attend to her customers on her own. She has been doing this for 3 years and she hopes that, in the future, her restaurant can grow more and generate greater earnings. She knows that to reach her goals she must work a lot and she is ready to do so. This is Maisa's third loan with MFP. Like her first loans, she hopes to pay this loan back on time. With the requested money she plans to improve the environment of her restaurant and buy more ingredients for cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving the environment of her restaurant and buying supplies

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 59 años, vive solo, ya que está separado de su pareja con la cual tuvo a tres hijos; Martha de 32, Robert de 28 y Mario de 26, los cuales ya tiene una vida independientemente. Desde hace más de 32 años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo, ya que este negocio le da tranquilidad y estabilidad, y gracias a él se mantiene ocupado. Lorenzo vende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde en el mercado, que es donde tiene su puesto, gustándole mucho su trabajo. La carne de pollo tiene que venderse en un tiempo corto porque no siempre se mantiene fresca y este es su principal problema, ya que tiene que vender su mercadería en el tiempo estipulado, pero felizmente las ventas son buenas y casi nunca tiene estos problemas, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Además tiene una sobrina que lo ayuda esporádicamente, haciéndole más fácil el trabajo. Lorenzo se encuentra en el segundo préstamo con MFP, y es el único varón de su grupo, siendo muy respetado y querido por su puntualidad y apoyo. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra una congeladora con exhibidor, donde pondrá la carne de pollo para su mejor conservación, ya que en la refrigeradora que él tiene no puede mostrar su producto para atraer a más clientela.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 59 years old, lives alone and is separeated from his wife, with whom he has 3 children: Martha, 32, Robert, 28 and Mario, 26. They all have independent lives. For more than 32 years he has been selling chicken (meat). This has been very stable and tranquil, and, thanks to him, it keeps on going. He works from 8 in the morning to 5 or 6 in the afternoon in the market, where his stand is, thanks to his work. He sells the chicken in a short time, but it doesn't always keep its freshness. This is his worst problem. He must sell in the market with the given time, and happily he seldom has these problems and earns good profits. He has a neice who sometimes helps him, which makes the work easier. This is Lorenzo's second loan with MFP. He is the only man in the group and is very respected and liked for his punctuality and support. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of a freezer with a window where he can put the meat to improve conservation. The refrigerator that he has can't display his product in order to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una congeladora

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice there is a gift," this is what Rebecca believes. Every day she is very optimistic that she can receive a gift through her business. Rebecca is 51 years old and married to Euligio. They live in San J., Quirino, Isabela and they are blessed with three children: Albert, 40 years old; Jenny, 38 years old, who is working in Malaysia as a domestic helper; and Janward, 25 years old. The family works hard for the fulfillment of their dreams in life despite their age.

Rebecca is a vendor in their village. She sells different merchandise in order to earn a living. Some of her products include: vegetables, fish sauce, goto (congee), and halo-halo during summer in her little stall located near their house.

She would like to request a loan amount of 7,000 Philippine Pesos to be used as additional working capital for her business. She was always busy with her venture to earn a living. She wished that somehow, someday, they can uplift their poor living condition so that her children and future families will not suffer so much from life's difficulties.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana tiene 69 años, está casada con Aparicio, quien se dedica a la carpintería. Tuvieron 5 hijos; Irma (39), Jaime (48), Iris (44), Maribel (42), Ever (40) decidieron formar sus propias familias y salir del seno familiar, quedando solos Maximiliana y su esposo, quienes hoy en día viven con una de sus sobrinas, apoyándola para que estudie y se convierta en una buena profesional. Desde hace 40 años Maximiliano se dedica a la venta de comida en el restaurante que posee, incursionó en este negocio gracias a sus grandes dotes en la cocina que siempre le gustó y que la llevo a mantenerse hasta hoy en día en este trabajoso negocio, ya que aunque no parezca, es muy sacrificado, ella debe levantarse a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los desayunos que ofrecerá a sus clientes hasta aproximadamente las 9 de la mañana, de ahí empieza a preparar los platillos que serán el deleite de sus clientes a la hora de almuerzo, esto hasta las 2 de la tarde tomando un pequeño descanso, para que a las 5pm vuelva a preparar nuevos platillos para la cena, y esto todos los días. Felizmente “Doña Maxi” como la llaman sus comensales más asiduos, cuenta con dos señoras que la ayudan en la cocina y atención de la clientela, (en la foto la acompañan en ambos costados) pues sin ellas no podría darse abasto para la atención de la concurrida clientela. El negocio es rentable y ella espera lograr expandirlo muy pronto, además quiere comprar una congeladora nueva para mantener más frescos sus alimentos. Maxi es una clienta antigua en MFP, pero por motivos de salud dejó de sacar préstamos en esta institución, volviendo después de un buen tiempo. Y ahora que está mejor de salud este crédito le permite tener una mejor estabilidad, además le gusta mucho su banco comunal, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy amables y alegres. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una considerable cantidad de víveres para la preparación de sus platillos; como fideos, arroz y papas.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 69 years old, married to Aparicio, who is a carpenter. They have 5 children: Irma (39), Jaime (48), Iris (44), Maribel (42), and Ever (40). They have formed their own families and don't live in at home. Left alone, Maximiliana and her husband now live with one of their neices. They support her while she studies and becomes a good professional. For 40 years Maximiliana has sold food in her restaurant. She started this business thanks to her ability in the kitchen that is always loved. This has allowed her to have a good business to this day. However, it is tolling. She wakes up at 5am to prepare breakfast for her customers until about 9am. Then she starts to make the lunch plates. At 2pm she has a small break. At 5 she makes dinner plates. This happens everyday. Happily, "Lady Maxi," as she is called, has two women to help her in the kitchen and with serving customers (they are in the photo with her.) Howver, they can't cope with giving service to so many customers when the restaurant is busy. The business is profitable and she hopes to expand it soon, but she needs to buy a new freezer to keep everything fresh. Maxi is an old client of MFP, for health reasons she stopped taking out loans with this institution, but she is now returning after awhile. Now that her health is better, this loan will help her have better stability, and she likes this bank a lot because everyone is nice and happy. With the requested money she hopes she will buy a considerable amount of supplies, such as noodles, rice and potatoes, for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making food

loans.name: Willy

texts.es: Willy es un joven muy empeñoso que trata de salir adelante día a día para buscarse un mejor porvenir, vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, comenzó trabajando en diferentes oficios, aunque conducir siempre le gustó mucho, aprendiendo desde joven con carros prestados de familiares y amigos. Es así que hoy en día se dedica a lo que más le gusta, él sigue diferentes rutas, según los clientes lo soliciten, todo el día “se pasa de paseo” como él mismo dice, empezando su labor desde las 7 de la mañana, hora en la que la mayoría de las personas salen a sus trabajos, requiriendo de sus servicios, y termina hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche. La ventaja de su trabajo es que le permite decidir cuándo salir a trabajar, siendo su propio jefe, pero Willy siempre ha sido muy estricto con sus horarios porque sabe que sólo así obtendrá buenas ganancias. Él quiere prosperar, y en el futuro tener una empresa de taxis, pero para esto se requiere mucha dedicación es por eso que necesita trabajar mucho. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y promete ser muy  puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a hacerle un mantenimiento a su auto, para que esté en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Willy is a very hard-working young man who is trying to get ahead in search of a better future. He has held odd jobs in different offices, but he has always liked driving, which he learned to do from a young age with cars borrowed from family members and friends. For the past 7 years, he has offered a taxi service, allowing him to make money doing what he likes most; spending the days "just driving around", as he likes to say. He starts at 7 in the morning, helping his clients get to their jobs on time, and he finishes at 8 or 9 at night. The advantage of his job is that he is his own boss, which allows him to decide when he goes to work, but he has always been very strict with his hours because he knows that's the only way to guarantee a good income. He wants to prosper, and in the future, own a taxi company--but that will require alot of dedication, which is why he needs to work hard. This is his first loan with PRISMA microfinances, and he promises to always be on time with his payments. The money that he is asking for is for the maintenance of his car so that it can be in top condition.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, or “Virgie” as she is called in their village, is engaged in hog raising. She is now 55-years old, married to Federico and they are blessed with three children. Aside from raising hogs, they are also engaged in farming as their major source of income. They plant rice, vegetables and root crops. She lives happily in the rural place of Barangay Tuao North over Bagabag Nueva Vizcaya with her family. Virgie and her husband send their children to school hoping that they will finish their studies and have good jobs someday. The couple is glad that, despite the difficulties in life they are experiencing, they have been able to support their children's studies.

Because of their desire to save for the future, Virgie was encouraged to request a loan of 20,000 PHP to maintain and improve their business. The loan will be used to buy additional piglets and feed for their hogs. She will also use some of the money for their farming needs such as buying farm tools. They hope to increase their income with this financial assistance. They are so thankful to the lenders who are willing to assist them financially.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and hog feed

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo Ricardo, el cual es policía, y sus hijos Marcia D. 12 y Ricardo D. 9 años. ElL. se dedica a L. preparación D. deliciosos platillos en su restaurante, el cual puso para mejorar L. economía D. su hogar, ya que pese a que su esposo es policía y tiene un sueldo fijo, a elL. siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y trabajar para lograr sus propios objetivos, es así que le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo. Jenny cuenta con una persona que L. ayuda en L. atención y cocina, con L. cual se da abasto para atender a L. cantidad D. clientes que frecuentan su restaurante haciéndolo muy rentable. Yenny se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos y en su banco comunal se siente muy feliz, ya que todas son muy unidas. Con el dinero que está solicitando quiere refaccionar un carro que tiene, aunque es un poco antiguo cree que con algunos arreglos quedará óptimo para ponerlo a trabajar como servicio D. trasporte, y con las ganancias hacer crecer su restaurante, haciéndolo más amplio para que pueda albergar a gran cantidad D. personas.
texts.en:
Jenny is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband Ricardo and their children Marcia (12) and Ricardo (9). She prepares delicious meals in her restaurant, which she started to improve the monetary situation of the household. Although her husband is a police officer and receives a steady salary, she has always enjoyed being independent and working to achieve her own goals, which is why she puts so much effort into her job. Jenny has one person who helps in the kitchen and with waiting tables, which is enough to attend to the number of customers which frequent the restaurant, making it very profitable. This is Jenny's 4th loan with PRISMA microfinances. She has been very punctual with her payments, and she feels very happy with her local bank since everyone there is very close. With the money that she is asking for, she is looking to fix up her car. Although it's a little old, she believes that with a few repairs it could serve very well as a taxi, and with the profits that she makes from that, she would like to grow her business, making the space larger and more open so that the restaurant has room for more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena T. is divorced with four children and operates a chop bar in Siwdo. She is an experienced businesswoman and has been in business since 1992.  Helena uses her income to pay for her family’s needs, especially school fees and bills.  She will use this loan to purchase additional ingredients which she will then use to prepare the food she sells at her chop bar.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to continue to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients used to prepare food for a chop bar

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni cuenta con 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, viven en la casa que tienen en el campo. Su ocupación es la agricultura desde que vivía con sus padres, asimismo le gusta criar animales como vacas y toros, porque las vacas le dan mucha leche que sirve para la alimentación de su  familia; y los toros son muy  útiles para el arado. Todos estos trabajos los realiza con la tutela de su esposo, una vez terminada la siembra su esposo trabaja arando las chacras de los vecinos, y con estas ganancias cubren la alimentación y los gastos del colegio de su hijo. Pero la crianza de ganando también resulta costoso, pese a que siembra avena, aun le falta alimento para sus animales que tiene que comprar, además hay que hacerlos chequear con un veterinario cada dos o tres meses para prevenir enfermedades futuras. Marleni es la tesorera de su grupo, con el cargo dice sentirse muy bien, ya que se siente muy útil. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de papas, asimismo comprará chacras de avenas ya cultivadas para la alimentación de sus toros y vacas.
texts.en:
Marleni is 29 years old, and she lives in a house in the country with her husband and the father of her 2 children. She has worked in agriculture since she lived with her parents, and she likes to raise animals such as cows and bulls, since cows produce alot of milk which helps feed her family, and bulls are very useful for plowing. She performs all this work with the guidance of her spouse, who, once planting is over, works plowing their neighbors' fields as well. With the money from this, they pay for food and the education costs of their son. However, raising cattle is expensive, even though they grow their own oats, and they don't always have money to feed the animals or to take them to the veterinarian for preventative check-ups every 2 or 3 months. Marleni is the treasurer of her group, and enjoys this position very much since she feels useful. This is her fourth loan from MFP, and she has always shown herself to be a client who repays her loans on time. The money that she is soliciting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potatoes, which she will sell in order help provide oats to her bulls and cows, both by growing her own and by buying from others.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta and her husband are helping one another sustain their rice and onion farm. Aside from farming, Marieta also helps her husband generate extra income by selling different snacks: pansit (noodles), native rice cakes, macaroni soup and other cooked foods in the public market.

Marieta and her family live in Barangay Tuao Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jerry and blessed with six children who are presently studying in high school and elementary school. They want their children to finish college so they will have a good future someday.

In preparation for the future college education of their six children, Marieta has decided to double her work time hoping that her income will increase. Following her dream, she would like to borrow 5,000 PHP that they will use for their farming needs. Marieta says they will do their best to increase their onion production. With faith and trust in the Lord, and with the help of the lenders, she will be successful in this endeavor.

loans.use: For farm supplies

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: Valentín tiene 40 años, está casado hace 18 años con la madre de sus 6 hijos. Lo encontramos camino a su chacra, sosteniendo su pico, herramienta que le sirve para trabajar en sus cultivos, a los que les tiene mucho agradecimiento, ya que cada año que ha sembrado le han producido muy buenas cosechas, convirtiéndose en una actividad muy rentable. La agricultura la desarrolla desde su infancia, su padre le enseñó a trabajar responsablemente cada uno de sus cultivos, ahora con el apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos en se siente dignificado por su trabajo. En consecuencia, a cada una de sus plantas las trata con mucho cariño y esmero hasta alcanzar su buena producción, para después cosechar y comercializar en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Valetín tiene el anhelo de comprarse una casa en la ciudad, para lograr el bienestar y tranquilidad de sus hijos y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el 4to préstamo que viene trabajando con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha sido muy responsable en cada una de sus cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para las chacras de papas que tiene en terrenos temporales.
texts.en:
Valentin is 40 years old, and he has been married since the age of 18 to the mother of his 6 children. In the picture, we see him in on the way to his plot of land, holding his pick, a tool which he uses to work in his field, to which he feels very grateful since every year that he has planted it has produced very good crops, making it a very profitable pursuit. Valentin has worked in agriculture since he was a child. His father taught him how to responsibly work with each crop, and now, with the help of his wife and children, he feels a sense of dignity from his work. As a consequence, he treats each plant with affection and care until they are ready for harvest, at which point he takes them to sell in the city of Tarma. Valentin would very much like to buy a house in the city to ensure the well-being and tranquility of his children, and in this way improve his quality of life. This will be his fourth loan from MFP, and in all this time he has been very responsible with each one of his scheduled payments. The money that he is soliciting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his potato patch.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, uno falleció y 2 ya viven independientes. Con una atenta mirada y la plena concentración teje faldas, gorras, chompas, etc. a palitos y a crochet, en esta actividad lleva toda su vida, y lo que le causa mayor placer es que le es muy rentable, y ha hecho clientes regulares. En época de cosecha apoya a su esposo con las faenas agrícolas, una vez cosechada su producción, la acumulan en su deposito y después con mayor disposición de tiempo selecciona sus productos de acuerdo al tamaño. Una vez realizado este proceso su esposo busca un carro para transportar al mercado de la ciudad, y Victoria aprovecha para llevar sus tejidos y vender en el mercado. Gracias a su habilidad textil, puede disponer de dinero para sus necesidades personales, inclusive cuando saca a pastear a sus animales va tejiendo y camino a su chacra, sigue tejiendo. Inclusive durante las reuniones de su banco comunal está ocupada con su tejido, este es su 5to crédito con MFP, donde en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con una parte del dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para que ella y su esposo abonen la hectárea de papas que acaban de sembrar; y con la otra parte comprará madejas de lana de diversos colores para la elaboración de sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old, and has 7 children, although one passed away and 2 now live independently. With an attentive gaze and full concentration she knits and crochets skirts, hats, jackets, etc. She has spent most of her life doing this, and what gives her the greatest pleasure is that it's very profitable and she has made regular clients. When it's harvest time, she helps her husband with his farm duties, and once gathered, she prepares the crops before putting them in a storehouse until they can later be sorted by size. Once this process is finished, her husband borrows a car in order to transport the merchandise to the city, and Victoria takes advantage of this opportunity to bring her textiles and sell them in the market. Thanks to her skill in her trade, she can make enough money for her personal needs. Even when she takes her animals out to graze, she's knitting. Even when she is walking to their farm, she continues knitting. Even during meetings with her local bank, she's there, busy knitting. This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she has always shown herself to be punctual with her payments. With part of the money that she's asking for, she will buy chemical fertilizers for the hectare of potatoes that she and her husband just planted, and with the other part she will buy skeins of yarn of different colors which she will use for her textiles.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool for textiles and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital for farm improvement

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hard-working mother and a faithful wife to Ernesto, an employee in a private company. They have four children: Jenelyn, Donald, Jonathan and Alwin Jay. The family is living happily in the village of Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Through their sacrifices and strong determination in life, the couple was able to send all their children to school. Three of them have already finished their college education while the youngest is still studying at the elementary level.

Elsa is engaged in farming. Aside from that, she is also managing her sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She and her husband work together in maintaining their farm for their family. She is now requesting a loan amounting to 15,000 Philippine Pesos that will support their rice and onion farming. She hopes that through this, she can increase her income to further meet the needs of their family. She also shared that “a person who perseveres for good will someday be given a reward.”

loans.use: To be used in rice and onion farming

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans A. A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Evans sells spare car parts at Siwdo near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a trader. Evans uses his income to pay for utility bills, food, school fees, etc.

Evans will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of car spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers. Evans plans to reinvest the new profits into his business to expand his trade.

loans.use: Capital for spare car parts business

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.es: Agrepina tiene  51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de animales, tiene un establo de ganado vacuno y ovino, cada día se  levanta temprano para atenderlos, cortar el pasto suficiente para su alimentación, y en la mayoría de las ocasiones los lleva a pastear a espacios abiertos con abundancia de pastizales, luego regresa para guardarlos en su establo. Principalmente cría ovejas y vacas, cada fin de semana, junto con su esposo, venden sus animales en las ferias y mercados ganaderos de su zona, y estas ganancias con las que cubren los gastos familiares. Agrepina y su esposo sueñan con tener un establo más grande, que les permita tener más animales, y están dispuestos a asumir un trabajo duro para lograrlo. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal porque es un espacio de crecimiento económico y se compromete a ser una cliente activa y puntual. El dinero que viene solicitando es para aumentar su ganado, comprará más ovejas.
texts.en:
Agrepina is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in their own house. She sells animals, and has a stable of cows and sheep. Every day she wakes up early to attend to them, to cut grass for them to eat, and usually to take them out to pasture as well before later returning them to the stable. Every weekend, she and her husband sell the animals at fairs or animal markets in the area, and these profits cover their family expenses. Agrepina and her husband dream of having a larger stable which will allow them to have more animals, and they are willing to do the work to achieve that goal. This is the first time that she has solicited a loan from MFP. She is very happy to form a part of the community bank because it is a space of economic growth, and she promises to be an active client who is regular with her payments. The money that she is requesting is for buying sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 43 años, vive con sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender ropa, repartiendo mediante visitas a sus vecinos y personas que conoce y son de confianza para darles crédito. Generalmente sale por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas está pendiente de sus hijos. Adicionalmente, hace varios meses atrás que empezó a vender leche azada, que es un postre típico de su zona y también lo vende de forma ambulante. Jaqueline se prepara para largos días de caminata, pero este esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, en las ganancias que obtiene para el sostenimiento de su familia. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, es una integrante de su banco comunal muy activa, la que siempre incentiva a la unidad en el trabajo, y se siente útil de servir de esa manera. Con el dinero de su préstamo comprará más mercadería, en especial pantalones.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 43 years old, and lives with her 3 children in their own house. For the past 3 years, she has been selling clothing during visits to her neighbors and people who she knows and with whom she has the trust to let them buy on credit. She generally goes out in the afternoons, since in the morning she is taking care of her children. Additionally, a couple months ago she began to sell leche azada, which is a traditional dessert of the region. Jaqueline prepares herself for long days of walking, but this effort has its payback in the money that she obtains to sustain her family. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from MFP, and she is a very active member of the community bank who always tries to unify people, and she feels very useful to serve in this way. With the money, she plans to buy more clothing, especially pants.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine O. A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. Augustine is a plastic molder who makes lots of things, including car lights, for sale at Siwdo (near Cape Coast), which he has done since 1999. His wife is a trader. Augustine uses his income to pay for food, clothing, fees, bills, etc. Augustine will use the loan to purchase more raw materials for plastic products. With the new profits from his expanded business, Augustine plans to reinvest back in the expansion of his plastic molding business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for the making of the plastic products

loans.name: Seberino

texts.es:
El sr. Severino M., es nacido en la cuidad de Potosí, Provincia Tomas Frías, y actualmente vive en la comunidad de Belén perteneciente a la comunidad del Torno. Cuenta con parcela propia.
Tiene su esposa la Sra. Martina Martínez y tiene tres hijos, ambos se dedican a la actividad de la agricultura, actualmente tienen sembrado maíz y fríjol. 
Con el préstamo que se les otorgará quieren sembrar papa, además de tener sus siembras también tienen 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno, 80 gallinas y 25 ovejas.
El sr. Severino quiere seguir trabajando de manera continua con el crédito ya que esto le ayuda a seguir aumentando su capital.
texts.en:
Mr. Severino M. was born in Potosí, Tomas Frías province, and currently lives in the community of Belén, belonging to the Torno community. He has his own plot. He has a wife, Mrs. Martina Martínez and they have three children. They are both engaged in agriculture for a living, and currently plant corn and beans. With the awarded loan they want to plant potato, and besides having their crops, they also want livestock, including 6 cattle, 80 chickens, and 25 goats. Mr. Severino wants to continue working on an ongoing basis with credit as this helps him to continue to grow his capital.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios envasados, tales como; mermeladas, manjar blanco, entre otros. Vende por cajas, y las reparte visitando de casa en casa a sus clientes para  dejar los pedidos, que generalmente cobra en partes, cada semana o como pacten con ella. Rosa realiza esta actividad hace 4 años, desde entonces, ha visto los resultados de su trabajo, los cuales son ventajosos para ella y el sostenimiento de sus hijos. Para más adelante Rosa está pensando mejorar su negocio y ofrecer otros productos como yogurt. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de ver que su grupo ha sabido sobrellevar una crisis que las ha fortalecido para ser más unidas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de mermelada, panes integrales, yogurt y otros productos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and lives with her 3 children at her parents' home. She sells packaged foods such as jams and dulce de leche, among others. She sells them by the case, and distributes them door to door to her clients. They order in advance and generally pay in installments, either every week or as they have previously agreed with her. Rosa has done this work for the past 4 years, and since then she has seen the results of her labour; it has been very advantageous for her and her children. In the future, Rosa is considering improving her business and offering other products, like yogurt. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP and she is very happy to see that her group has overcome a crisis that has strengthened their bond. The money she is requesting will be used to buy jams, whole wheat bread, yogurt, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac A. is married and has 5 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. Isaac is a blacksmith who uses metals to do a variety of things like making springs for sale at Siwdo near Cape Coast, which he has done since about 20 years ago. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income to pay for utility bills.

Isaac will use the loan as additional capital to buy more metals for the production of springs and other items to meet the demand of his customers. He plans to reinvest his new profits in the business to expand his trade.

loans.use: Metal for blacksmithing

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses D. is married and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high. Moses sells car spare parts at Siwdo near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2004. His wife is a nurse. Moses uses his income to pay bills.

Moses will use the loan as additional capital to enable him increase the sale of car spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He plans to reinvest his new profits back into the business for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: Car spare parts for resale

loans.name: Ademir

texts.es: Ademir es una madre muy amorosa, vive un cuarto alquilado junto a su única hija, Nardi de 2 años, y lo que más desea es brindarle buenos estudios. Junto a su inseparable carretilla de helados Ademir pasa sus días, caminando bajo el inclemente sol, recorriendo las calles de la ciudad Juliaca en busca de personas que deseen refrescarse comiendo un delicioso helado, ella es muy alegre, por lo cual sus clientes siempre se acercan a comprarle su producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para encargarse de su negocio, así como de las tareas del hogar, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera tener más adelante una tienda de helados donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el tercer préstamo de Ademir con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus dos primeros créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar su capital de trabajo para comprar más helados.
texts.en:
Ademir is a loving mother, who lives in a rented apartment with her only child, her 2-year-old daughter Nardi. Her greatest hope is to provide her with a good education. With her ice cream cart always by her side, Ademir spends her days walking under the harsh sun, traveling the streets of the city of Juliaca in search of people who want to refresh themselves with a delicious ice cream. She is a very happy person, which is why her clients always come to buy her product. What she likes most about her job is the freedom it gives her to take care of her business, as well as her household chores. She has spent two years doing this job and hopes in the future to have an ice cream shop where she can provide greater comfort to her clients. This is Ademir's third loan with Kiva partner MFP and she hopes to repay with the same punctuality as her two previous loans. She is a very responsible and supportive member of her village bank. With the money requested, she plans to increase her working capital in order to buy more ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 38 años es una madre muy querida por sus hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Elías de 41 años y sus 2 hijos Willy 20 y Javier 15, a quienes desea darles una buena educación superior. Elena camina todos los días por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, junto a su carretilla de helados buscando clientes que desean saborear sus deliciosos productos, es muy alegre y siempre atiende a las personas con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la cara de felicidad de los niños cuando sus padres les compran el helado que tanto deseaban, pero lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, lo que le causa mucho cansancio. Lleva 14 años en esta actividad y espera hacer crecer su negocio y poder comprarse su propia carretilla de helados, porque la que usa actualmente la alquila de la empresa, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poco a poco acercarse más a sus metas. Este es el quinto préstamo de Elena con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus socias, ya que es muy responsable. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más helado para vender más durante sus jornadas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Elena is a 38-year-old beloved mother who lives in her parents' home with her 41-year old husband Elias and her two sons: Willy, age 20 and Javier, age 15. Elena hopes to provide her children with a good post-secondary education. She walks with her ice cream cart every day in the streets of Juliaca, looking for clients who would like to enjoy her delicious products. She is a very happy person and always serves her customers with a smile on her lips. What she likes most about her job is seeing the happy faces of children whose parents have bought them the ice cream they wanted so much. The hardest part of her job, however, is having to walk all day under the harsh sun, which makes her extremely worn out. Elena has spent 14 years doing this job, and she hopes to be able to improve her business, and purchase her own ice cream cart, as the one she currently uses is rented from the company. Owning her own cart would allow her to increase her income and gradually get closer to her goals. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She has been very punctual with her prior payments and hopes to be so this time as well. In her village bank she is much appreciated by the other members, as she is very responsible. With the money requested, she will buy more ice cream in order to sell more in her workday.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric M. sells spare parts for cars at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Eric has received junior high schooling. He is single and has no child. He is responsible for paying utility bills.

Eric has been selling spare parts for cars since 2002. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia es una mujer muy admirada por sus vecinas, debido al gran esfuerzo que hace para salir adelante, tiene 30 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su vida. Se dedica al negocio de los tejidos artesanales, aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeña cuando ayudaba a su madre a terminar los tejidos que le solicitaban, actualmente es una de las principales proveedoras de las tiendas artesanales de la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más a un si son artesanías, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y anhela tener su propia tienda de tejidos artesanales donde pueda vender sus propias prendas, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es transportar sus tejidos hasta donde los distribuye, ya que se le hace muy cansado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo para poder salir adelante. Este es el quinto préstamo de Emilia con MFP, y espera pagar  todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy activa. Con el dinero solicitado planea comprar más lana de todos colores y de mejor calidad, para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Emilia is a woman who is much admired by her neighbors due to the great efforts she has made to make ends meet. She is 30 years old and lives in a rented room and she wants to improve her life. She works making handmade fabrics, which she learned as a young child, helping her mother complete her fabric orders. She is currently one of the principal suppliers of fabrics for the Sunday craft market in the city of Juliaca. What she likes most about her job is weaving, especially artisan fabrics. She has spent 8 years doing this work and longs to have her own shop where she could sell her own garments. What she likes least about her job is transporting her materials to where she distributes them; it is very tiring, even though she knows that she must do so to get ahead. This is Emilia's fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to make all her payments on time so she does not get in trouble with the members of her village bank, where she is a very active member. With the money she has requested, Emilia plans to purchase more wool in a variety of colours and of a better quality than usual, in order to produce a greater supply of fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano es un padre soltero que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, vive en la casa de sus primos junto a sus 2 hijos; Cynthia de 15 y Cliber de 14 años, quienes son el motivo de todos su esfuerzos y sacrificios. A lo largo de su vida Feliciano ha trabajado en muchas cosas para poder mantener a su familia, actualmente tiene un trabajo muy peculiar, él es triciclista (transporte de pasajeros en triciclo) pero al darse cuenta de la gran cantidad de competencia que tenia decidió fusionar su triciclo a una vieja moto que tenia almacenada, creando así una especie de “mototrici”, esto le permite llevar a sus clientes a una velocidad más rápida que el resto de tricicleros, además también le permite subir hasta lugares muy empinados donde no llegan los triciclos comunes. Lo que más le gusta a Feliciano de su trabajo es que puede distraerse paseando por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que trabajar bajo la lluvia puesto que su triciclo se moja y se le hace más difícil conseguir pasajeros. Su deseo es acondicionar mejor su triciclo para poder brindar un servicio más confortable a sus clientes. Este es el primer préstamo de Feliciano con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido pese a ser nuevo en el grupo. Con el dinero que solicita planea arreglar su vehiculo, el cual viene teniendo algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is a single father who has always fought to come out on to. He lives in his cousins' house with his two children; Cynthis, age 15, and Cliber, 14, who are the motivation for all his efforts and sacrifices. Throughout his life Feliciano has worked in many ways to support his family. Currently he has a very unusual job, he is a tricyclist (someone who provides transportation on a three-wheeler). Thinking creatively, he decided to attach his three-wheeler to an old motorcycle which he had in storage, creating a sort of "mototrici", which allows him to move his clients much more quickly than other tricyclists. He is also able to access really steep areas where regular three-wheeler aren't able to go. What Feliciano likes most about his job is that he can pass time travelling the streets of Juliaca. He has spent 5 years doing this job, and what he likes least is that he must work even when it's raining, though his vehicle gets wet and it becomes more difficult to find passengers. Feliciano's hope is to soup up his three-wheeler to provide a more comfortable service to his clients. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP. He knows he must pay his fees on time as he doesn't want to end up in trouble with the members of his village bank, in which he is very appreciated despite being new to the group. He will use the money requested to fix up his vehicle, in which there are some imperfections.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicular repairs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una buena vejez. Desde muy niña le gustó trabajar, actualmente atiende en un restaurante muy conocido de la ciudad de Juliaca, es una trabajadora muy ágil y atenta, pues sola atiende a cerca de 200 personas que entran diariamente al restaurante. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro pueda tener su propio restaurante. Este es el primer préstamo de Nancy con MFP y espera poderlo pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita incrementará el monto para posteriormente poner su restaurante.
texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old, and a very responsible and hardworking woman. She lives in her parents' home and she wishes to give them a happy old age. Since she was very young, Nancy has enjoyed working, currently she works in a well known restaurant in the city of Juliaca. She is a lively and attentive worker, and she alone serves the nearly 200 people people who visit the restaurant each day. What she likes most about her job is conversing with the customers. She has spent 4 years at this job and hopes that in the future she could have her own restaurant. This is Nancy's first loan with Kiva partner MFP and she hopes to be able to repay it on time, as she doesn't want to have problems with the other members of her village bank, where she is well-liked and respected. With the money requested she will increase her total in order to eventually fund her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for her own restaurant

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward A. is an auto mechanic at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Edward has received junior high school education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a seamstress.

Edward has been an auto mechanic since 2008. He is responsible for feeding and clothing his family as well as for fees, bills, etc.

Edward’s loan will be used to buy spare parts. His customers insist that he repairs the vehicles and replaces the necessary parts using his own money and then they pay for his services and other expenses he incurs on the vehicle. He is therefore asking for additional funds to buy spare parts to enhance his work. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: За те 2 займа полученные Мавчудой с КИВА бизнес претерпел большие изменения. Она ввела в ассортимент новые виды обуви, а одежда для женщин, которую она продает, стала более дешевой и качественной. Мавчуда за прошедшую зиму несколько раз выезжала за товаром и каждая партия товара ею уже продана и она благодарна КИВА за поддержку. Новый займ Мавчуда собирается потратить на ассортимент весенней одежды и планирует получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Over the course of the two loans that Mavchuda has received from Kiva, her business has undergone great change. She added new styles of shoes and women's clothing to the assortment that she sells, lowered her prices and increased quality. Several times last winter Mavchuda went on buying trips, and sold each lot of goods. She is grateful to Kiva for the support. Mavchuda is going to spend the new loan on an assortment of spring clothing, and plans to make a good profit.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод занимается ремонтом частных домов. Эта профессия была приобретена им когда не найдя постоянной работы он перебивался разными заработками. Тогда он стал учеником к одному мастеру по ремонту и за пару лет стал самостоятельно делать самые сложные виды ремонта. Сейчас он может выполнять наклейку обоев, стелить полы, уложить кафель и тп. Дилшоду 26 лет, еще не женат. На займ полученный в КИВА собирается приобрести строительный материалы (обои и кафель), которые он будет расходовать при выполнении строительных работ.
texts.en:
Dilshod works in residential construction. He took up that profession to make ends meet when he was not able to find steady work. He became an apprentice to a master craftsman and in a couple of years was able to independently handle the most complicated of jobs. Now he can hang wallpaper, and lay floors and tile, et cetera. Dilshod is 26 years old and unmarried. With the loan from Kiva, he is going to buy materials (wallpaper and tile), which he will use on construction jobs.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anora

texts.ru: Социальное положение Аноры на сегодняшний день очень низкое. Ей 36 лет. незамужем. Не имея постоянной работы Анора занимается мелким предпринимательством и продает различные мелкие товары: носки, носовые платки, и тому подобное. Опыт ее работы на рынке хотя и большой, но за эти годы его объем не увеличился настолько, чтобы смело можно было бы его назвать успешным. Скорей всего это результат того, что вся прибыль идет на покрытие семейных расходов. Анора вынуждена  взять небольшой займ, чтобы внести новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Anora presently lives at the bottom of the socio-economic ladder. She is 36 years old and unmarried. Being without steady employment, Anora has a business selling various small items: socks, handkerchiefs and the like. Although she has a lot of experience selling at the market, over the years her volume of sales has not increased to such an extent that it could be labeled a success. Most likely this results from the fact that all the profit goes to cover family expenses. Anora is obliged to take out a small loan to bring in a new assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her assortment of goods

loans.name: Meera

texts.en:
Meera P. is a resident of Khokhana-Dobata. Khokhana-Dobato is located in Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. Meera P. lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her older son is studying in grade 7 and her younger son is studying in grade 2.

Both Mrs. and Mr. P. are engaged in the traditional work of tailoring, which they learned from their forefathers. They make different types of clothes, including ladies clothing and dresses. They make pants and shirts for gentlemen and kurta sulwar, blouses and makhshi for ladies.

Now Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Mrs. Nura P., 35, is a tailor in the village of Khokhana-Dobato. Tailoring is their traditional work. Both Mrs. P. and her husband, Surendra P., make different types of dresses for both ladies and gentlemen.

Mrs. P. plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use her income for self improvement and for her children's education. In Nepal the cost of a good education is increasing and Mrs. P. is saving her income to provide a good education for her children.

She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her son is studying in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Shree Kumari

texts.en:
Shree Kumari M. is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two daughters. Her husband, Mr. Ganga Ram M., works in a private office. Her older daughter is studying in grade 7 and her younger daughter is studying in grade 3 at school.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop five years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic conditions of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to increase the stock of food for her shop, such as noodles, rice, biscuits and other items. She will also use the loan to expand her shop. She wishes to use her income to give a better education to her daughters.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi S. lives in the village of Thecho, which is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. S. lives in single family. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband, Mr. Ira S., is engaged in woodcarving work. She has two daughters. Both of them are studying in a primary school.

Mrs. S. opened her meat shop six months ago in the town of Kalanki. She sells chicken and buff (buffalo) meat in her shop. She opened the meat shop to improve the living standards of her family. Her husband also helps her in her work. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 loan to buy a freezer to store meats.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to store meats

loans.name: Santu

texts.en:
Santu M. lives with her husband and two sons in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Santu M. and her sons are engaged in making different types of traditional brass religious statues. They make the figures as per the demand of customer.

Now Mrs. Santu M. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy the necessary raw material for her statue-making work. She wants to use her increased income to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati R. lives in Tangal in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels and stationery stores.

Mrs. Rangit lives in a single family with her husband and four children. Some of her children are now studying and some are working.

Both Mrs. and Mr. R. work in their own small restaurant. They opened their restaurant nine years ago. They sell different types of food items in her shop, especially Newari food because the demand of Newari food is greater. They also sell tea and coffee in her hotel. Now Mrs. R. is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to expand her business and purchase necessary food materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati B., 40, is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Patan. She opened her tailoring shop more than 10 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, long dresses, makhshi and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. Majarcharya took a six-month training course in tailoring.

She plans to use the Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

Her husband's name is Dinesh B. and he makes brass religious statues. She has three daughters studying in grades 9, 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Man Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Man Kumari K. is a tailor in the town of Kuleshwor. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, makhshi and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs K. took a six-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

She plans to use the loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self improvement and for her children's education. In Nepal the cost of good education is very high.

Her husband's name is Shyam K. and he is a house painter. She has one son and one daughter. Both of them are now studying in the higher level.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya T. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Kul Bahadur T. and he is a driver. Mrs. T. has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying for a BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies) and her daughter is studying in grade 8.

Mrs. T. opened her vegetable shop five years ago. She sells different types of vegetables, which she buys from the Kalimati market. She opened the vegetable shop to increase the living standards of her family.

Now Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy various types of vegetables, like potatoes and tomatoes, for her shop. She also wants to purchase new furniture for her shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sita T. lives in a single-family home with her husband and four children in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Shyam T. and he works in a private office. Mrs. T. has three daughters; they are studying in grades 6, 3 and 2 respectively. Her son is in primary school.  She has four children and in Nepal, the cost of education is very high. So they have to spend a huge amount for their children's education and the economical conduction of her family is not so good. So to overcome this problem, Mrs. T. opened her vegetable shop five years ago. She sells different types of vegetables in her shop. She buys vegetables from Kalimati market. With her first loan from Kiva, Mrs. T. was able to raise her income. She has already cleared her first loan from Kiva.
Now Mrs. T. is requesting a loan for Rs 20000 to buy various types of vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes etc for her shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Mangal Maiya

texts.en:
Mangal Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are Newars and they depend on agricultural work. Mrs. Mangal Maiya M. lives with her two children. Several years ago, her husband, Prem Bhakta died and now she has sole responsibility for her two children. Mrs. M. opened a meat shop five years ago. She sells chicken in her shop. Now a day the demand for and the cost of chicken are very high. So Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for Rs 10000.00 to invest in her shop.
She has one son and one daughter. Both of them are now studying.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Buddi Maiya

texts.en: Miss Buddi Maiya R. is a tailor in Thikhidewol, Lalitpur. She lives with her father, mother, one brother and one sister. She opened her tailoring shop one year ago. She took a six-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women. She makes dresses according to the orders she gets from her customers. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Dolma

texts.en:
Dolma L. lives in Thikhidewol, Lalitpur. There are three members including herself in her family. Her husband, Mr. Keshab Bahadur L., went to Dubai to work. She has one son who is in pre-primary school.
Mrs. L. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Thikhidewol. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks and cold drinks. Now Mrs. L. is requesting a loan for Rs 10000.00 to expand her business by purchasing different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. L. wants to utilize her income to provide a better education for her sons. She also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Bidhya

texts.en:
Bidhya T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in the Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. 
Mrs. Bidhya T. lives in a single family home. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband, Mr. Tulshi T., works in a private office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 9 and her daughter is in grade 5. 
Mrs. Bidhya T. is engaged in poultry farming. She buys small chickens and sells them after 50 to 60 days to the dealers. She already has taken her first loan from Kiva for the same business and has already cleared her first loan. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy small chickens for her business.
She decided to engage in this business to change the living standard of her family. She wants to provide a better education for both of her children.

loans.use: To buy small chickens

loans.name: Manju Thapa

texts.en:
Manju Thapa M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She opened her grocery store to upgrade the living standard of her family. She opened her grocery store five years ago. She sells different types of grocery items in her grocery store. She feels proud to help her husband in fulfilling the needs of family. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodles, biscuits etc in her shop. Now she is requesting Rs 10000.00 to buy different varieties of grocery items for her shop.
Mrs. Manju Thapa M. lives in a single-family house with her husband and four children. Her husband works in a private office. She has two sons and two daughters. All of them are now studying.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju J. runs her fruit shop in Sainbu-Bhaishepati. She runs it along with her husband Mr. Gopan J.. They also sell fresh fruit juice. They buy fruit from Kalimati market which is one of the very famous bazaars for fruit and vegetables in Nepal. They first opened their fruit shop two years ago and it provides income for their family.

Now Mrs. Manju J. seeks a Rs 10000 loan to invest in their shop. She will buy fruit with the loan. She will also use the loan to buy furniture for their shop.

Mrs. J. has three sons. All of them were in primary school. Now all of them are in normal boarding school. She wishes to send all her sons to a good boarding school.

loans.use: To buy fruit for their store

loans.name: Goma Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma Thapa M. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhashipati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and one granddaughter. Her husband, Mr. Kamal Bahadur Thapa, is a retired officer. Her son is a land broker.

Mrs. Goma’s daughter-in-law is a beautician. She has completed the training to be a beautician. Now she wants to open her own beauty salon but, due to lack of funds, she cannot open her own beauty salon. So her mother-in-law Mrs. Goma Thapa M. is requesting a Rs 25000.00 loan to help her daughter-in-law open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To open beauty salon

loans.name: Ganu Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganu Thapa M. is a cosmetics shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She opened her cosmetic shop five years ago. She opened her shop to utilize her free time and to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different kinds of cosmetic goods in her shop. Now she seeks a Rs 15000.00 loan to invest in her shop. She will use the loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods such as cream, lipsticks, glass bangles etc.

Mrs. Ganu Thapa M. has five members (including herself) in her family. Her husband, Mr. Kesbad Thapa M., has retired from his job. She has one son and two daughters. All of them are now studying.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Renu P. is a tailor in the villege of Bhakepati. She took six months of training for her tailoring work. She especially prefers to make traditional ladies dresses such kurta-sulwal, a blouse which is very popular among Nepalese women. She is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work such as cloth, cutting machines etc.

Mrs. Renu P. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Deepak is a land broker. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9 and her son is in primary school. She uses her income in fulfilling the needs of her family. She wants to spend her income to provide a good education for all her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita L. lives in Bhakepati which is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agriculture. Mrs. L. lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and husband. Her husband, Mr. Mohan works in a medicine factory.
