Mrs. Sarita L. is engaged in making different types of handmade dolls. She took two months of training for this work. She sells her dolls in a decorative shop. She engaged in this work to help her husband in fulfilling the need of her family.

Now Mrs. L. is requesting a Rs 20,000 loan to buy various types of raw materials for her doll-making work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her doll-making

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala A. lives in Bhakepati which is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. Mrs. Bimala A. lives in a single family home.

She has three members including herself in her family. Her husband is a taxi driver and drives his taxi around Kathmandu valley. She has one son who is studying in grade 9.

Mrs. Bimala A. is engaged in poultry farming. She buys chicks and sells them to the dealers after 50 to 60 days. She engaged in this business to improve the living standard of her family.

Now she is requesting a Rs 25,000 loan to buys chicks for her business. She wants to provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: El Senor Es Mi Pastor 1 Group

texts.en:
Enerita Y. and the four other members of this group are requesting their third loan with Esperanza International. Enerita has five children; the youngest is 11 years old. She has been appointed group representative and lives in Santiago. This is the second largest city in the Dominican Republic and one of the largest industrial cities in the country. However, it is surrounded by slum neighborhoods inhabited largely by people who've migrated from smaller areas in the north of the country looking for better employment opportunities. 

Enerita makes a living selling clothing. She will use a portion of her loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the balance to expand into the sale of oil and milk, two of the most commonly used items in daily Dominican diet, but also two of the most expensive. She believes if she can buy a considerable quantity of these items to sell at home, she can make good profits and most likely, raise her daily income. 

Enerita likes to listen to Christian music in her spare time because it helps her relax. Please help us support her and the other entrepreneurs in this through group a Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy new clothes, oil and milk to sell.

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three women who live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sem E., age 30, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. She is married but has no children. Her husband is Sokhom, age 41, who works as a military policeman.

Mrs. E. currently sells groceries out of her home. As another income source, she provides small loans with specific terms to the villagers. Because the business of selling groceries is an important source of the family's income, E. is requesting a loan in order to increase the inventory.

The other two borrowers are: S., a widow who works as a garment worker. She is requesting a loan to buy fruit to sell. K., who sells cakes in her home and needs a loan to purchase ingredients and some groceries to sell.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her grocery  busines

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en:
"Ni Ketut G. - (DNR.M-0635) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Dsn Pangkung Liplip, Ds Kaliakah. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut G. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Ni Ketut G. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years.

In 2007, Ni Ketut G. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut G. has successfully repaid a previous loan from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Ketut G. is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Ketut G. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*********************************************************

Ni Ketut G. - (DNR.M-0635) merupakan 50 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn Pangkung Liplip , Ds Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut G. memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak sapi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut G. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut G. bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut G. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5000000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut G. berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Mrs. Ant Inn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ant I. has been selected president by the sixteen members of this village bank. She is a rice farmer who owns a plot of land. In this plantation, she faces obstacles because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy rice seed. To deal with these problems, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She will use the rest of the money to buy piglets to start a breeding business. She is a 55-year-old widow with two children: one is a construction worker and the other is a seller.

This village bank is located in Trapeang Lean village in Takeo province. The other members plan to use the loans which they obtain for different purpoS.. Ten members in this group loan have end-of-term loans (the borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.) The rest have monthly payment loans.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial for Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Vorn Nuch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Trapeang Lean village in the Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Vorn N. is a 30-year-old village-bank president. She is a vegetable seller and pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Eng Vorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Vorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

Seven members in this group loans are using end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income

loans.name: Ni Made Mey Arianti

texts.en:
"Mey Arianti - (DNR.M-0636) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Pangkung Liplip, Ds Kalikah.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Mey Arianti owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Mey Arianti has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 900,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2008, Mey Arianti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mey Arianti has successfully repaid a previous loan of 450,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Mey Arianti is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Mey Arianti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Mey Arianti - (DNR.M-0636) merupakan 35 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Dsn. Pangkung Liplip, Ds Kalikah.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Mey Arianti memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuka toko umum.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Mey Arianti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Mey Arianti menghasilkan sekitar 900,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2008, Mey Arianti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Mey Arianti meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli peralatan & perkakas baru untuk mengembangkan bisnis.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Mey Arianti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Rorn Nhin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of fifteen members, is located in Trapeang L. village in Takeo province. The members plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes.

Mrs. Rorn N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Naem Roun, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard they still earn too little income to provide a better house for their family. Thus, Mrs. Rorn N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timbers to build the house. She is 40 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK, Kiva's partner, has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy timbers for building a house.

loans.name: Ni Komang Maria Coa

texts.en:
Maria Coa (DNR.M-0637) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Pangkung Liplip, Ds. Kaliakah.  She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Maria Coa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Maria Coa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maria Coa joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Maria Coa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  Maria Coa is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Maria Coa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Arlene N. is a rice farmer. She is 48 years old and has nine children. She started her farm business using a 1-hectare lot that she inherited from her parents. She wants to buy more field to increase her business. Currently, Arlene is working as a barangay (village) health worker. When she is not busy in her work, she helps her husband, Solomon N., with taking care of the crops.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Kiva's partner CEVI. She will use the loan to buy herbicide and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her achieve better yield. In that way, she believes, she could better support the needs of her children.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to help start and have their own businesses. CEVI provides their clients with credit, training and insurance-coverage services to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Sith Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people living in Trapeang Lean village in TaK. province comprise this village bank loan and they will use the loan for various purpoS.. Mrs. Sith V. is a 59-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. U. Chhim, is a construction foreman. In his work, he needs some construction supplies to better his work. Thus, Mrs. Sith V. decided to ask for a loan to buy construction supplies for her husband’s work. She has six children, two are employed in a garment factory while the other three are attending the local school and the last is too young to work or study. 

Fourteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband’s work.

loans.name: Chham's Group

texts.en:
This loan is for a group of three women. One of them is Mrs. M., 50, who has been selected to be the leader by the other members. M. is a widowed mother who has four children; three of them are single and the other is married and lives independently. Two of her daughters are employed: One is a used-clothes seller and the other sells fish in the market. Her husband sells clothes in the Sophy Market.

Presently, M. supports her family by selling fresh fish in the market, earning about $3.50 a day. M. and her husband think that their ventures are profitable and good items for family to invest in. Therefore, they have decided to request a loan to increase their businesses' capital.

The other two borrowers include M., who is a fish seller asking for a loan to buy additional fish for sale, and P., who sells Khmer fritters in her home and needs a loan to order wooden statues to sell to tourists for more income. The borrowers live in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To increase their business capital

loans.name: Ni Komang Sri Virgawati

texts.en:
Ni Komang Sri Virgawati is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. PangkugLiplip, Ds, Kaliakah. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling religious items. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling incense and candles to tourists and local community members. Ni Komang Sri Virgawati has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati joined Kiva's partner DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Komang Sri Virgawati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

Ni Komang Sri Virgawati is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Komang Sri Virgawati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small-business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
