loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is 53 years old, married and blessed with four children. She lives in Zone 3, Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. Her husband is an electrician and a plumber. She engages in food and snack vending. She is also into food processing and catering services.

Mary is working so hard to earn money for the family. Everyday, she peddles the food and snacks in their neighborhood and nearby villages. Due to financial incapacity and increasing demands of her business, she wants to apply a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 7000 to purchase additional materials and ingredients. If granted, this will be a great help for the family to generate more income. This will be Mary's second loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food and snack vending

location.town: Zone 3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. manages a small piggery business. She is 42 and has five children. She engaged in this kind of business to earn an income for her family. At some point in her life, she decided to quit her business. But because she enjoys the work and earns reasonable profit from it, she continues to raise pigs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed. The loan will help Elizabeth increase the size of her pig fence. "Hard work always has a reward. I am making my best to support well my family," she said.

CEVI is reaching out to more hog growers to increase and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients with credit, training and insurance-coverage services to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Tunas Baru A Group

texts.en:
Tunas Baru A is a group of 15 farmers in Bokong Village in the Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. This group is led by Stefanus A., a 38-year-old man. He is married with one mute son who is 10 and one adopted daughter who is 6 years old and studying in the elementary school grade 1.

Both Stefanus and his wife work hard to fulfill their family needs. As a farmer, Stefanus leans upon his harvest to generate income for his family. In the rainy season, he usually plants corns, peanuts, cassavas, pumpkins, bananas and coconuts. And in the dry season, he usually plants some vegetables, onion, tomatoes and chilies. Then Stefanus and his wife will sell their harvest to the markets. The nearest market is situated about a 30-minute drive from their village. The road in Bokong Village where Stefanus lives is bumpy with many holes. It is hard for public transportation to serve this area in the rainy season; as a result the farmers in Bokong Village (including Stefanus) cannot bring their harvest to the market to be sold. The income that Stefanus generates by selling his harvest is unstable, that is one of the reasons why he is interested in the TLM cattle-fattening program. Stefanus plans to spend the profit of selling the fattened cattle to meet his daughter's education needs and to meet his family needs. 

Stefanus is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner TLM amounting to Rp 3,200,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. Just the same as Stefanus, the other 14 members of this group are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. All of them have a dream to have better lives through their involvement in the cattle-fattening program.

Note: When the picture was taken, Marselina, Ribka and Lodia weren’t present.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Mrs. Somaly Lung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirty-one people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Somaly L. is a 42-year-old village bank president.  She is a hard working woman. She also is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed off the farm while the others are attending the local school. 

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.en:
Reynilda E. is a 39-year-old resident of Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She is a widow with five children. She has a carenderia (food stall) business.

Reynilda started her business with the pension she gets from her deceased husband. But the pension and the income coming from the food stall is not enough to provide the daily needs of the family. That's why she wants to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 4000 to purchase ingredients and materials for her food stall. This will be a great help for Reynilda to give the family a comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food stall

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy M., 35, has been running a small shop out of her home selling groceries for years. For another source of income, she also works with her husband cultivating rice on farmland they inherited from their grandparents.

The family lives with their four children in Siem Reap Province. Their children are single students who help them in the business when they are not studying. Chy M. will use the loan to purchase more cows to plow a field and to raise them for their offspring.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
"I started my business tilling the more than 2-hectare land of my parents," says Viola E., a mother of five children from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. "Now that it is officially mine, I gain a lot of meaningful experience how to farm to ensure food for the family."

Viola E. is married to a farmer. They are together for many years already. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy diesel fuel to run the tractor for the farm and to buy seeds for the next planting season. The loan will help benefit Viola's family by growing their farm and attaining better yield.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients with credit, training and insurance coverage to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: Purchase of diesel fuel and certified rice seed

loans.name: Mrs. Ang Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of eighteen members is located in Krasang village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Ang S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a hard working woman. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Although she tries to work hard, she still earns little income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. Mrs. Ang S. is a 49-year-old widow with three children, one of whO. is a farmer to help the mother work while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Nine members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh P. is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Oanh owns and operates a business venture operating a retail store which specializes in making and selling baskets and brooms. So her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bamboo products in the local community. Oanh has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 4200000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, Oanh joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Oanh is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Oanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality of life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation and role in society.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie Z. is 45 years old, married and blessed with two children. She lives in Zone 3, Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. Her husband works as an electrician for a private company.

Rosemarie engages in pastry and cake baking, making banana cakes, cookies, pineapple pies and others. She started her business with their own personal money coming from their savings. She distributes her pastries and cakes through consignment with her suki (regular customers). Most of her customers are her neighbors and some close friends. Due to increasing demands of her business, she decided to expand it by applying for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 7000 to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business. If granted, this will be a great help for them because she always dreamed of having a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the business

location.town: Zone 3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Quý

texts.en:
Quý Q. is a female living in the town of Hưng yên. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Quý is running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Quý has been engaged in this business for over nine years. Out of it she achieves approximately 2000000 VND (approximately 114 US Dollar) a month from these activities.

In 2000, Quý joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Quý is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials for manufacturing additional products. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by her from TYM Fund. Quý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for five women who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. The group leader, Mrs. Sot N., age 34, is a good mother of three teenage children who are school age. Her husband is a military policeman. Currently, N. earns a living by distilling rice wine as well as raising a few pigs for sale in a pigpen out of her home. N. normally uses the remainder of the wine for the pigs to eat so she can save the cost of pig food. Because the business of breeding pigs is going well and is profitable, N. has requested a loan to purchase more piglets to raise. The other four borrowers are: 
N. is a single woman selling groceries, who needs a loan to increase inventory.
S. is a widowed mother selling cakes in her home and she requests a loan to use as capital for the business.
N. sells cakes for kids in the village and she will use the loan to support her husband's business of growing vegetables.
M. makes Khmer wine and raises pigs for sale and she is applying for a loan to begin selling groceries.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Đường
loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh D. is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Hanh owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector and specializes in melting copper. So the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling metal & metal-related products in the local community. Hanh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4300000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1998, Hanh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanh has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Hanh is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Hanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality & life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation & role in society.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Can

texts.en:
Can L. is a 59-year-old femaL. living in the town of Nam Định.  She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Can works in a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business which specializes in making rice-noodles. So her income comes primarily from manufacturing & selling to local businesses and community members. Can has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4300000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1999, Can joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Can has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Can is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Can plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality & life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation & roL. in society

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Abdul Wali

texts.en:
Abdul Wali K., who is 35 years old, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in Jalalabad city Nangarhar province and he is involved in agriculture in his own village in the Angoor Bagh. He has six years experience in this work and is a very hard worker. He has studied in the past during the war in Afghanistan up to three classes.

Abdul has two sons and one baby sister. He lives with his parents in a small rental house in Angoor Bagh. His senior son is studying in fifth class at a public school in Jalalabad city and in his spare time he helps his father with the farming. The other one is not able to go to school. Abdul has a lot of dreams for the future of his children but his income is so small. He wants to increase it because he pays 3000AF per month rent for his house.

Abdul wants to buy some things for his land but he needs an individual loan; therefore he requested that the lenders of AFGS to give him a 40000AF individual loan. Also he has his own capital of 100000AF but he invested it in his business. He wants to increase his income to become 500AF (~10USD) per day. And he says if he receives this money he will buy some seeds and necessary things for his land and more. 

Thanks Kiva loan!

loans.use: Buying seeds and necessary things for his land

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of four borrowers in this loan is Mrs. Leng S., age 31. S. and her husband make their daily income by fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake. Since 1998, they have been operating their job. The couple now lives with two teenage children who are school age. The children help their parents' fishing business when they are not studying. S. is applying for a loan in order to buy a machine to connect to the boat so she can go fishing more quickly. The other three borrowers are:
V. is a local fisherman, asking for a loan to buy nets for fishing.
S. is looking for a loan in order to purchase fishing tools for her business.
S. earns a living by fishing and is requesting a loan to decorate her house.
They all live in Chong Kneas Commune, in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her boat

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina T. is a pig grower. She has three pigs and one sow. She is 33 years old, married and has two children. She wants to buy more piglets to increase her income. Before she engaged in the hog raising business, she grew rice. She still has her farm even though she has pigs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy new piglets and feed. The loan will help Gina grow her piggery even more. 

CEVI is reaching out to more hog raisers to grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig  feed

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita C. is managing a small parcel of rice farm in her village. She is 43 years old and has five children. "I started farming in 2004. Now, I am still managing my business to provide the needs of my children", she said. "My husband and I decided to buy a new farm, but we need to improve our current yield to realize our plans", she added.

Now, Lucita is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy diesel fuel to run the tractor that she rented to plow the field, fertilizer to enrich the soil for productivity of her farm and insecticide to protect her rice from attacks of insects and pests.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI gives their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services to grow their business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel fuel, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene S. is managing a one-hectare rice farm. She is 35 years old and has five children. Her husband, Danilo S., is helping her with the farm business. They have been together for two years already. Farming is their only source of income. Aside from rice, the family also grows vegetables in their backyard to supplement their income.

Now, Arlene is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI (the first Filipino MFI partner to go active in KIVA microfunds). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil fertility of her farm, and herbicides to stop insects and pests from inflicting damage on her crops. In this way, she believes, her family will get a better yield than their previous experience.

CEVI is reaching out more farmers to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI is provides their clients with credit, trainings and insurance coverage services to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.ru: Дониёр – мужчина средних лет (42 лет), женат и отец 4-х детей. У Дониёра есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 40 овец и 20 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Дониёр каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Дониёра пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Дониёр за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Дониёр очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Doniyor is a middle-aged man (42 years old), is married, and is the father of four children. Doniyor has a flock of livestock consisting of approximately forty sheep and twenty goats. His wife is a housewife, but in her free time, she works processing wool and knitting various warm things. She sells these things to neighbors or relatives. Every morning, Doniyor drives the flock to the mountains, grazes them, and drives them back in the evening. Doniyor does not currently own any cattle, but Doniyor wants to buy two average bulls with this new loan. After fattening them three to four months, he can sell them for very good price. Doniyor is very happy to be working with us since the loans help him a great deal.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Фармонова Манзура в возрасте 41 год проживающая  в городе Гисар. Разведена имеет троих детей, образование среднее.Клиентка занимается бизнесом, уже более семи лет,на центральном рынке города Гисара.У клиентки имееется арендуемая торговая точка. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар в виде закупа обуви. От имеемого дохода клиентка содержит семью.
texts.en:
Manzura F. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Gissar. She is divorced and has three children. She has secondary education. She has own business for more than seven years on the central market of Gissar. She is renting out a vendor space. Manzura want to use the money from the loan to increase the inventory stock by buying shoes. She uses the profit to support her family.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.ru: Иброхимчон Солиев - мужчина 31 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. Иброхимчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Иброхимчон кредитуется уже 2 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Иброхимчона большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Иброхимчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Ibrohimjon S. is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Ibrohimjon works fattening and selling cattle, and his wife is works processing and selling milk. Ibrohimjon has taken out loans for two years. The first time he applied for a loan, he had very few cattle. Now, Ibrohimjon has a large quantity of livestock. Currently, his wife has only one milk cow. Ibrohimjon plans to buy another milk cow and calf for his wife, and he is grateful to our lenders for helping him carry out his plans.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn P. D. is a 39-year-old resident of To-ud, Maasin, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is married and blessed with two children. Her eldest child is currently employed and the other is in third-year high school. Her husband is a farmer. They planted their farm with bananas, coconut and other things.

Joselyn is engaged in buying firewood and selling it in the market. Currently, Joselyn's venture is good but its income is not sufficient to cover the family's daily expenses. She wants to increase her stock to cover the demands of her customers and generate higher income. That's why she wanted to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 7,000 to purchase additional firewood. If granted, this will be a great help for the family, in their efforts to have a comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for sale

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy V. is a resident of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines. He runs a grocery store where he sells canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, bottled water and a variety of candies and biscuits (cookies).

Sammy is planning to increase his income to support the educational and other needs of his children. He needs additional capital of PHP 11,000 to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Sammy thanks everyone for bringing him an opportunity to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Юлдошу 42 лет. У него есть жена и 4-ро детей. Два сына и две дочки. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Дочки помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Юлдош пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он берет кредит в нашей организации, для увеличения количества скота.
texts.en:
Yuldosh is 42 years old. He has a wife and four children, two sons and two daughters. His older sons have gone to Russia to work. While working there, they send money to their parents. The parents save the money they receive in order to pay for their sons’ marriages. The daughters help at home. His wife spins yarn. She then sells it at the market. Yuldosh grazes cattle in the mountains and comes home very late. He wants to take out a loan through our organization in order to buy more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Nasir Ahmad

texts.en:
Nasir Ahmad is the son of A. H.. He lives in district 8, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and married with 6 children. After he came from Pakistan he opened a small restaurant to provide all the necessities of his house members and repair his house which was damaged because of winter. The income he received from his restaurant was not enough for both his house repairing and expenses of his family members, so he would like to take out a loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of ten months to buy the construction materials for his house. 

He would like to mention that Kiva is an effective process that can support all the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is 22 years old and married with three children. She is living with her family at Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines.

Arlene has been in her buying and selling business for three years. She buys raw bananas and copra products from her neighbors. When she has enough stock, with the help of her husband, she'll transport the products to the city and sell them.

She is so grateful for the assistance extended by HSPFI in their area through its micro-finance program. Arlene wants to expand her business to earn more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more raw bananas and copra products to sell in the city.

Arlene sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more raw bananas and copra products to sell in the city

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.ru: Умарчон молодой человек 26 лет. Он женат и имеет дочку и сына. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, нянчит детей и по мере возможности кормит скот. Умарчон занимается откормом и продажей скота. Начало весны для Умарчона – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что скот сейчас стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Умарчон не покупает для скота сено. Через 4 месяца городские люди начинают покупать скот. Вот тогда, Умарчон продаст свой скот. Он благодарен нам за помощь в развитии бизнеса молодой семьи.
texts.en:
Umarjon is a young man, 26 years old. He is married and has a daughter and a son. His wife does not work. She keeps the house, cares for the children, and, as much as possible, feeds the cattle. Umarjon works fattening and selling cattle. Umarjon buys cattle at the beginning of spring, since prices then are low. Additionally, fattening cattle is not expensive. The cattle eat mountain grass, so Umarjon does not buy hay for his cattle. After four months, city people will start buying cattle. Then Umarjon will sell his cattle. He is grateful to us for helping develop his young family’s business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita D. is married with three children. She is currently living at Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. Amelita engages in a food vending business where she sells food through peddling. Her direct customers are neighbors, school teachers, and students.

Amelita is already 50 years old. She wishes to build a simple food stall of her own. She is confident that she could serve and satisfy her customers well if she could build her food stall. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000.00 to materialize her plans.

loans.use: To build a food vending stall.

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Mr. Herman R. is 36 years old and a resident of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines. Mr. R. is married with three children. He is a well-motivated man who wishes to bring a bright future to his family. He started up his mini grocery store when he received his first loan from HSPFI.

At this moment, because his store can hardly accommodate the demands of his customers, he wants to access additional capital of PHP 11,000. This will be used to buy additional stock for his store, like canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and beverages. Mr. R. and his family extend their thanks to KIVA and KIVA lenders, who will be the bridge to the success of his plans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for sale, like canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and beverages.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Mrs. Emelda P. is 47 years old and lives in Baluarte, Lumbia, City of Cagayan de Oro, Philippines. She lives with her husband and five children. Emelda is currently engaged in her buy-and-sell business. She buys green bananas from her neighbors and in neighboring villages and then sells them in the city. She is doing this routine twice a week.

Emelda wants to maximize the days of the week to cope and also meet the demands of her customers, both in her town and in the city. She believes that if she has enough capital, she can handle such demand and her buy-and-sell business would eventually grow.

With HSPFI assistance, she was previously granted a loan amount of PHP 5,000. Right now she is in need of PHP 8,000 to buy more bananas, sell more, and earn more in order to cater the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Mrs. Leoncia A. is a member of HSPFI. She is 52 years old and currently resides in Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City, Northern Mindanao, Philippines. With HSPFI's assistance, she was granted a loan of PHP 5,000. Leoncia used it to finance her food vending business. Together with her daughters, they manage her business well and right now she is building a food stall of her own.

Leoncia has one hectare of land that needs to be cultivated. She wants to cultivate this land and plant it with cassava and corn. She is in need of PHP 8,000 to finance the cultivation of her land and to buy cassava sticks, corn seeds, and fertilizers. Leoncia is already a widow and is now the one providing for the needs of her four children.

loans.use: To buy cassava stalks, corn seeds, and fertilizers for her farm.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leticia Nalwanga‘S Group

texts.en:
Leticia is 30 years of age and married with three children, aged between 4 and 9 years. All her children go to school. She owns a four-roomed house where she lives with three people. She also takes care of additional family members: her mother, two younger sisters, and brothers. She has no access to electricity but has piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Leticia runs a retail shop in Kisasi, one of the Kampala city suburbs, and that is how she earns a living. She uses public transport to and from shopping. She receives about 35 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and rent for her business premises is 30,000 per month. She has done this business for ten years now and is faced with the challenge of competition, as all her neighbors deal in retail businesses.

This is Leticia's seventh loan since she joined MCDT. She has been with MCDT for nine years, working this long with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more things for shop. She aspires to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more products for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Mohammad Y., the son of Mohammad Naser. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 48, married and has 5 children. He is a farmer and he loves his business and works hard on his land.

He wants to expand his business and buy the required tools for farming. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He is confident that he can expand his business as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchasing tools and expanding his business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine M. has worked for two years with her clothing business. With HSPFI assistance programs, she was able to mobilize her business. She buys slightly used clothes, shoes, pants, bed sheets and other garments in the city and sells them in her town and neighboring villages through peddling.

Josephine is already 46 years old and has six children to support. Her husband also supports the family with traditional gold-mining work. Josephine is a determined wife. She wants to improve their lives to continually send her children to school. She is in need of PHP11,000.00 to buy more stock such as slightly used clothes, shoes, pants and bed sheets for sale. Josephine wants also to repair her garment stall to properly display her clothing and other garments for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock like slightly used clothing, shoes, bed sheets and other garments for sale

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amonboy

texts.ru: Амонбою 51 год. Он женат и имеет 6-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. У них есть несколько дойных коров. Она сдаёт молоко оптом на рынок городским торговцам. Так как у городских людей нет дома коровы, молоко им приходится покупать на рынке. Спрос молочных продуктов очень высокий. Амонбой старается увеличить количество своего скота, это принисет ему больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Amonboy is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. He completed secondary school. His wife processes and sells milk. They have several dairy cows, and she markets milk wholesale to vendors in town. Since the people living in town do not keep cows at home, they are obliged to purchase their milk at the market; the demand for milk products is high. Amonboy is trying to increase the size of his herd to bring in more profit.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Libreta

texts.en:
Mrs. Libreta A. is one of the new members of HSPFI. She buys bananas and copra products from her neighbors and neighboring villages, and transports them to the city to sell. As a new member, she was assisted by HSPFI in managing her business.

Libreta is already 42 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City, in the northern part of Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a motorcycle driver and earns an average of PHP 200.00 a day. Knowing that her husband's income could not support the daily needs of their family, Libreta entered the micro finance program of HSPFI. She wants to have additional capital of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase more banana and copra product from neighboring villages. She wants to take advantage of the low price of banana and copra in her area, knowing that she can easily sell them in the city even if she doubles the price. Libreta is very grateful for the opportunity to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more banana and copra products to sell

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita A. owns a small piece of farm land in her village. She is 49 years old and all of her 3 children are in school. She is married to a farmer, Agustin A., and they have been together for 28 years already. Aside from growing rice, they also raise carabaos and goats. They work very hard to provide for their needs and the needs of their children.

Mercelita is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy quality rice seeds for her farm. The loan will truly help her continue her business and increase her harvest as well. She is planning to buy additional carabao for her farm. Instead of renting an expensive tractor to plow the field. Mercelita will use her carabaos for land preparation.

CEVI is recahing out to more farmers like Mercelita to sustain and gro3w their livelihood. CEVI provides not only loans to its clients, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase quality rice seeds

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita A. is a resident of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. She is 67 years old and married with eight children.

When Rita was granted her first loan from HSPFI, she used it in her fish vending business; she sells the fish through peddling. Until that business grows, she is also venturing into a buying and selling business. Banana and coconut planters are common in her area, but they find it difficult to transport their products to the market because it is so far away. Having this opportunity, Rita built a hut where she could put a bulk stock of copra products. Now most of her neighbors sell their bananas and copra to her at a lower price. Rita then becomes the wholesaler of these banana and copra products in the city.

Even with the growth she has already seen in this business, Rita still wants to increase her sales and earn more to support the needs of her grandsons and granddaughters, who are still in school. Right now, Rita needs a loan of PHP 11,000.00 to purchase more banana and copra products for sale. Rita thanks everyone for helping her gradually realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy more copra and banana products

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Mr. Restituto L. is very hardworking man who sells a variety of goods in his mini grocery store. Restituto wants to improve his living standard which is the reason why he is spending most of his time in managing his business. He opens his store everyday with the help of his children.

Restituto wants to add additional grocery items for sale in his store to eventually increase his sales and income. HSPFI assisted him through its microfinance program. Right now, Restituto needs an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional grocery items for sale like sugarcane, dairy products, beverages and rice.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale such as rice, sugar, beverages and dairy products

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sultan Mohammad

texts.en:
Sultan M. is the son of M. S.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 35 years old. He has been married since 2002. He has two children—one son and one daughter. He owns land and is busy farming. He is glad that he is busy working and with the money he receives he meets the needs of his family members and pays for their expenses.

He needs to have cultivated land and grow more seeds, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to purchase more seeds and the other needed materials. He is pleased that there is such an effective loan process to support the Afghan people.

loans.use: purchasing more seeds

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Mr. Ronie T., 23, is a resident of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. He is married and has a one-year old child. He is striving hard to earn more income to support his family’s needs and his child's future. With HSPFI assistance, he was able to open up a mini grocery store, where he sells canned goods, noodles, snacks, soft drinks, candies, chocolates and other items. Ronie’s store has the advantage of being located near Lumbia International Airport. Ronie plans to leverage the proximity to the airport and thus increase his income from the business. He requests a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase more goods to retail and to revovate and expand his store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stocks to retail and for expanding store

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. is 50 years old and has two children. She manages a small rice farm. The income generated from the farm is used to meet the basic needs of her family. She teaches her children to farm so that when they grow up they will know how to plant rice for their families. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI to buy diesel and seeds. She needs diesel to run the tractor to plow the field and requires good quality rice seeds to obtain maximum harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to help them start their own business. CEVI provides not only credit assistance but also trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase diesel and seeds

loans.name: Umirzok

texts.ru: Умирзоку 41 год. Он женат и отец 4-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Жена домохозяйка. Умирзок кредитуется у нас один год. За это время он увеличил количество своего скота. Скот является основным богатством и хлебом сельских людей. Поэтому они все стремятся увеличить количество своего скота. Умирзок тоже стремится к этому. Последний займ он потратил на покупку трех бычков. Через пол пол года они достаточно вырастут, чтобы продать их за хорошую цену.
texts.en:
Umirzok is 41 years old. He is married and the father of four children. He graduated from secondary school, and raises and sells cattle. His wife is a housewife. Umirzok has been a client of MicroInvest for one year, and in that time he has increased the size of his herd. Cattle are the basis of wealth and nourishment for rural people, so they all are striving to increase the size of their herds, just as Umirzok is doing. He spent his latest loan on the purchase of three bulls. In six months' time they will have grown sufficiently to be sold for a good price.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Ehena

texts.en: Mrs. Ehena H. is 42 years old and is married with six children. She is very industrious and a good client of HSPFI, who has been assisting her from the start of her business until now. Ehena ventures into different kinds of businesses. Aside from her grocery store, she also has a food vending stall, where she sells different types of viand and grilled chicken parts. With her savings from HSPFI, she is able to handle the demands of her customers, both at the store and at the food vending stall, with help from her husband. Ehena believes that she could maximize her income if she could get additional capital for her businesses. Hence she requests a loan of PHP 11,000. She extends her thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more stocks to retail

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa M. is 54 years old, a widower and has three children to support. She has been engaged in her buying and selling business for two years now. She buys raw banana, copra and raw potatoes in neighboring villages. With the help of her children, she delivers her products to the city every Friday.

Josefa wants to open up a mini-grocery store to cater for those slack days she has. With HSPFI's micro-finance program she was able to gain access for funding. She has already finished her small stall behind her house ready for her mini-grocery store business. To start her mini-grocery store, she needs an amount of PHP 5,000 to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To finance a mini-grocery store of her own

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor D. is 42 years old, married with eight children and currently residing at Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines.

Nestor wants to develop his farm which he planted with vegetables, banana and coconut. He believes that if his plants are treated with fertilizer it would bring him a good harvest and a good income. He is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000. Nestor thanks all Kiva lenders for the opportunity given to him.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his farm

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a cosmetics and clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar . She belongs to Mkorofi si mwenzetu group loan (Group code 2071). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for six hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics and clothes for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and clothes for her business

loans.name: Florence Namuwonge ‘S Group

texts.en:
Florence, a 36-year-old married mother of four schoolchildren between the ages of 7 and 16, owns a two-room house where she lives with six people and takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals per day.

For the past year, Florence has been selling second-hand clothes in the Owino market, one of the busiest in Kampala, where she averages 30 customers a day working seven days a week. Rent for her business location is 20000 UGX per month, and she also faces the challenges of high transportation costs and the rainy season, when customers are scarce. This will be Florence’s third loan since joining MCDT a year and a half ago, during which time she has worked with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes as she aspires to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita J., 59 and an active member of HSPFI, lives in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines, where she is supporting the education of her nephews. When she received her first loan from HSPFI, Rosita began a mini grocery store, and she is very grateful for the assistance that has made her business a success. Now, because of her experience in breeding and butchering pigs, Rosita wants to move into the livestock business. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 11,000.00 to finance this new venture.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and pig fodder.

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mohammad Yousof

texts.en:
Mohammad Yousof is the son of A.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 and has 6 children. He is a farmer and is interested in farming so much. Every morning he wakes up early and goes to his land to start work and because of the irrigation of his land he has lots of clients coming to his land to buy fresh vegetables.

He would like to expand his business and purchase more and different kinds of seeds, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He would like to say that he admires the effectiveness of the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: purchasing different kinds of seeds

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en: Roxanne buys and sells firewood in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, where she lives.  Married with two children, she started her business by using her own capital, but as demand grew, Roxanne approached HSPFI and was granted a loan of PHP 7,000.00. Her husband helps her in delivering the ordered firewood to their neighbors and neighboring villages. Roxanne believes that if she could have more stocks of firewood, she could also cater to other neighboring villages, thereby increasing her income. Therefore, she is requesting KIVA loan assistance of PHP 10,000.00 to increase her working capital.

loans.use: Additional working capital

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim K., 57, has formed a loan group with the other four members. K. has been selected by the other members to be the leader.

Currently, she and her husband have jobs as local cultivators. In additionally, they are also fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake which is an important place for fish to be found. The couple now lives with four children who are still single: two of them are employed working as massage staff in the hotel.

Recently, the family's investment is not going well because their equipment frequently breaks so that they can't catch as many fish as before. To solve the matter, K. would like a loan to purchase additional equipment for fishing activities.

The others borrowers are all people who live in Siem Reap Province. They are:

Mrs. P., who is a fisherman seeking a loan to buy a boat machine for her business. She was not available for the photograph so her husband is shown instead.

Mrs. S. is a rice farmer and a local fisherman and is requesting a loan to buy nets for fishing.

Mrs. C. sells groceries out of her home and needs a loan to increase her stock of groceries.

Mrs. P. is a fisherman applying for a loan to support her business operation.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for fishing activities

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
For two years now, Vilma has been operating her mini grocery store in her place in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines. Her direct customers are her neighbors, school teachers and students. Both Vilma and her husband are helping each other to bring a bright future to their nine children.

Since her business location has an advantage, Vilma wants to open a food-vending stall beside her mini grocery store. Food vending would be an easy business for her since her husband is a good cook. Vilma is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase cooking materials and food containers to be used in her food-vending stall.

She is expressing her thanks to HSPFI and to all Kiva lenders for bringing her family an opportunity to improve their living standard.

loans.use: To purchase cooking materials and food containers for her new food-vending stall

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy A. is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City with her husband and three children. Her husband manages their farm which is located two to three kilometers away from their house.

Daisy already had her business prior to her partnership with HSPFI. Yet she is very thankful, since HSPFI has been assisting her business by providing her with additional capital.

Daisy wants to help her husband in supporting the needs of their three children who are all in school. The opening class is fast approaching and so Daisy wants to take the opportunity to increase her merchandise for sale. She is requesting an additional loan of PHP 11,000 to buy additional stock such as school supplies, bottled water, soft drinks and variety of candies.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City with her husband and two children. She started her grocery-store business when she became a member of HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Carmela's business is very active due to the fact that her store is situated near the Lumbia International Airport. Her business is doing good.

Carmela's children are still young. Her eldest is 7 years old while her youngest is 3 years old. Her children inspire her to strive hard to prepare for their future. Her husband is assisting her in her grocery store.

Carmela wants to expand her store by adding additional stock to sell. Right now she is needing a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000.00 to buy additional canned goods and beverages as these are the most salable items in her store.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and beverages for her store

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: У Ахмада большой опыт животноводства. Он уже 30 лет занимается этим. У него есть большое количество скота. Но ему нужно передать сыновьям определенное количество каждому. У него трое сыновей. Двое из них уже женаты и у них отдельное домохозяйство. Но пока у них нет собственного скота. Теперь отец должен передать им определенное количество скота. Поэтому Ахмад берет кредит чтобы купить скот и увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Ahmad has a great deal of experience with livestock, as he has been in the business for 30 years. He has a large herd, but he needs sufficient cattle to divide amongst his three sons. Two of his sons are married and have their own households, however they do not have their own cattle and it is their father's obligation to provide them with a particular number of animals. Therefore, Ahmad is taking out a loan to purchase cattle to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is managing a small parcel of land as a rice farm. She is 38 years old and has four children. She also raises hogs which she thinks has supplemented their income. Rice and pigs are their only source of income to feed and clothe her family well. She started her rice farm four years ago. Until now, she still has her farm growing an abundant harvest.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. She will also use some of the loan to buy ducklings and start a duck business as well. The loan will truly help Elizabeth increase her yield and get her duck farm started.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides every poor family with a chance to have a livelihood. CEVI gives not only credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and ducklings

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is one of the active members of HSPFI. She has done well with her previous loans, which has made her business run well. Teresita is married with five children. Her husband assists her in their business. They both want to strive hard for their children who are all in school.

Teresita is very happy with the result of her investments and she is determined to continue growing these. Her previous loans are already repaid due to the success of her business. Teresita and her husband agreed to put up another mini grocery store in front of the school in their town. She is now requesting an additional loan of PHP 11,000.00 to finance the installation of her new grocery store.

loans.use: Finance the installation of new grocery store

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият – женщина 50 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. Хосият закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром каждую неделю. Её муж в Росии. Хосият уже 3 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Хосият расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию летней детской обуви. Теперь у Хосият увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Khosiyat is a woman of 50. She is married and has three children. She runs a business selling children's clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Khosiyat purchases goods at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Every week she goes there on a buying trip. Her husband is away from home working in Russia. Khosiyat has been a client of MicroInvest for three years. When she began, she had very little inventory, but now Khosiyat has expanded, and with her latest loan she purchased a lot of children's summer shoes. At present she is expanding her range of goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas P. is a pig grower. She is 53 years old and has six children. She is already a widow. Presently, she is a barangay (village) captain in her village. She has been raising pigs for 10 years already. "Because of it, I was able to send my children to school and provide their other needs," she said.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (the first Filipino MFI partner to go active with Kiva). She will use the loan to buy pig feed. The loan will help her grow her piggery business to support her children more.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and have their own business. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a native of Baliangao. She is 65 years old now. Her husband works as a government driver in their town. They have been blessed with four chidren. Marciana has a fishing business that she is hoping will eventually grow and develop so that they can save more for their retirement phase.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 for the purchase of parts to repair her motor boat. She said that if they have a good catch, they can easily pay their investment from it. She is so thankful to Paglaum because of the trust they have given her.

loans.use: To purchase motor boat parts for repairs.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio F. is managing a small piggery business. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. He is the caretaker of a building and is paid Php 600 a month. In 2004, he started his business by raising one pig. Now, he has plenty of pigs in his backyard, which helps him provide for the needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy two additional piglets and pig feed. The loan will help Bonifacio grow his business even more and earn a bigger income for his family.

CEVI is reaching out more pig farmers to grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides credit assistance. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage services to all its clients to help them grow their business.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and two piglets.

loans.name: Margie Rose

texts.en:
Margie lives in Misom, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is married to a motor driver. They had only one child. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 for the purchase of farm inputs, such as fertilizer, medicines, and labor expenses. The ricefield is a legacy from their parents.

Margie is positive that today's harvest would be greater than before based on what they have observed about how the palay grows and develops. The family's income is taken from her husband's driving income. It is used for their daily needs, especially on their meals and groceries. The couple is wishing that they can improve their way of living and finish their child's college course to allow for a decent job someday.

loans.use: To purchase rice fertilizer and medicines and pay for labor.

loans.name: Chhoeurng's Group

texts.en:
There are five people requesting this small loan, all residents of the province of Siem Reap. The members have selected Mrs. S., 45, to be the group leader. She is a good mother whose five children who are students pursuing individual studies and who still live in the family home. She works as a massage staff member in the hotel and gets a set salary of $80 a month to support her family's daily expenses. She is married to Mr. Chan, 38, who supports the family by fishing in and near Tunle Sap Lake. S. will use the loan to purchase a bicycle for her children so that they can ride it to their studies.

The other four borrowers are all local fisherwomen:

Mao C. is looking for a loan to repair her old house. Nuor Y is asking for a loan to buy fishing tools. (Nuor Y was not available for photographing so her husband is pictured instead.) Dung D. is applying for a loan to purchase a boat machine for her fishing business. Lonh K. is hoping for a loan to refurbish and decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle and to be applied toward the other group members' fishing businesses.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
M. Ruth is one of the executive members of Naalya agali awamu group in Kampala. She is a businesswoman with a retail shop that she has owned for over nine years. She has seen it grow ever since she joined her group and started getting loans for business expansion.

She is married with four children who are all in boarding schools and she is grateful that she has been working hand in hand with her husband who is the Deputy Headmaster of Naalya SS.

She needs a new loan to help with recapitalizing her shop with more sugar, rice, soap and milk that she buys in large quantities for profitability.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more sugar, soap, milk and rice

loans.name: Estrillita

texts.en:
Estrillita Q., a 57-year-old rice grower, has been a farmer since she was a child. She supplements her income by engaging in community service as a barangay health worker, monitoring the health of a specific number of people in their barrio.

Estrillita wants to grow her business to support her four children in school and is therefore requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (the First Filpino MFI partner to participate in KIVA microfunds) to help improve the condition of her farm’s soil. In this way, she believes that she will be able to increase her yield and better support her family.

CEVI, a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines, helps provide credit, training and insurance coverage to small businesspeople. CEVI helps small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase six bags of urea fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga Hoàng Thị was born in 1960. She has a shop at her home. She lives with her husband and two children. Mrs Nga's main job is farming. In addition, she sells vegetables and dry food at the market. Thus, her family has a stable source of income of 4,000,000 VND (approximately $225) per month.

Bích Nguyễn Thị was born in 1966. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND ( approximately $282) to buy goods to resell.

Hoa Nguyễn Thị was born in 1973. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her shop.

Kim Nguyễn Thị was born in 1974. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND ( approximately $233) to buy sugar cane to resell in the market.

Trang Nguyễn Thị Thùy was born in 1984. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy a motorbike to go to the market.

Hà Nguyễn Thị was born in 1973. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and dry food to sell

loans.name: Nurmat

texts.ru: Нурмат Мамидов 1977 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Нурмат   имеет во дворе несколько коз и овец. Сейчас его козы и овцы  находятся на пастбище на откорме. Его сын собирает стадо и с пастухом они идут в горы пастись  коз. В сезон огорода Нурмат  сажает в огороде репку , редиску и другие овощи. Кредит получил  месяц назад, для расширения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Nurmat M. was born in 1977. He is married and has five children. Although he did not complete any sort of higher education, Nurmat has several goats and sheep in his yard. At present his goats and sheep have been put out to pasture to fatten. His son gathers the flock, and he and the shepherd go into the hills to graze the goats. In season, Nurmat plants turnips, radishes and other vegetables in his garden. The loan he received last month is for increasing the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his herd

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en: Safina T. is a very enterprising business lady with a first business of brick laying. This has been beneficial to her family and general income, as well as reviving her other business of making samosas. She makes samosas with rice and peas, uses flour, onions and salt to spice them up, and fries them to supply to shops and schools around Naalya. She has 6 children who are all in school. She has been in her lending group for a long time. She will use her loan to buy more flour, onions, and other ingredients for making the samosas, as well as pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Buying flour, onions, and other ingredients for making the samosas, as well as pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Chinedu

texts.en: Chinedu is 29 years old and he is single without a child. He is a tailor and he also sells tailoring materials. He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando M., who has a duck farm business, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and duck feed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and duck feed.

loans.name: Tinh's Group

texts.en:
Tình Nguyễn Thị was born in 1965. She lives with her husband and three children in Luc Canh villarge Xuan Canh commune in the Đông Anh district in Hà Nội city. Her family has a car. Her husband is a driver and she helps him. They usually buy goods to resell in the market. They have a monthly income of about $224. She wants to borrow $310 to buy more goods. There are 6 members in her group: 
 Mai T. N. was born in 1967. She wants to borrow $243 to make clothes at home.
 Quy N. T. was born in 1964. She wants to borrow $260 to open a shop.
 Trang Ngo T. T. was born in 1979. She wants to borrow $260 to buy pigs and chickens to raise.
 Tý Đào Thị was born in 1960. She wants to borrow $243 to buy food for pigs and chickens.
 Thịnh Hoàng T. was born in 1972. She wants to borrow $184 to buy food for pigs.
 Được Nguyễn Thị was born in 1971. She wants to borrow $282 to invest her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 26 years old and he is single. He makes beautiful furniture like chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. He is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more woods to make more furniture to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more woods to make more furniture to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 52 years old and she is a widow with a child. She sells drinks and local gin. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more drinks and local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and local gin to sell

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Akakpo drah a commencé depuis 2005 le commerce en gros d’eau en sachet« pure water », des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et elle a beaucoup de clientèle. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de bien satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a remboursé. Elle demande un deuxième crédit pour acheter 20 cartons VOLTIC, 100 sachets VOLTIC, 25 cartons VITAL, 100 sachet VITAL, 06 sacs de riz et 05 bidons d’huile. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est fonctionnaire d’état et à 02 enfants qui font  l’école primaire.
texts.en:
A. began a business in 2005 selling, on a wholesale basis, bags of drinking water of the brand «pure water», sacks of rice and jerrycans of oil. This business is going well and she has lots of customers. Her present stock does not permit her to satisfy her customers' needs. She has already had one loan from WAGES and has reimbursed it correctly. She is requesting her second loan to buy 20 cases of VOLTIC, 100 bags of VOLTIC, 25 cases of VITAL, 100 bags of VITAL, 6 sacks of rice, and 5 jerrycans of oil. She is married to a gentleman who is a civil servant and has two children who are in primary school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags of drinking water, VOLTIC, sacks of rice and jerrycans of oil

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak H. is a villager living in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia, where he has been settled with his family members for years. He is currently providing for his family by driving a motor taxi, with which he can generate a stable income of $3 a day. To help meet the family's needs a little better, his wife is raising pigs for sale. Chak H. and his wife have eight children who are of school age. Chak H. sees his wife's business of raising pigs as a profitable one because pork is now commanding high prices. Therefore, Chak H. would like a $600 loan in order to purchase extra piglets for his wife to raise, and also to build more pigpens. (Chak H.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase piglets for his wife to raise.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en: Aliyu is 31 years old and he is married with 3 children. He sells dried fish. He purchases the dried fish from the northern part of Nigeria to sell in Benin city, Edo state. He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
D. Sharif is married and has two children. Eleven years ago, determined that his children should go to college to get ahead, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots so as to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. His experience in this kind of business allows him to expand his clientele day by day. 

Right now, Sharif needs a loan of $3,000. He is going to use the loan to purchase, process, and sell larger quantities of dried apricots. With your help, Sharif will someday be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and became honorable people.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots for expanding his business.

loans.name: Namboto

texts.en:
Namboto has been an egg and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the R'haigawanywi group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Namboto is 27 years old, married, and has a 7-year-old child.

loans.use: To  increase her current stock for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane O. is the leader of the Beat art and craft group in Jinja. She is a businesswoman whose business is selling local brews, including malwa, tonto, and waragi, to her customers. She now also makes a local brew herself, though on a small scale, and this has helped her to earn much more compared to when she had to buy solely from other brewers.

Jane has a dream of opening up a small retail shop from her home to add on her local brewing and farming business. Since she must sometimes attend to her farming, she employs two people to help her with the local brew business.

She needs a new loan to help with stocking yeast and bananas for making her brew.

loans.use: Buying bananas and yeast for making her local brew.

loans.name: Muhamadali

texts.en:
V. Muhamadali, 31 years old, is married and has three children. Muhamadali has been engaged in the business of selling clothing and shoes for the last 10 years. He has a truck, which allows him to carry his goods from the neighboring city every month. Muhamadali also provides transportation services on his truck. 

Muhamadali dreams of his children becoming educated people, and he is working hard toward this end. As a result, the business generates significant income, allowing him supporting his family. 

Currently, Muhamadali needs to purchase more clothing and shoes for expanding his business. For this purpose, he is requesting $1,500. This is his first loan; however, Muhamadali is sure he will pay the loan on time.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for expanding his business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores C. is a 59-year-old resident of Maasin, Tu-od, Manticao, Misamis Oriental in Southern Philippines. She is married to 62-year-old Luciano C. and blessed with four children. Her husband is a carpenter and a regular employee in a furniture shop. She engages in salabat (ginger tea) making and ginanggang (grilled banana).

Being a mother, Dolores find ways to earn an income for their living. Everyday, she peddles her salabat and ginanggang in their neighborhood and nearby villages. She wanted to expand her business but due to financial incapacity, the income from her business is not sufficient. Therefore, she wanted to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 7000 to purchase additional ginger and bananas for her business. Dolores is planning to put up a sari-sari (variety) store with her ginger tea and grilled banana displayed.

loans.use: To purchase additional stcoks of ginger and bananas

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
J. Rano has been selling foodstuff and drinks at her grocery store for the last 3 years. She is a true entrepreneur and studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Rano is Industrious and enterprising and focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $ 300. Rano is currently seeking a loan for 3000 Somoni for a term of 6 months. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Rano hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family.
