Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff for resale and increase her variety of goods

loans.name: Ruki

texts.en:
Ruki is 34 years old and is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs like rice and beans. She started this business in 2004.

Ruki hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
The small stone pigpen located in Siem Reap Province is used by Mrs. S. for raising pigs to earn a living. In her pig-raising business, she sells the mature pigs twice a year, four months after she begins raising them.

She is applying for a $300 loan to be used to buy additional piglets and to build one more stall for breeding pigs. S. is a widowed mother who has three children who are in school and still live in the family home.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and to build one more stall for breeding pigs

loans.name: Higinia

texts.en:
Higinia P. is a vegetable vendor. She grows squash, cabbage, tomatoes, eggplants and beans in her backyard and sells them to provide additional income for her family. Her husband, Leonito P. is a farmer. They have been together for 25 years already. They also raise chickens to supplement their income.

Higinia is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and chemicals for her vegetable garden. She also wants to buy more vegetable seeds so that she will have more vegetables to sell in the market.

CEVI is helping her grow her business even more. Now, she enjoys CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Amadatou

texts.fr: Madame S. est un residente du quartier d’agoè atsanvé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’oignons, elle exerce son activité dans le marché d’agoè atsanvé. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays parce que les oignons sont moins coûteux là bas. Son stock actuel d’oignons étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 19 sacs d’oignons. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a resident of the Agoè Atsanvé neighborhood, an outlying district of the town of Lomé. She sells onions in the market of Agoè Atsanvé. She buys her merchandise in the interior of the country because the onions cost less there. Her present stock of onions is expended so she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 19 sacks of onions. She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of onions for re-sale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
M. Mavjuda is 41 years old, married and has three children.

Mavjuda has been running a grocery store for the past seven years. She sells sweets (candies), preserved food, juices, soft drinks and other products in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Mavjuda is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again.

Mavjuda is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 4,000 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Mavjuda reach all of her aspirations.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods in her grocery shop

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has been a dressmaker and chicken seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

Maryam belongs to the M'mola group loan and is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her business. She hopes to increase her profit through this loan so that she will be able to grow her business as well as save money for future use.

Maryam is 50 years old and married. She has seven grown children, ages 30 to 35.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her dressmaker business.

loans.name: Azizullah

texts.en:
Azizullah is the son of Y. M.. He lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 39 and married. He lives in a family with 6 members, including his father and mother.

He needed to repair his house, but it was not possible for him because with the monthly salary he receives he can only pay for household expenses. When he heard about the loan process he decided to take out a loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 6 months to buy all the needed construction materials. He is grateful for this process.

loans.use: buying construction materials

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
K. Mariam is the leader of Dembe group in Jinja. She is a married woman with a hotel/restaurant business that she has been running for six years. She has four children that are all in school. The family live on top of the restaurant. She is also a farmer and most of the foodstuffs that she prepares in her restaurant come from her garden, hence enabling her to save.

Mariam needs to stock more rice for her restaurant since she doesn’t have a rice plantation at the moment and also to buy more sauce for the same purpose. Getting loans has enabled her to increase her daily income as well as to learn how to manage her business and save.

loans.use: To buy rice and sauce for her restaurant

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is 38 years old and married with three children. He sells bags of rice and beans on a wholesale and retail basis to his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Kankoè Dodji Atassé

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme célibataire exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de friperie, il a commencé cette activité en 2007, il s’approvisionne au marché local de Hedrzanowoé  où ce commerce est très développé , cette activité marche bien pour lui. Actuellement  le stock dont il dispose ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  1 balle de chemise et 1 balle de pantalon.
texts.en:
This young man is single, and he sells used clothing to earn a living. He began this business in 2007. He buys his merchandise at the local market of Hedrzanowoé where this business is widespread. The business is going well for him. Presently, the stock he has at his disposal does not allow him to satisfy the needs of his clientele. He would like to refurbish his inventory and is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 1 bale of shirts and 1 bale of trousers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma S. owns a small piggery. She raises pigs to help her husband earn a little income to support the growing needs of her family. She is 42 years old and has four children. Someday, she will have a bigger piggery so that she will be able to send all her children to college.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. And because she also manages a small rice farm, she will use some of her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI gives all its clients not just credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and four sacks of rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa sells bags of rice on a wholesale basis to his customers. He loves this business because he makes a lot of profits from it. He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of rice to sell. He is 25 years old and married with two children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en:
N. Musharraf is 26 years old. She is the loving wife and mother of two kids. For four years Musharraf has been running a store which she rents. She has been selling different kinds of paints and other tools necessary for house repairing. Over these years Musharraf has acquired the knowledge and skills required for her business. Since Musharraf started her store, she has been able to increase her clientele and in order to provide them with a good service, she is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni, which she will use to buy merchandise to increase her assortment of inventory.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa M., 44 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She lives in Neopoda Villages, Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. She buys and sells dried fish. She also engages in snack-making, particularly in the preparation of traditional Filipino delicacies like puto, cochinta, and biko.

Teresa works hard to earn money to provide for the needs of the family. She is very lucky to have a stall beside the mall and the stall rental is free. She started her business with the help of her brother's money.

Due to the increasing demands of her business, she wants to apply a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 4,000. She wishes to use this loan to purchase additional stocks of dried fish as well as ingredients for her snack-making. This will help Teresa to generate more income and supply the needs of her customers.

If granted, this will be her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish and ingredients for snack-making.

location.town: Tambo, Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
R. Dilorom lives in Isfara, a town of the Sugd region. She is a widow and has four chidlren. When her husband passed away, she was left without a steady income. Supporting this large family on her own is very difficult. Dilorom has to spend a lot of money on their education, clothing, food, etc. The love to her children allowed her to stand up against all the difficulties in her life.

Dilorom has two cows and four sheep. Now she wants to borrow money to buy more calves. She hopes in that way to earn more and to be able to continue providing her children with education.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more calves in order to expand her business and continue to provide education for her children

loans.name: Abdul Habib

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Abdul Habib, the son of M. R.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an oil seller and most of the other shops and people buy oil from his shop.

He wants to make his business vast and make it larger. He needs to take a loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 6 months. He is confident that he will progress in his business as soon as possible. He wants to say that Kiva is an effective process.

loans.use: expanding his business

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa has been a clothes and bites (bread and badia) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Each day she works at her business for eight hours.

Mtumwa is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mtumwa is married, and has seven children: ages 22, 19, 18, 12, 9, 6 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependent.

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rukia, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell, to expand her business

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Y. Azamat is a 26 year old, is married and has a child. Azamat owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by it.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase his stock. Azamat is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa L. lives with her husband and two teenage daughters in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her two daughters are both students in a local high school.

Dariimaa has a small retail business selling women’s and men's clothing. She started the business ten years ago by renting a small stall in the local market and since then has expanded it significantly. She now has two rented stalls in the town's largest outdoor market and another two stalls in a local mall. She travels to Ereen, China, a border town where many goods are imported to Mongolia, and purchases inexpensive clothes for her business. In the future, she hopes to have her own shop instead of paying high rent.

Dariimaa requests a loan to purchase more women’s and men’s clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more women's and men's clothes from Ereen, China

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en:
Semeni has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to R'haigawanywi group loan (Group code 2080). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Semeni is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell so as to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.

Semeni is 33 years old, married, and has six children with ages between 7 years and 1 month.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell so as to expand her business

loans.name: Atoullo

texts.en:
K. Atoullo is a 29-year-old man who is married and has two children. Atoullo’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life so that he can get ahead and fulfill his goals.

He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Dushanbe City in search of customers. He has owned his business for two years. 

Today, Atoullo is planning to replace the fuel supply system of his taxi with one using liquified gas, as the gas is cheaper than petrol (gasoline). For this purpose he wants to borrow $800.

He sincerely thanks Kiva and all its lenders for making this help possible.

loans.use: To buy a kapron gas-cylinder for the taxi's fuel supply system

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is twenty-six years old and he is single with no children. He sells pepper soup and drinks in his restaurant. He hopes for the loan of $475 to purchase more drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: N. Jane is the leader of Akuwa Olukaba group in Jinja. She has a business of a retail shop that she has owned for 10 years. In the shop, Jane sells sugar, salt, oils, Vaseline, groundnuts, rice etc and she is happy that her shop has expended ever since she started getting loans. She is a mother of 7 children of which 4 are in school and she works hard to ensure that their school fees is paid on time. Jane needs a new loan that will help her restock her shop with more quantities of the goods she sells in the shop. Jane is also a farmer and the food she grows helps her save on the money she would have used on purchasing the same food that she grows now. She is surely grateful for the loans they get.

loans.use: To buy rice and sauce for her restaurant.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans sells phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards. He is thirty years old and single with no children. He hopes for the loan of $675 to purchase more phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.en:
A. Abdukahor is a successful entrepreneur, father and dedicated husband. He has five children who inspire him to work hard. Abdukahor began a small grocery store twelve years ago with a small amount of capital from his savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of $1000  so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Abdukahor is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a wider range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa S. lives with her husband in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Davaa's family has three grown-up children, two of whom live independently from their parents. Her youngest daughter is a university student. Davaa has a small business making shoes. With her husband's help, Davaa started the shoe-making business in 2000. Since then the business has been doing very well. Working capital has increased from $70 to $700. Davaa buys raw materials from the local market and makes winter and spring shoes for women and men. Davaa pays her youngest daughter's university tuition from her profit. In the future, Davaa hopes to expand the shoe-making business by hiring another person. She requests a loan to purchase the materials needed for her shoe-making business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shoe-making business.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Марифат занимается продажей тканей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Она продает только национальные ткани. Марифат закупает товар на оптовых рынках "Атуш-базар" и "Сомон-базар". Она кредитуется у нас уже 2 года. За этот период времени Марифат увеличила свой ассортимент. У нее очень красивый и дорогой товар, который пользуется очень большим спросом между молодых девушек и женщин. Но теперь Марифат хотела-бы завезти партию европейской ткани. Но для этого ей потребуется большая сумма денег. Марифат накопила определенную сумму, но ей не хватило еще немного. Этот займ она потратит на закупку первой партии европейской ткани.
texts.en:
Marifat sells fabric at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. She only sells traditional fabrics. Marifat purchases her wares at the Atush and Somon Bazaar wholesale markets. For the past two years she has been a client of MicroInvest. During that time, Marifat has increased the range of goods she sells. She has very beautiful and expensive goods, which are in high demand amongst young girls and women. Now Marifat would like to import a selection of European fabrics; however, she needs a large sum of money to do so. Marifat has saved a certain amount, but she does not have quite enough. She would spend this loan on the purchase of her first lot of European fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fabric

loans.name: Oyatullo

texts.en:
N. Oyatullo is twenty-eight years old. He is married and has one child. Oyatullo’s wife is a housekeeper. Oyatullo works hard as he is the only breadwinner in the family. For two years he has been selling bedclothes and towels. Oyatullo buys the goods from the market “Korvon”. He tries to choose a variety of goods of high quality and attractive prices which helps him keep his clientele. The business brings in a stable income and allows Oyatullo to improve the living conditions of his family. Today Oyatullo requests $700 to purchase more bedclothes and towels in order to increase the range of the products he sells. He would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly in ten months. The progress of Oyatullo’s business is in your hands. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean C. is managing a small piggery in her village. She is forty years old and all of her four children are in school. She wants to expand her business. Aside from the pigs, she also grows rice to supplement the income of her family. Her husband, Rodrigo C., manages their rice farm. Some of their harvest is intended for family use and the rest is sold to meet living expenses.

She is requesting a loan of $225 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. She will also use some of her loan to buy fertilizers and quality rice seeds.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. It gives credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy pigs, feed, fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Lê Thị was born in 1958. She lives in Xuan Trach Villarge. Her main job is farming. Every day, she receives paper to make pockets. Presently, she lives with her husband, her mother-in-law and three children. Her family has a monthly income of about $190. She wants to borrow $356. She is a group leader. There are five other loan participants in her group .
 Hằng Hoàng Thị was born in 1981.  She wants to borrow $282 to buy scrap paper to make pockets.
 Thuyên Lê Thị was born in 1966. She wants to borrow $282 to repair her house. 
 Xuân Lê Thị was born in 1954. She wants to borrow $233 to buy food for pigs.
 Xiêm Nguyễn Thị was born in 1966. She wants to borrow $110 to buy eggs to resell in the market.
 Thu Lê Thị was born in 1963. She wants to borrow $233 to buy pigs and food for them.

loans.use: To buy pigs, eggs and scrap paper.

loans.name: Siem

texts.en: Mrs. Siem H. inherited almost one hectare of farmland from her grandparents who wasted away for a long time, while she cultivated their vegetable crops. She has been working in the farming business with her husband for more tH. twenty years. The family lives with one son who helps with the family's needs by working as a construction foreman. Because Siem H. thinks her son's investment in the business would help generate a stable income for their family, she would like an $800 loan for her son to use as capital in the operation of the family's farming business. The family lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To use as capital

loans.name: Shernazar

texts.en:
A. Shernazar has been a livestock farmer since 2004. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has two children who need him to support them and to provide a proper education for them. Shernazar has improved his financial situation considering that his father is also a cattle breeder. From childhood he has gained rich experience in the livestock business. His biggest dream now is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivatives (such as dairy products) to the surrounding community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Shernazar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She belongs to Mshikamano  group loan (Group code 2016).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga (which are colorful, printed cotton garments), DVDs and other items. She wants to increase her current stock to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money for future use.  

Asha is forty-five years old, married, and has five children, ages twenty-five, twenty-two, twenty-one, twenty and eighteen.

loans.use: To buy more Khanga, DVD, and other items to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga T. lives with his wife and daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is four years old and goes to kindergarten. Battulga has a small business distributing milk. With his small truck, he goes to herder families nearby and purchases their milk at wholesale prices. Once he collects the milk he transports it to the supermarkets and food retail stores to sell for a profit. He has a contract to provide a daily milk supply for a few domestic supermarkets. With his profit he was able to purchase the small truck that he currently drives to collect milk. Battulga dreams of building and owning a milk distribution center in the city. He requests a loan to purchase more milk from herder families.

loans.use: To purchase more milk from herder families.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
T. Saodat is forty-four years old and married with three children. Ever since she was married, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price in order to increase her profits. She currently has three cows.  Saodat wants to expand her business and since her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. She is asking for a loan of $700 for the term of nine months in order to purchase cattle. Saodat expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is twenty-eight years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods like rice, plantain and fufu (which is a dough-like ball used to dip into stew). She hopes for the loan amount of $275 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tuwewakweli Group

texts.en:
Bimtoro owns a small charcoal store, and she has also sold clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Bimtoro is forty-six years old, married, and has two children, ages twenty-three and twenty-two. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Aziza, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en: Ariunaa B. lives with her teenage daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has been working in South Korea with a work contract, for the last four years. It is quite common in Mongolia to go to South Korea and work. The work does not usually require any skills or language fluency and pays better than many other alternatives in Mongolia. These Mongolian contract workers usually work in construction and heavy manufacturing. In 2007, Ariunaa launched a small business in making women's bags with remitted money from her husband. In the beginning, she started making small bags for cosmetics and leather book covers. She went to local markets to promote and sell her bags. The business has done well and she has found some trusted retailers who sell her bags in their stalls at the local market. Now, she also makes women's bags from pre-orders sent by her clients. In addition to bags, she is the exclusive seamstress for local Christian churches' Bible covers.  She requests a loan to purchase a sewing machine and more leather.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and more leather

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Mrs. Ruby P., forty-one years old, is a resident of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is married and blessed with three children. She runs her mini-grocery store where she sells biscuits, dairy products, soft drinks, a variety of candies, soap and shampoo. Her husband is also contributing an income to their family with his peddling business. Ruby wants to save more for her children's future. She is thanking HSPFI and KIVA lenders for extending assistance to her business. Ruby is now requesting an additional loan of $250 to purchase more stock and to add more merchandise to her store such as rice, beverages and spices.

loans.use: Additional working capital

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sachet water (packaged/bottled "pure" water) in wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine M. is an active member of HSPFI. She is now on her fourth credit cycle. She's been running her grocery store for two years now. She sells rice, sugar, soap, dairy products, and beverages.

Josephine is a mother of seven. She wants to give them a good future by continually sending them all to school. Being a determined wife, she hopes to have more income. According to her, she could surely earn more if she could access additional capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to buy more merchandise to sell.

Josephine extends her thanks and appreciations to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar O. is 46, married and the father of three. All three children are attending elementary school. His family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

In 1997, he started a wholesale meat business at the local market "Huchit shonhor". Tumurbaatar has an old Russian pick-up truck which he uses once every two or three months to pick up meat in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He buys whole animals such as sheep, cows and horses with 4.5 million tugrugs ($1.00=1450 MNT) to re-sell for a higher price.

In 2008, his spouse, Enhtuya, joined him in his business. She rents a stall for 200,000 tugrugs at "Asait," one of the local food markets, to sell meat. Their working capital has now increased to 5.8 million tugrugs and their average monthly income is 8 million tugrugs. Tumurbaatar requests a loan to buy more whole animals to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: to buy more whole animals

loans.name: Mehrabudin

texts.en:
Mehrabudin is the son of M. G.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has six children. He owns land on which he works hard to earn more money and to achieve all the goals of his family members.

He has been involved in this business since he was a child. His father was a farmer and he learned how to work on the land from his father. He is very interested in farming and would like to progress well, so he wants to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 10 months.

He would like to mention that this is the best process which can support all entrepreneurs to expand her or his business and be a good businessperson in the future.

loans.use: progressing business

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy M. is 26 years of age and comes from Brgy. Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental. He lives there with his wife and three children. They have their "sari-sari" (variety) store and his wife is obliged to care for it. it. People from their area who can not visit the downtown city will go over to Randy’s sari-sari store and buy their needs.

Randy is always optimistic for their business. He is happy that somehow he can extend help to his fellow villagers. Randy is very grateful that he became an active member of HSPFI (Kiva Partner), for that means he is able to have assistance for his business. As of this time, he is planning an expansion of his sari-sari store, and to that end, he is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. Randy now is aspiring for the success of what he had started.

loans.use: acquiring additional goods intended for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam B. is 44, married, and the father of three. He has one son who is a 19-year-old university student. His two daughters go to elementary school. Dorjpalam's family lives in a "ger" (nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

In 2006, together with his spouse Bulgantamir, he started running a family business selling dairy products by going door to door. Then in 2008, they rented a food stall at the local food market "Terh" that sells products such as flour, rice, and a variety of vegetables. His wife works as a saleswoman at their stall while Dorjpalam buys and picks the goods. His working capital is 3.0 million tugrugs. He is a friendly and kind person.

Dorjpalam requests a loan to buy more food products to increase his inventory. His hope is to have his own grocery store. In the picture: Bulgantamir, Dorjpalam's wife, is at their food stall.

loans.use: To buy more food products to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Khalda Group

texts.en:
Khalda is the group leader of Khalda group. There are six members in this group. Each of them wants to expand their business and they want to take a loan of 84000 Afghani.

Khalda wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a fruit and greenery shop. Shahpary wants to take a loan for a tailoring business, because she wants to buy a new machine for her business. Shams want to take a loan for a general store where he sells different kinds of things and supports all of his family members. Gul Indaram wants to take a loan for a metal working shop. Nawab wants to take a loan for a stationary shop. Ehsanullah wants to take a loan for a car part shop. 

They are very happy about this process of small loans in Afghanistan and want to thank especially Kiva and all lenders around world.

loans.use: for the progress of their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various vegetable seeds

loans.name: Arthuro

texts.en:
Arthuro O. is a man full of determination in life. He is 25 years old. He lives in Brgy Tumpagon Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental. He has a satisfying existence with his wife and four children.

Arthuro is involved in a mini grocery store business. This is Arthuro's one regular source of income. Thru this business he is able to support the needs of his family and is proud to be able to send his children to school. With his evaluation, there are still more people in their place who need the service of his business.

Due to the extent of demand of his customers Arthuro decided to expand his store a little. Arthuro wants to utilize the program available through HSPFI; Arthuro is extending his warmth appreciation to the organization for helping the improvement of the business. At present , he is requesting for a loan of Php 11,000 for the procurement of additional goods intended for selling. Arthuro is looking forward with confidence that his request will be granted.

loans.use: purchase of additional goods intended for selling

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en: Bumi is 36 years old and she is married with five children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream. She hopes for a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis has been a bread and stone seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for eight hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. This will allow her to save money for future use. 

Mwanahamis is 30 years old, married, and has three children of ages 15, 12, and 4. She also cares for three additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mariam, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
The man pictured is M. Nahim, the son of H. M. Z.. He is 25 and lives in Kabul in a family with seven members. He is a farmer and he works on the land together with his father.

He loves to work hard and to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy more seeds and tools for the land.

He wants to state that this is the only process that can support an entrepreneur to bring a new change in his business.

loans.use: buying more seeds for farming

loans.name: Abdusobur

texts.ru: Абдусобур - молодой мужчина 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Пасет свой скот в горах. С раннего утра до позднего вечера он пасет скот. А в выходные ездит на рынок, чтобы купить или продать скот. Иногда он покупает быка, чтобы заколоть и продать мяснику. Это очень выгодно для него. На этот новый займ он покупает 2 коровы и теленка. Одна из них дойная корова. Жена очень обрадовалась дойной корове. Теперь она будет доить молоко для семьи и для продажи.
texts.en:
Abdusobur is a young man of 36. He is married and has two children. He raises and sells cattle, which he grazes in the hills. From early in the morning till late in the evening he herds his cattle, and on weekends he travels to market to buy and sell cattle. Sometimes he purchases a steer to slaughter and sell to the butcher, which is very profitable. With his latest loan, he purchased two cows and a calf. One of them is a milk cow, with which his wife is delighted. Now she has milk for the family and for sale.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en: An T. A. D. was born in 1983. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a driver. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND ($196 USD). She is asking for a loan of 1,972,000 VND ($110 USD) to buy flowers and fruits to sell. The other group member is Lan N. T., who was born in 1978. She hopes to borrow 2,204,000 VND ($124 USD) to be repaid in six months. She will use the loan to buy food for pigs and chicken.

loans.use: to buy flowers and fruits to resell

loans.name: Fatumah's Group

texts.en: Fatumah B. is the leader of Mukisa group in Butiki, Jinja. She is a hard-working lady who runs a business selling clothes. She buys garments for her shop from Jinja, Iganga and sometimes from Kampala, depending on the prices at the time. Fatumah sells mostly womenswear and childrenswear, both brand new and used, and this has enabled her to win many customers with different tastes. She has run her shop for four years now, and she hopes that it will grow more and more. Fatumah needs a loan to help buy a bale of clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy a bale of clothes to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 29 years old and married with three children. She sells groceries and drinks for a living. Margaret is requesting the loan amount of N40 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leuk's Group

texts.en:
This loan request is from a small group of four people, all residents of Siem Reap province. Mrs Leuk S. has been selected to be the group leader by the members. S. owns a small shop selling soft drinks to her neighbors in her village. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, and he also helps his wife transport products from the market to sell at their shop. They have four children who are students and still live in the family home. To earn additional income, Leuk S. has requested a loan to purchase a variety of soft drinks to sell in her store.

The other three borrowers are:
– K., who rents comfortable rooms to tourists for income, and needs a loan in order to fulfill her customers' requirements
– K., who sells breakfast food to the villagers, and has applied for a loan to buy her cooking ingredients
– S., a grocery seller looking for a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell in her shop

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 51 years old and she is married with 8 children. She sells women's clothes and shoes and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more women's clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
This is Marie B., Rev. Sia L. M’bayo, Isatu J., Kadie K., and Regina G.. They named their group Faith. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and quality of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve their standards of living.

Marie (left) is the leader of this group. Marie is forty-four years of age. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. Two of her children are already grown-ups and two are attending schools and the last is in nursery school. Marie sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and she has been in this business for seven years now. She will use this loan to buy two barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm-oil.

loans.use: Buy two barters of palm-oil

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien N. T. was born in 1981. Her family has a flower shop. She usually buys flowers from the farmers and then re-sells them at her shop.  She is requesting 5.014.000 VND (about 282 USD) to have more capital to buy more flowers.
 
  Tam T. Thanh was born in 1961 and wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (about 257 USD) over 12 months to buy food for pigs.

  Đào Thị Lê was born in 1986. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (about 233 USD) to buy feed for pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy flowers for re-sale

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.ru: Тошпулот занимается откормом и продажей скота. Как и все сельские мужчины, он стремится к увеличению количества своего скота. Ему сейчас 52 года, и у него есть 5 детей. Трое из них сыновья, которым он должен разделить скот поровну. Ну и конечно некоторое количество оставить себе. Дочерям по обычаю, скот не дают. У Тошпулота стадо овец и коз. Дома есть два быка. За очередной займ Тошпулот хочет закупить еще два быка.
texts.en:
Toshpulot's business is buying, raising and re-selling livestock. Like all village men, he would like to increase the number of animals he owns. Toshpulot is 52 years old and has five children. He must divide his herd equally among his three sons (by custom, daughters do not typically receive a share) although Toshpulot would also like to keep some animals for himself. He has a flock of sheep and a herd of goats, as well as two bulls. Toshpulot would like to receive a loan in order to purchase two more bulls.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
This is Esther P., Madinatu K., Hanna Davis, Josetta Decker, and Yomie Lumpkin. They named their group Trust in God. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them to give a boost to their businesses.

Esther P. (right) is the leader of this group. Esther is thirty-eight years of age. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is single with two children who are in nursery and class one. Esther has been in business for three years now. She sells soap.

loans.use: Invest in her soap-selling business

loans.name: Abdul Salam Feroz

texts.en:
Abdul Salam Feroz is the son of K. D.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is single, but still feels many responsibilities towards his family members. He is a hard-working young boy. He has a metal shop in which he is very busy, working 7 days a week.

He would like to expand his business and buy all his required business materials, so he wants to take out a loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He would like to progress as soon as possible and bring changes in his life.

loans.use: buying required materials for metal shop

loans.name: Maris

texts.en: Maris is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She sells provisions such as noodles, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Osatite

texts.en: Osatite is 30 years old and single. He has a boutique where he sells clothes. He hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more clothes to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Mariama M., Issa K., Safiatu T., Fudia K. and Adijatu I.K A.. They named their group Sorbeh. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone Leones. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve on their standards of living.

Mariama (left) is the leader of this group. Mariama is forty-nine years of age. She was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married and the two of them have three children together. One of their children is in college and the two are still in secondary schools. Mariama sells items like biscuits, lollipops, cigarettes, tins of milk, batteries, pencils etc. She has been in this business for seven years now.

loans.use: Expand on her business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она кредитуется у нас уже 2 года. За этот период времени она расширила свой ассортимент. Сейчас она продает детскую одежду и обувь. Сейчас ей 49 лет. Замужем. Мать 4-х детей. Её муж занимается частным извозом. Старшую дочь она выдала замуж. В следующем году хочет женить сына. Поэтому она старается расширить бизнес и открыть вторую точку продажи. На второй точке продажи будет сидеть ее дочь.
texts.en:
Marhabo sells children’s clothes in Panchshanbe market in Khujand. She buys the goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She has financed her business through us for two years. During this time, she has expanded her inventory. Now she sells children's clothes and shoes. Currently, she is 49, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a delivery man. She has given her oldest daughter in marriage. Next year, she wishes to marry off her son. Therefore, she is trying to expand the business and to open a second point of sale. Her daughter will run the second shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling children's clothes

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 37 years old and she is married with four children. She sells provisions like rice and beans. She has been in this business for a long time.

She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata  Touré  est âgée de 43 ans,  veuve  et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit  dans le domicile de son feu mari et ses enfants au quartier Bougoufié de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aminata a abandonné l’école en classe de neuvième année fondamentale       (système éducatif malien) pour se marier par  la volonté parentale. Elle commença le commerce suite au décès  de son mari, avec la vente de gâteaux. Ce commerce lui a permis de comprendre les règles du commerce et de savoir faire le marketing de ses produits. Après le gâteau,  ce fut le commerce du l’ail et d’échalote, qu’elle mène depuis 17 ans au marché château. Elle est très connue dans ce créneau et jouit d’une grande notoriété pour la qualité de ses articles.
Dans l’intention d’avoir plus de marchandises afin de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 36 mois. Après 2 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 250 000 FCFA, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 3 sacs de l’ail et 3 sacs d’échalote. Elle s’approvisionne à partir du Burkina Faso. Madame   Aminata  Touré vend, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à subvenir aux  charges de la famille (achat de nourriture, habillements des enfants et paiement des frais de scolarité).
Son ambition est de transformer sa maison du banco en dure.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata Touré, age 43, is a widow and the mother of three. She and her children live in her late husband’s house in the Bougoufié district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). She dropped out of school in the 9th basic year (education system in Mali) to get married by parental requirements. She started a business following the death of her husband and sold cakes. This business enabled her to understand the rules of commerce and to find out about marketing her merchandise. After selling cakes, it was garlic and shallots that she sold for seventeen years at the Chateau marketplace. She is very well known in this niche and enjoys great distinction for the quality of her goods.

Wanting to obtain more merchandise in order to realize a lot of profit, she has turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 36 months. After two solidarity loans, and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan in the amount of 250,000 francs CFA. She intends to use this loan to buy three sacks of garlic and three sacks of shallots. Supplies are gotten from Burkina Faso. She sells at the retail level to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will serve to cover family expenses (to buy food and clothing for the children and to pay the schooling costs). Her ambition is to transform her house from adobe to something hard.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 28 years old and single without any children. She sells medicines. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is an active LAPO client. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Assanatou    D.  est âgée de 42 ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygamique avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle a très vite abandonné l’école pour mener le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait de l’arachide. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière elle a pu maîtriser le commerce et finit par évoluer seule. Elle commença  par la vente de produits de beauté mais décida finalement de s’installer dans la fabrication et vente de savon local. Cette activité elle la pratique depuis 3 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et réputation qui dépasse le cadre de son quartier de résidence.
Pour faire du savon, elle a besoin de 10 kg de soude caustique + 5 kg de sel iodé, ensuite  elle mélange ses éléments à l’aide d’une grande louche pendant une heure jusqu'à avoir la pâte savonneuse, qui une fois refroidit et asséchée (pendant des heures) sera mis en boule pour être vendu.
Dans l’intention de pérenniser son activité  elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois. Après 5 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 400 000 FCFA.
 Elle compte l’utiliser pour avoir une barrique vide, 2 baignoires et 40 kg de soude caustique. Elle s’approvisionne sur place en matières premières et effectue ses ventes  au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de prendre certaines charges familiales surtout les dépenses des enfants. 
Son ambition de vendre des chaussures parallèlement à son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Assanatou D., age 42, is married and the mother of seven. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and their children in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). She very quickly dropped out of school to work in commerce with her mother, who used to sell peanuts. After several years at her mother’s side, she was able to master commerce and eventually advance on her own. She started by selling beauty products but decided in the end to get situated in the making and selling of local soaps. This has been her work for three years, and she enjoys a large customer base and a reputation surpassing the confines of her district where she lives.

To make soap, she needs 10 kg of caustic soda plus 5 kg of iodized salt. Then she mixes the elements with the aid of a large ladle for an hour until a soapy paste is obtained. Once it is cooled and dried (over a few hours), it is formed into balls to be sold.

Wanting to perpetuate her business, she has turned towards Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 42 months. After five solidarity loans and one individual loan, she is now on her second individual loan in the amount of 400,000 francs CFA. She intends to use it to obtain an empty barrel, two bath tubs, and 40 kg of caustic soda. Supplies of raw materials are gotten locally, and sales are made at the retail level to customers composed primarily of women, cash or credit accepted.

She intends to realize a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will enable her to cover certain family expenses, especially those of the children. Her ambition is to sell shoes concurrently.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making local soaps

loans.name: Askarjon

texts.ru: Аскарчон занимается продажей масла на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Он продает хлопковое масло, говяжий жир, растительное масло и сливочное масло. Разные масла он закупает в разных местах. Хлопковое масло он закупает хлопковом заводе, растительное и сливочное масло ему поставляет фирма. А говяжий жир он закупает у мясников. Еще он продает иранские масла "Мумин", которые поставляет та же фирма. Сейчас масла подешевело. И поэтому торговля пошла лучше. Аскарчон планирует расширить свой бизнес и открыть свой магазин.
texts.en:
Askarjon sells oil in Panchshanbe market in Khujand. He sells cottonseed oil, suet, vegetable oil, and butter. He buys different oils in different places. He buys cottonseed oil from a cotton factory; vegetable oil and butter is delivered by another company. And he buys the suet from butchers. Additionally, he sells an Iranian oil called "Mumin" which is delivered by the same company. Currently, the price of oil has fallen, and consequently his trade has gotten better. Askarjon plans to expand his business and to open up his own shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling oil

loans.name: Gomonay

texts.en:
T. Gomonay is from Tumpagon ,Cagayan de Oro, Philippines. She is 38 years old. She is blessed with three children. Her husband is in farming.

T. is involved in running a mini grocery business thru the help of HSPFI (Kiva Partner). T. and her husband help each other to raise their family well. She always does the accounts for her store to know if her business is growing. T. assesses her business very well.

T.'s business helps a lot, not only for her family but also the people living in their village. T. now needs additional money to purchase additional stock for her mini-grocery. She is now applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 as additional capital. T. is looking forward to the great help that would be rendered to her business.

loans.use: purchase of additional items for their mini-grocery

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Madame   Assétou   Keita  est âgée de 53 ans,  mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygamique avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle ne commença le commerce qu’après son mariage, en vu d’épauler son mari (bien qu’il occupe un haut poste dans l’administration) dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Elle mena plusieurs activités telles que la vente de condiments et de fruits. Elle opta  finalement pour  le commerce d’habits et de chaussures qu’elle mène depuis 27 ans chez elle ou en ambulant. Nantie d’une grande clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes lettrées, son dynamisme fait d’elle une grande commerçante détaillante de Médine avec ses habits  de hauts  de gammes.
Dans l’optique de satisfaire permanemment sa clientèle elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 500 000FCFA, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  au Burkina Faso. Madame   Assétou   Keita vend, en détail au comptant et à crédit.. 
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à prendre en charge certaines familiales (achat de savons, charbons et habits des enfants) et de honorer ses dettes. 
Son ambition est de construire des maisons pour usage personnel et location.
texts.en:
Ms. Assétou Keita, age 53, is married and the mother of four. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Médine district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having dropped out of school very early on for societal reasons, she started a business only after her marriage and with the goal of supporting her husband (even though he has a high position in the administration) in meeting family needs. She did several kinds of work, such as selling condiments and fruit. She opted in the end for commerce in clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for 27 years working out of her house or going door-to-door. Bestowed with a large customer base composed mostly of educated women, she has become a great retail merchant in Médine due to her dynamism and her high-end clothing.

From the perspective of satisfying her customers indefinitely, she has turned towards Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 48 months. After four solidarity loans and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA. She intends to use the loan to buy fifty bolts of Wax pagne cloth in Burkina Faso. She makes her sales at the retail level and accepts cash and credit.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover certain family expenses (to buy soap, charcoal, and children's clothing) and to honor her debts. Her ambition is to build houses for personal use and for renting out.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Махмудова Марина жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 47 лет, вдова и имеет троих детей. Имеет высшее образование . Всю жэизнь проработала учителем в средней школе. Но после смерти мужа , пять лет назад занялась бизнесом. Торгует рисом на Гисарском рынке "Сомон".Старший  сын работает в средней школе учителем.Сейчас цены на рис растут , в связи с сезоном. Поэтому она решила получить кредит и сделать запас рисом. Это поможет сохранить цены до нового урожая и не потерять клиентов.
texts.en:
Marina M. lives in the Gissar district. She is 47 years old and a widow with three children. She completed a college education. She has always been a middle school teacher, but after her husband's death five years ago she started a business as well, selling rice at Gissar's Somon Market. In this season of the year rice prices rise, so she decided to apply for a loan to buy a reserve of rice. This will help her maintain prices until the new harvest so she doesn't lose customers. Her eldest son is also a middle school teacher.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani A. is a 42-year-old businesswoman from Tumpagon, Cagayan de oro City,Misamis Oriental. She is blissfully happy with her seven children; four of them are in school and the rest stay with her and help her with the daily chores.

Lani owns a mini-grocery store in their township. She sells different goods when her customers express a need for them. Her buyers are all from their neighborhood.

When she decided to put up her business she used her own savings. As time went on , she perceived that her business was growing. For her to accommodate the demand of her customers, she needs an expansion for her mini-grocery store. She pledged to be a member of HSPFI (KIVA Partner). At the present time, Lani is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. She is hopeful that this would possibly be done. Formally, she wants to send her appreciation to the organization for the support given her.

loans.use: purchase of additional goods for re-sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 32 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She sells baby things such as cream, powder, clothes, flasks, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 80,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
Fredelyn M. is one of the participative members of HSPFI. She lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Traditional gold mining is common where they live and most residents do this as another source of income. Fredelyn buys gold from traditional miners and processes it into jewelry. She is been in this business for almost a year. She then sells the jewelry in the city.

Fredelyn joined HSPFI micro-finance program and she was granted a loan of PHP 8,000. Right now, Fredelyn needs an additional capital of PHP 11,000 to cater for neighboring villagers who drop in at her house to sell grams of gold.

Fredelyn believes that this is a great opportunity for her family to improve their living. She also aims to open up a little jewelry shop soon. That is why, she is soliciting KIVA lenders once again to help her fulfill her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to procure  additional raw materials  for her jewelry business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shamsuddin

texts.ru: Нуриддинов Шамсуддин житель Гисарского района. Возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка.Образование высшее. По профессии кинорежиссер. Проработал 10 лет по специальности. В данный момент работает  в сфере садоводства. Имеет сад. Кредит нужен для того, чтобы закупить удобрения , необходимые для обработки деревьев.
texts.en:
Shamsuddin N. lives in the Gissar district. He is 37 years old, married, and has one child. He completed a college education and is a film director by training. He worked for 10 years in his specialty, but is now a gardener. He has his own garden. He needs a loan to buy fertilizer for growing trees.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: R.c Masomgbo Group

texts.en:
Pictured are teachers from the R.C. Masomgbo Primary School in Masomgbo, one of the villages surrounding Makeni City. This school was established by the Roman Catholics in 1950 to train children of the Masomgbo community, and villages close to it, as future leaders. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. Currently, the school has 554 pupils and a staff of 17 teachers.  

With this loan, some of the teachers will start small businesses, and those who already run businesses will invest their loans into them. Some staff members will be using their loans to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or their own further studies, while others will use their loans for home-building projects.  

Fifty-five-year-old Alie A. S. (right) is the headmaster of the school, and has been a teacher for over 32 years. He was born in Masomgbo village, and is married with ten children – some of his children are in primary school, some in secondary school, and others are in college. Alie will use his loan to pay his children's school fees. Educating his children is a priority to Mr S., as these children will, in turn, assist him when he is old and retired.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 33 years old and she is single without a child. She is a hair-stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream.

Kate hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tavarali

texts.ru: Абдуллаев Таварали житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. имеет высшее образование , по профессии организатор. Уже 10 лет как он занимается садоводством. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы купить удобрения для обработки деревьев. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tavarali A. lives in the Gissar district. He is 50 years old, married, and has two children. He completed a college education in administration, but for the past decade he has been a gardener. He came to us for a loan to buy fertilizer for raising trees. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Khafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза – женщина средних лет (39 лет). Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Она занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Она закупает товар на оптовом рынке "Атушбазар" и "Сомонбазар", а раз в месяц ездит на оптовый рынок города "Истаравшан". Хафиза уже год кредитуется в нашей организации. Она начинала с продажи полотенец, носков и нижнего белья. За один год она смогла расширить ассортимент своего товара, и теперь перешла на мужскую одежду. Хафиза планирует закупить партию мужской обуви и расширить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en:
Khafiza is 39 and married with two children. She sells men's clothing at the "Panshanbe" market in the city of Khujand. Khafiza purchases her inventory at the "Atushbazar" and "Somonbazar" wholesale markets and once a month she travels to the wholesale market in the nearby city of Istravshan. Khafiza has been a microcredit client with MLF for one year. She started out selling towels, socks and underwear. In the past year, Khafiza has been able to expand the types of products she sells and break into the men's clothing market. Khafiza is now applying for a loan in order to purchase men's shoes and further diversify her product line.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Saoudath

texts.fr:
A. Saoudath est née vers 1959 dans la Commune de Bantè dans le Département des Collines au Centre du Bénin. Saoudath est mariée à OKE Bruno. Saoudath est Mère de quatre enfants. Les enfants de Saoudath, Bertin âgée de 29 ans, Angèle âgée de 26 ans, Mariame âgée de 23 ans ne sont plus à sa charge. Seul Deen âgé de 18 ans, apprentis mécanicien est encore à sa charge. Depuis dix ans, Saoudath vend de l'igname frite et des beignets de haricot. C'est une nourriture que les gens du Bénin prennent tous les soirs comme goûté. C'est dans son quartier sous un hangar en tôle que Saoudath fait et vend cette nourriture tous les soirs. Saoudath par manque de moyens financiers est obligée d'acheter ses provisions au quotidien après chaque vente. Saoudath sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour parrer à cette difficulté et ainsi arriver à acheter l'igname et le haricot dont elle a besoin en gros par semaine. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Saoudath A. was born around 1959 in the township of Bantè in the county of Collines in the center of Bénin. Saoudath is married to Bruno Oke and the mother of 4 children. Saoudath's older children, Bertin, 29, Angèle, 26, and Mariame, 23, are no longer in her care. Only Deen, 18 and an apprentice mechanic, is still her responsibility.

For 10 years, Saoudath has been selling fried cocoyams and bean fritters. These are dishes that the people of Bénin have every evening as a snack. She sells her food in the evenings, in her own neighborhood, in a corrugated iron shed. Since she lacks working capital, Saoudath has to buy her supplies every day, with money from the preceding day's sales. She is asking ALIDé for a loan to improve this situation so that she can buy the cocoyams and dried beans, that she needs to make her food, wholesale, on a weekly basis.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next door to Nigeria, where the GDP per inhabitant stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of cocoyams, dried beans, and jerrycans of peanut oil

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 45 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling medicines to the people of her community. She has been in this busines many years, and has applied for a loan to buy more medicines to sell. She offers her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 56 years old, married and has seven children. She makes a living selling palm oil to her customers. Elizabeth has been in this business for a long time, and is applying for this loan so that she can buy more palm oil to sell. Demand is strong and her goal is to satisfy the needs of her customers. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as a house painter for eight years. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Together We Tinap Group

texts.en:
Here we see Abdul K., Adamsay S., Isatu F., Aminata K., Augusta S. and Susan S.. They are members of a loan group called Together We Tinap. They have applied for their third loan from SMT/Kiva. Their previous loans have had a huge impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid those loans successfully and on time, they are requesting a new loan to increase the size and quality of their businesses, make greater profits and improve their standards of living. 

Abdul (second from left) is the leader of this group. He is 35 years of age and was born in Makeni City, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children, all of whom are still in school. Abdul makes a living selling plastic slippers in Makeni. With this loan, he will be able to increase his stock of items to sell. This will bring many positive changes by providing his family with food, clothes to wear, the ability to go to school and so on.

loans.use: To expand several small businesses.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 51 years old, married and has five  children. She makes a living selling second-hand clothes, and hopes to open her own boutique in the future. She is applying for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. She wishes to offer her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as an aluminum producer for 12 years. He also repairs doors and windows. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Abdukocim

texts.ru: Исматов Абдукосим житель Гиссарского района. Холост, живет с родителями.Семья небольшая , но он один является кормильцем семьи. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства.  Он откармливает бычков для реализации их на мясо. Бизнесом занимается уже 10 лет . Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка и таким образом увеличить поголовье скота. Сейчас нет проблем с кормом , поэтому покупка и содержание животных является выгодным.
texts.en:
Abdukocim I. lives in the Gissar district. He is single and lives with his parents. The family is small but he is its only provider. He has a business in animal husbandry.
