He raises bull calves and sells them for meat. Its a business he's been in for 10 years. He decided to request a loan to buy a bull calf and so increase his herd of livestock. Feed is not an issue right now, so buying and keeping livestock is profitable.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bull calf purchase

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 39-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Hussein owns a photography studio. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his studio. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

Hussein is special in his work because he does nice pictures and knows how to suit his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his work, he didn’t face difficulty. Hussein decided to do his work because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase tools for his studio.

loans.name: Mahbubahon

texts.ru: Махбубахон занимается продажей парфюмерии и декоративной косметики на рынке "Панчшанбе". Она арендует магазин на втором этаже рынка. Товар ей поставляют разные фирмы: Nivea, Dove, и другие. Еще она заказывает продукцию от косметических компаний Oriflame, Avon и Faberlic. За заказы фирмы требуют предоплату. Поэтому Махбубахон хочет взять кредит, чтобы оплатить за последнюю партию заказа от Oriflame. Махбубахон сотрудничает с нами уже 2 года. В будущем, когда у нее расширится бизнес, она планирует открыть свой фирменный магазин.
texts.en:
Mahbubahon's business is selling perfume and cosmetics at the "Panshanbe" market. She rents a store on the second floor of the market, where she sells different brands of products, including Nivea, Dove, Oriflame, Avon and Faberlic. To order products from these companies, she needs to pay in advance. For this reason, Mahbubahon is applying for a loan to pay for her most recent order from Oriflame. Mahbubahon has been an MLF client for two years. As her business develops and expands in the future, she plans to open her own name-brand store.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Ahmad has owned a barber shop for a year. Ahmad requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools, a new seat and change the décor of his salon. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ahmad decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation as well as have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase tools, a new seat and change the décor of his salon.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Исматова Нигора проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Два года , как они с мужем занялись бизнесом. Арендуют помещение , которое используют под продуктовый магазин. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Таким образом она сможет увеличить ассортимент товара и сможет привлечь новых клиентов.Кредит даст возможность улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Nigora I. lives in the Gissar district. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She and her husband started a business two years ago. They have a small grocery store in a rented space. They decided to request a loan to increase sales. It will be used to expand their inventory and attract new customers. The loan will help to improve the family's financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Ahmad has been working as a furniture sewer since 2002. Ahmad requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and he didn’t have a lot of clients. Ahmad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a new and bigger sewing machine.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Perly

texts.en: Perly L. is 29 years old, married and blessed with five children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver, and they live in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. She makes a living buying and selling used clothing, and has applied for a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She and her husband also run a small business buying and selling firewood. Perly wants to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support, because without it she would not be able to run her small company.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Noha has owned a small locA. chicken slaughterhouse since 1999. She requested a loan of 1800 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase a refrigerator and merchandise for her business. This is the first time that Noha has requested a loan.

Noha is speciA. in her work because she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her work, she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her business. Noha decided to do her work because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Noha will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Cité De La Gloire Plus Group

texts.fr: Paulin N. exerce ses activités commerciales dans une zone montagneuse à l’ouest de la ville Kinshasa, capitale de la RDC. Il est connu dans son quartier et ailleurs à cause de l’huile de palme et végétale qu’il livre régulièrement à ses clients. Il vend aussi des sacs de maїs et manioc.  Paulin a débuté ses affaires en 1988 en ouvrant une boutique qui a prospéré en lui procurant un capital de $2000 en 1991. Il était victime des pillages à Kinshasa en 1991 et 1993 qui ont causé la chute et la fermeture de sa boutique. Après la reconstitution, Paulin a relancé l’activité en 1996 avec un capital de $400 en achetant 1 sac du riz, de farine de froment, du riz, des savons, etc… Son activité a encore connu une baisse en 1999  suite au changement de la monnaie «  Zaire » en « Franc Congolais ». Malgré ces difficultés et pertes subites, Paulin travaillait durement en vue de maintenir son affaire. De 2000-2009, il a diversifié son affaire en ajoutant la vente de l’huile de palme et végétale. Dans le souci  d’avoir un soutien financier permanent en vue de développer son commerce, Paulin a décidé de se faire membre dans un des groupes de l’IMF Hope RDC en août 2008. Il a obtenu trois crédits qu’il a totalement remboursés. Le prêt reçu en avril courant lui a permis d’acheter 5 sacs de manioc. Actuellement, son capital est $300. Son activité génère un bénéfice de $50 par semaine. Paulin rêve acheter un jour des camions pour transporter les marchandises des commercants. Il a 40 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 16 dont trois vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Paulin N. works in a mountainous area west of the town of Kinshasa, capital of the RDC. He is well-known in his neighborhood and beyond because of the palm oil and vegetable oil that he regularly delivers to his customers. He also sells sacks of maize and manioc.

Paulin started up his business in 1988, opening a little shop that prospered and earning him a working capital of US$ 2,000 by 1991. He was a victim of the pillaging in Kinshasa between 1991 and 1993, which destroyed and closed down his little store.

After things got back to normal, Paulin got his business going again in 1996 with a working capital of US$ 400, buying 1 sack of rice, some wheat flour, bars of soap, etc. His business went into a decline in 1999 when the currency was changed from « Zaire » to « Franc Congolais ». Despite these problems and sudden losses, Paulin worked hard to keep his business going. From 2000-2009, he diversified his business, adding the sale of palm and vegetable oils.

Wishing to find a more permanent financial aide so as to develop his business, Paulin decided to join one of the groups of IMF Hope RDC in August 2008. He has received 3 loans which he has completely reimbursed. The loan received this April has allowed him to buy 5 sacks of manioc. Presently his working capital stands at US$ 300. His business generates a weekly profit of US$ 50.

Paulin dreams of buying some trucks one day, so as to transport other merchants' goods. He is 40, married, and the father of 4 children between 6 and 16, of whom 3 are enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 5 sacks of manioc so as to bolster his business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Rana has owned a photography studio since 2000. She requested a loan of 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for her studio. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her studio by purchasing new tools. Rana is special in her work because she does nice pictures and knows how to suit her clients. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her work, she didn’t have the startup capital and didn’t have all the needed equipment. Rana decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Rana will use the loan to purchase tools for her studio.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исматов Исмоил проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Исмоил более 20 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует коврами. Работает вместе со своими старшими детьми. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и расширить ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Ismoil I. lives in the Gissar area. He is 50 years old, is married and has eight children. He works in a store. He has a food store. Ismoil works there together with his older children. He plans to receive credit in order to increase his turnover and expand his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Faress

texts.en:
Faress is a 47-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their 11 children. Faress has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1995. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase merchandise for his work. Faress has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he didn’t face difficulty. Faress decided on doing his work because he wants to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Faress will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.ru: Марьям - 51 год. Она разведена и живет и двумя детьми и невесткой. Старший сын женат и имеет сына. Дочь еще не вышла замуж. Марьям занимается продажей канцтоваров и косметики на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда, магазин № 234. Она кредитуется у нас уже 2 года. В начале ее бизнеса она продавала только канцтовары. Теперь ее бизнес расширился: теперь она продает и косметику. Канцтовары ей поставляет фирма, а косметику она заказывает у косметических дистрибьюторов. За последний займ она планирует  заказать партию косметики от компании Avon.
texts.en:
Maryam is 51 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children and her daughter-in-law. Her older child, a son, is married with a son of his own, while her daughter has still yet to marry. Maryam's business is selling school and office supplies and cosmetics at the "Panshanbe" market in Khujand, where she occupies store number 234. Maryam has been an MLF client for two years. Initially, she only sold school and office supplies but has since expanded into cosmetics as well. A company furnishes her store with the school and office supplies, but she has to order her stock in cosmetics from distributors. With this loan, Maryam plans to purchase inventory from Avon.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 25 years old and married with one child. She is a tailor who makes lovely clothes for her customers. She also sells sarongs of various colors. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en: Endurance is 27 years old and married with one child. She sells provisions and bottles of wine. She hopes to own a big supermarket in future. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en: Cerina is a wine merchant. She sells bottles of wine on a wholesale and retail basis to her customers in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more bottles of wine to sell. She is 54 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 32 years old, and she is married with a child. She sells provisions. She started this business in 2006. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe D. is a responsible man from Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. He is 56 years old. He is married and lives with his 6 children. Felipe is engaged in a kind of business known as "alacart." This is a food business, wherein you sell primarily chicken barbecue or pork barbecue. Alacart businesses are in demand. They're affordable and at the same time very tasty. Felipe has many local customers. He doesn't regret engaging in such a business. He has fed his family with this business. He is able to send his children to school and gain a college degree. Felipe is indeed a determined man. He is working hard for his business so that he can sustain the needs of his family. Felipe wants to impart his gratitude to the organization that supported his business, and that is HSPFI (a Kiva partner). Felipe believes that he could do more with his business if he had money to purchase additional ingredients for use in alacart vending. He is now asking for another loan amounting to 11,000.00 PHP. He is aiming for immediate approval of his request, for he wants to pursue his plan for expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his alacart business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Akoua Abléwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris le métier de la couture mais elle ne gagnait pas suffisament d'argent elle a préféré se lancer dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, actuellement ce commerce marche bien pour elle. Voulant agrandir son stock elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, le revenu qu’elle gagne de son commerce lui permet de contribuer aux charges de sa famille
texts.en:
This lady learned to be a seamstress, but she didn't earn enough money in that trade, so she preferred to get into selling groceries, and presently, this business is going well. Wishing to increase her stock of goods, she has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy groceries and other general merchandise for her store. She is married and the mother of 2 children. The income she makes from her business allows her to contribute to covering the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 38 years old, and she sells jewelry like chains, bracelets, etc. She hopes to receive a loan for the amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry to sell. She hopes to make more profits from this business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mensah Nyaga

texts.fr: F. mensah est une dame qui réside dans le quartier de Novissi, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1992, ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce commerce. son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, elle sollicite du crédit de WAGES pour se réapprovisionner avec des sacs de riz, des cartons de savons, des cartons de sucre et  divers produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants.
texts.en:
F. Mensah is a lady who resides in the Novissi neighborhood; she sells groceries to earn a living. She has been in this business since 1992, so she is very knowledgeable at it. Her stock of merchandise is expended so she has requested that WAGES give her a loan to replenish her inventory with sacks of rice, cartons of soap, cartons of sugar, and various other products. She is married and the mother of 6 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 41, is married and has four children. She sells bags of garri (cassava grains) in wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Mariam hopes to take out a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 39 years old and is married with two children. She sells daily provisions, such as toothpaste, milk, and detergent. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions for sale. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 54 years old, is a widow with seven children. She is a tailor. She also sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 so she can purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their generous hearts.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells blocks of ice to her customers, who are vendors in the business of selling drinks and wine. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to obtain a loan in the amount of N100,000, which she wishes to use to purchase one deep freezer and more ice blocks to sell. She is 35 years old and she is married with four children. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and more ice blocks to sell.

loans.name: Lovinsa's Group

texts.en:
G. Lovinsa is the leader of the K. group of Ivunamba. She has a retail-shop business that she has been running for a long time. She is grateful to have watched her business grow over the years, and, as a result of her success, her daily sales, income, and savings have improved.

Right now, her income is 80,000 shillings, and she has more than 150,000 shillings in her personal savings. However, she plans to more than double this so that she will easily be able to pay school fees for her children.

Lovinsa needs a new loan so as to be able to stock her shop with more products.

loans.use: To restock goods for sale in her retail shop.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is 46 years old and she is married with no children. She sells crates of drinks and bottles of wine. Her hope is someday to own and operate a big supermarket.

She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000, which she plans to use to purchase more crates of drinks and bottles of wine to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bottles of wine to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a hard working woman. She is a tailor and also sells tailoring materials like zip, thread, landings, etc. She is a LAPO client. She hopes to expand her business and is requesting a the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Rita is 37 years old and is married with 4 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Aboudermane

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est un homme marié qui habite le quartier de Kégué, il est père de 02 enfants, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. C’est cette activité qui lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille. Il exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « A. et Fils ».il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit  qu’il a bien remboursé. Il sollicite un  deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale par l’achat de 05 cartons de lait liquide, 10 sacs de riz, 04 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 05 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is a married man who lives in the Kégué neighborhood; he is the father of 2 children. His business is selling groceries, and it is this business that allows him to support his family. He tends shop in his own little store that he calls ,«A. et Fils». He has already had one loan from WAGES and has reimbursed it correctly. He is requesting a second loan which will allow him to add to his stock of grocery items by buying 5 cases of liquid milk, 10 sacks of rice, 4 cases of pasta, and so on.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina has been selling soup ingredients in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria since 1997. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children.She hopes to get a loan of N100,000 to purchase additional soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 47 years old and she is married with one child.  She sells clothes, bags and shoes. Kate has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to get a loan loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Joyce Plus Group

texts.fr: Marceline Tartine a 40 ans, mariée et mère d’une fille de 15 ans qui est élève. Elle habite dans une zone montagneuse à l’ouest de Kinshasa où elle exerce son petit commerce de vente des poissons salés, elle vend aussi à coté de ces poissons les chikwangues (kind of bread made of cassava flour). De fois, ses clients mangent ces aliments sur place ou les amènent chez eux. En bref, Marceline est entrain de commencer un mini restaurant. Son  capital actuel est de $72. Elle a commencé son activité en l’an 2000 avec un capital initial de $ 15 qui lui avaient permis d’acheter de la braise à revendre. Son affaire a prospéré jusqu’en 2006. L’affaiblissement de la santé de Marceline causé par l’intervention chirurgicale subie durant la période 2006-2007 ne lui a pas permis d’exercer pleinement ses activités commerciales. En deuxième semestre de 2007 jusqu’aujourd’hui, elle a relancé son affaire en y ajoutant des poissons frais et a intégré un des groupes de l’IMF Hope dénommé « Joyce » en février 2008 dans le but de recevoir un appui financier durable afin de développer son affaire. Marceline a reçu quatre fois les crédits de Hope qu’elle régulièrement et totalement remboursé. Elle a acheté avec le prêt reçu en avril courant des poissons salés et diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant du pétrole ainsi que de l’huile végétale en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son activité  lui génère $33 de bénéfice par semaine. Son ambition est d’acheter un congélateur dans le but de conserver les vivres frais dont ses clients ont souvent besoin.
texts.en:
Marceline Tartine, age 40, is married and the mother of a 15-year-old daughter, who is a student. Marceline lives in a mountainous area to the west of Kinshasa, where she works at her small business selling salted fish. Besides selling fish, she also sells chikwangues (a kind of bread made of cassava flour). Sometimes, her customers eat these foods on site or take them home. Basically, she’s in the midst of starting up a mini-restaurant. Right now, her capital amounts to $72. She started her business in 2000 with $15 of initial capital that had enabled her to buy some charcoal to resell. Her business prospered through 2006.

Marceline’s ill health, caused by a surgery undergone in 2006-2007, prevented her from doing commerce fully. In the second half of 2007 through today, she started back up again by including fresh fish.

She joined one of groups of the micro-finance institution HOPE named “Joyce” in February 2008 with the goal of receiving renewable financial support for developing her business. She received loans from HOPE four times, and she repaid them regularly and completely. In April, she used the loan received to buy some salted fish, and she diversified by including kerosene, as well as vegetable oil, intending to grow her revenues.

Currently, her business generates for her a profit of $33 a week. Her ambition is to buy a freezer with the goal of preserving the fresh staple goods that her customers have often needed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salted fish and to diversify her business with kerosene and vegetable oil for increasing her income

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Guy Roger

texts.fr: Monsieur A.  est un boulanger,il produit et vend du pain à base de farine de blé en gros et en détail à ses clients.il a commencé cette activité en 2008, il livre à des revendeuses du quartier en gros tous les matins, cette activité lui est rentable, avec ce qu’il y gagne, il arrive à subvenir à ses propres besoins. La demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, mais il ne dispose pas assez de stock de farine, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé, du sucre et 05 cartons de beurre.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is a baker. He produces and sells wheat bread wholesale and retail to his customers. He started this business in 2008. He delivers in bulk to retailers in his district every morning. It is a very profitable business. With what he earns from it, he manages to support himself. The current demand from his customers is high, but he lacks enough flour in his inventory. He’s therefore asking WAGES for his first loan to buy sacks of flour, some sugar, and five boxes of butter.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky is 32 years old and married. She has two children. She makes a living by selling women's accessories, specifically bags and belts. Lucky has requested a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags and belts to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and belts to sell.

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She sells bunches of plantains in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has run this business for a long time. Ejiro is requesting the loan amount of 140,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is 50 years old and married with 7 children. She sells bunches of plantains in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more plantains to sell. Justina thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She sells sarongs of various colors to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa D. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse d’ignames, une denrée très comestible à au Togo. Elle désire avec ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des ignames pour la revente. Son activité consiste à aller acheter des ignames dans les fermes venir les livrer aux détaillants et aux détenteurs de bar restaurant. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawa D., age 40, is married and the mother of three. She sells yams, a very edible item in Togo. She would like to use this loan, her first with FECECAV, to expand her business by buying some yams for resale. Her work consists in going to buy yams from farms and coming to deliver them to retailers and pub owners. She’s counting on this opportunity to change her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams for resale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con sus tres hijos mayores que velan por su bienestar. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de diversos productos porque tenía que asumir  la responsabilidad de educar a sus hijos, quienes ahora son mayores y velan por ella. Sin embargo,  aun tiene fuerzas para seguir trabajando, y hace 4 años empezó a vender comida en el mercado que esté cerca de su casa, dicho espacio lo obtuvo con mucho sacrificio, pues no es fácil tener un lugar donde vender sin que la municipalidad lo impida. Gracias a esto, sale a vender  con su cochecito de comida todos los días desde el medio día hasta las 3 de la  tarde, para cumplir esta rutina tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar las compras necesarias y preparar los alimentos. A pesar de contar con un espacio donde vender, el deseo de Francisca es mejorar, cada vez más, la calidad de su atención al público. Ella es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal dentro de MFP, donde se siente muy  contenta, pues entre compañeros, tratan de ayudarse en lo necesario frente a los problemas que se les presentan a cada uno. Los 2000 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina y víveres, para incrementar la cantidad de platos de comida que satisfagan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking woman who lives with her three adult children who take care of her well being. Since she was young she has worked selling a variety of products as she had to assume responsibility for the education of her children, who now care for her in their adulthood. She still has the strength to keep working, so 4 years ago she began selling food in the market near her home. She had to sacrifice a great deal to get this market spot, as it is not easy to have a location to sell where the municipality will not interfere. Due to this, she makes sales from her little food car every day from noon until 3 pm. To accomplish this, she must wake up very early in order to make the necessary purchases and prepare the food. Despite having a sales place to count on, Francisca's hope is to improve her service more and more. She is one of the founders of her village bank, where she feels very happy. The members try to help one another with the problems that come up for each of them. The money she has requested will be invested in purchasing cooking utensils and supplies to increase the quantity of dishes provided to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing utensils and supplies for her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia SONIA; Es natural del distrito de Chincheros, ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba en el departamento del Cusco, situado a 1 hora de la ciudad en transporte público.

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio minorista, ella cría animales menores (cuyes, pollos, patos, gallinas, cerdos, ovejas), para su venta posterior y compra granos secos para venderlos en el mercado dominical; por lo que la socia requiere el préstamo para implementar sus animales y comprar granos.

La socia está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado y de la misma manera se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Partner SONIA: She is a local of Chincheros district, located in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco, situated one hour from the city by public transport. Our partner alternates her domestic and retail activities. She raises small animals that she later sells (guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, pigs, goats), and also buys dry grains to sell in the Sunday market. So she requires a loan to raise her animals and buy grains. The partner is very grateful for support offered, and in the same manner she agrees to comply with loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals and grains.

loans.name: Sèminankpon

texts.fr:
B. Sèminankpon est âgée de 45 ans. Sèminankpon est originaire de la Vallée dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Sèminankpon est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Parmi les quatre enfants, seuls Roger âgé de 18 ans en cinquième année du lycée et Irène âgée de 16 ans en quatrième année du lycée sont encore à la charge de Sèminankpon. Sèminankpon vend des produits maraîchères. Sèminakpon va dans les jardins acheter les produits maraîchères qu'elle passe livrer aux revendeurs dans les marchés locaux de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Le jour Sèminankpon n'arrive pas à livrer tous ses produits sur les marchés, elle revient vendre le reste aux ménages à la maison, devant chez elle. Sèminankpon enregistre beaucoup de demande qu'elle n'arrive toujours pas à bien satisfaire par manque de moyens financiers pour prépayer les produits aux jardiniers. Sèminankpon sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé pour parer à cette difficulté et arriver à mieux servir ses clients. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Sèminankpon B. is 45 tears old. Sèminankpon was born in Vallee, in the District of Oueme. She is married and the mother of four children. Of her four children, only Roger, age 18 and in 5th year at Lycee and Irene, age 16 in her 4th year at Lycee are still under her care. Sèminankpon sells garden vegetables. She visits the gardens and buys supplies of vegetables that she then delivers and resells in the local markets of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. On the days when Sèminankpon is not able to sell all of her vegetables, she will sell the remainder to local house keepers, near her home. Sèminankpon has demands from customers that she is unable to fill as she does not have enough capital to purchase sufficient supplies of vegetables from her gardeners. Sèminankpon is requesting financial assistance from ALIDe to address this problem and satisfy her clientele. The meaning of "ALIDe" in the local Benin language is: "There will always be a road available for the most poor". Benin is a small west African country, neighboring Nigeria with an average income of $1,500.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of green vegetables lettace, coliflower, cucumbers and carrots.

loans.name: Ufoma

texts.en: Ufoma is a 30-year-old single woman. She has sold men's shoes and clothes since 2007. Ufoma is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more male shoes and clothes to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more men's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: D. abla réside dans le quartier de kégué, un quartier de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son stock est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  10 sacs de riz parfumé, 08 bidons d’huile, 04 cartons de savons et de 06 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.
texts.en:
D. Abla resides in Kégué, a district of the city of Lomé. She is married and works to earn an income in the grocery business. Her stock of goods is exhausted. She wants to resupply herself and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of aromatic rice, eight drums of oil, four boxes of soap, and six boxes of pasta.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 45 years old and is divorced without a child. She has sold bags of groundnuts for a long time. She is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more bags of groundnuts to sell. Ruth is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra E. est propriétaire d’une baraque installée au bord de la route à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. son activité consiste à acquérir des marchandises au près des grossistes et de venir les étaler dans sa baraque. Elle désire avec ce crédit renforcer son commerce en aménageant sa baraque et l’approvisionner. Elle est à son deuxième crédit et le premier a été remboursé promptement
texts.en:
Abra E. is the owner of a stall situated along side the road to Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three. Her business involves acquiring merchandise from wholesalers and displaying it in her stall. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business by fixing up her stall and stocking it. She is on her second loan, and the first one was promptly repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her stall and to stock it

loans.name: Jacinto Hugo

texts.es: Jacinto, más conocido por su segundo nombre, Hugo, es un noble zapatero que dedicó todos sus años de casado en el bienestar de sus seres queridos, quienes le brindan hoy el mismo cuidado y cariño, pues todos viven en la casa. Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de zapatero y con el tiempo fue especializándose en mejorar la calidad del trabajo, que desde hace 25 años realiza. Gracias a su rapidez y eficiencia, las personas de su localidad siempre solicitan sus servicios, pero por falta de herramientas adecuadas, no puede atender a todos sus clientes, esto fue a raíz de que por motivos de salud no pudo trabajar durante un año, lo cual produjo algunos problemas económicos en su hogar. Pero ahora ya está recuperado, y poco a poco trabaja para que su pequeña zapatería vuelva a tener la capacidad de atender a todos sus clientes. Hugo no sólo espera tener una renovadora, sino también poder fabricar nuevos modelos de zapatos para diversas edades y en el futuro tener una tienda donde venda los diversos modelos de calzado que fabrique. El es un cliente fundador de su grupo, pues hace 6 años MFP lo impulsó a el y a otras personas a mejorar sus negocios, desde entonces viene trabajando con responsabilidad  junto a sus compañeros, con quienes ha llegado a compartir diversas actividades, que con el paso del tiempo, fortalecieron su amistad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales indispensables para la reparación de zapatos, y así, seguir atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jacinto, better known by his second name, Hugo, is a noble cobbler who has worked during his married years for the well being of his loved ones, who now give him the same care and affection since they all live at home. From a very young age he learned the cobbling business and with time he specialized his skill and improved the quality of his work. He has worked as a cobbler for 25 years. Thanks to his speediness and efficiency, the people in his neighborhood always ask for his services, but because he lacks appropriate tools, he can't attend to all of his clients. This is due to a health problem that left him unable to work for a year and caused some financial problems in the home. But now he has recovered and, little by little, works so that his small shoe shop is once again able to attend to all his clients. Hugo does not only want to remodel, but also wants to be able to make new styles of shoes for all ages and in the future have a store where he can sell the many models of shoes that he makes. He is the founding member of his group. Six years ago MFP encouraged him and others to improve their businesses and since then he has worked responsibly along with his partners, with whom he has come to share different past times, thus strengthening their friendship. The money he requests will be used to buy necessary materials for shoe repair to be able to keep attending to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking materials

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 59 years old and is married with 6 children. She sells firewood at Warri, in Delta state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She has applied for and hopes to get a loan of N100,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Kaimer

texts.es: Kaimer tiene  35 años, su vitalidad le ayuda a trabajar y proteger a su familia cada día, conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijas, su familia vive toda junta en una pequeña casa. La experiencia que obtuvo desde joven lo llevó a dedicarse plenamente al transporte de pasajeros, actividad que realiza todas los días a partir de las 4 de la tarde hasta altas horas de la madrugada, pues tiene que cumplir el horario de trabajo de la empresa transportes donde labora por más de 10 años. Dicha labor está ocasionándole algunas molestias físicas, pues sus horas de descanso son muy pocas, siendo éste el lado desagradable de su ocupación como chofer, pero tiene la necesidad trabajar por el bienestar de su familia. Es así que tiene pensado  iniciar un trabajo adicional con su esposa, pues ella tiene mucha habilidad para las ventas, habilidad que desean explotar al máximo instalando una tienda en su casa, aprovechando la escasez de este tipo de negocio por su localidad, y la gran demanda por parte de sus vecinos y amigos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está seguro que esta oportunidad le ayudará a seguir creciendo, además se considera una persona muy responsable, dando fe de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su auto y algunos productos para empezar a reunir la mercadería para su futura tienda.
texts.en:
Kaimer is 35 years old. His vitality helps him every day to work and protect his family, which is comprised of his wife and their two daughters. His family lives together in a small house. The experience he had when he was younger caused him to work solely in public transportation. He works from 4:00 pm until the early hours of the morning, according to his work schedule from the transportation company for whom he was worked for more than 10 years. The disagreeable aspects of his job as a driver are that it causes him some physical discomfort and he does not have much time to rest. However he has to work for the well being of his family. He has thought of starting an extra business with his wife since she has a lot of skill in sales. They want to take full advantage of that skill by putting a store in their home, as there is a scarcity of that type of business in their neighborhood and a lot of demand from their neighbors and friends. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is certain this opportunity will help him keep growing. Furthermore, he is considered to be a very responsible person who will make the loan payments on time. He will use the requested money to buy parts for his car and some products to begin to gather the merchandise for their future store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts for his car

loans.name: Ekiemute

texts.en: Ekiemute is 40 years old and is married with 3 children. She sells kitchen utensils like pots, plates, spoons, etc. Ekiemute is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Akpene K. est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle est productrice et revendeuse de jus de fruits au bord de la route à Lomé. Elle livre aussi ses produits à d’autres revendeuses. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de on commerce afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle bénéficie de son premier crédit chez FECECAV et promet des remboursements à temps.
texts.en:
Akpene K. is a young women, 35 years old, married, and the mother of a boy. She produces and sells fruit juices along side the road to Lomé. She also delivers her goods to other retailers. She would like to use this loan to increase her business capacity in order to respond better to the needs of her customers. She’s benefiting from her first loan with FECECAV and promises to make the payments on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and a refirgerator

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 24 años, es una joven que apoya mucho a sus padres, pues desea que su familia mejore económicamente. Su ganas de progresar la llevaron a dedicarse a la venta de comida, lo cual realiza dentro de su casa, cocina por las mañanas para tener todo listo al medio día, hora que sale a repartir los menús a sus pensionistas, que son más de 20 personas. Esta actividad no la realiza sola, pues cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien le enseña a preparar los diversos platillos para que sus clientes puedan sentirse satisfechos. Sin embargo, Maria desea seguir aprendiendo aun más de cocina, y tiene proyectado instalar en su hogar un pequeño restaurante, donde atienda junto a su madre, ya que la ventaja es que está ubicado en una avenida principal y tendrían gran concurrencia. María trabaja con MFP más de 3 años y le agrada pertenecer a un grupo tan ameno, pues las actividades y reuniones son muy favorables para compartir ideas y mejorar en su negocio. Los 1500 soles que solicita los usará en la compra de utensilios necesarios para iniciar poco a poco la instalación de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old, and is a young woman who gives a lot of support to her parents, as she desires that her family improve economically. Her desire to get ahead led her to work selling food, a job she undertakes from within the home. She cooks in the morning to have everything ready at noon, at which time she leaves to distribute the menus to her boarders (there are more than 20 of them). She does not do this work alone; she counts on her mother for support. Her mother teaches her how to prepare all the different dishes so that her clients are satisfied. However, Maria desires to keep learning more about cooking and has planned to install a small restaurant in her home, where she will work with her mother. They are located on a main avenue and would get a lot of business. Maria has worked with MFP for more than 3 years, and she enjoys belonging to such a pleasant group, as the activities and meetings are favorable for sharing ideas and improving business. The 1500 soles she is requesting will be used to buy the necessary utensils for starting to install the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for a future restaurant

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
G. Véronique est âgée de 25 ans. Véronique est mariée à TOUDONOU Constant conducteur de camion. Véronique est mère d'un enfant âgé seulement de 3 ans. Véronique vend depuis environ dix ans la bouillie de maïs et de manioc accompagnées de l'arachide grillés ou de lait. Ces deux bouillies sont prises à toute heure de la journée; elles font partir des habitudes alimentaires de la population du Bénin. C'est de quartier en quartier, le plateau de bouillies sur la tête que Véronique passe vendre ses bouillies. Véronique a besoin de moyens financiers pour s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en maïs et farine de manioc, ainsi qu'en lait et arachide. C'est pourquoi Véronique sollicite l'appui en crédit de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Véronique, age 25, is married to TOUDONOU Constant, a truck driver. She is the mother of a child who is only three years old. For about ten years, she has been selling porridge made of cornmeal or cassava, accompanied with roasted peanuts or with milk. These two kinds of porridges are eaten at any hour of the day and figure among the typical foods of the people of Benin. From area to area, Véronique goes, balancing the tray of porridges on her head to make her sales. She is in need of funds to resupply herself in sufficient quantities of corn and cassava flour, as well as milk and peanuts. This is why Véronique is applying for loan support from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of cassava flour, corn, and peanuts,and cartons of milk

loans.name: Adaeze

texts.en:
Adaeze is 42 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is standing close to her husband in the picture. 

Adaeze has a store where she sells medicine. She has requested and hopes to get a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She is an active LAPO client. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El sr. FRANCISCO, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba en el distrito de chincheros en la comunidad de qollana, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos en transporte público de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio alterna sus actividades principales que son la agricultura y la ganadería con el servicio de taxi en la ruta de Cusco a Chincheros y Urubamba, el socio tiene 39 años de edad, es casado con la sra. Sonia que también es nuestra socia, ellos tiene 4 hijos de (14, 13, y 2 gemelos de 9) años; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y un ganadito.

El sr. Francisco esta muy agradecido con el préstamo otorgado y reitera su compromiso de cancelar su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Mr. FRANCISCO is a native of the Urubamba province, in the qollana community of the chincheros district, located 1 hour and 10 minutes from Cusco by public transport. The parter alternates his main activities between agriculture and livestock, with a taxi service route between Cusco to Chincheros and Urubamba. He is 39 years old, and is married to Mrs. Sonia who is also a partner. They have 4 children (14, 13, and 9 year old twins). Our partner requests a loan to buy spare parts and livestock. Mr. Francisco is very grateful for the loan and he reiterates his commitment to cancel his debt within the scheduled time.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts and livestock.

loans.name: Vacilia

texts.es: Vacilia es una mujer de 44 años, y todo este tiempo ha luchado por ser feliz. Ahora, a lado de su familia; integrada por su esposo y sus  tres hijos, ha podido conseguir paz y alegría en su casa que terminó de construir, junto a su pareja, hace poco. Dedicarse al comercio fue algo con lo cual soñó desde muy joven, ya que siempre le atrajeron las ventas, desde que se caso fue dedicándose a múltiples rubros; como la venta de ropa en las calles donde tuvo diversas dificultades por el peligro y delincuencia que hay en los mercados y ferias donde vendía. Pero hace 9 años  tuvo la oportunidad de invertir en la instalación de una pequeña tienda, desde entonces, está dedicada a mantener adecuadamente su negocio, tratando siempre de contar con los productos necesarios y brindando a sus clientes una atención de calidad. A pesar de tener este negocio en casa, no deja de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, pues sus clientes le hacen pedidos, los cuales son cumplidos por doña Vacilia, quien está muy contenta de seguir creciendo económicamente, pues esto le permitirá lograr ampliar su negocio  y convertir su bodega en un bazar con mayor diversidad de productos. Vacilia es nueva en MFP, y está muy emocionada por la oportunidad de lograr sus metas a través de este crédito, y con el tiempo ser una cliente de confianza. Los 3000 soles que solicita los usará en la compra de la mercadería que requiere para su tienda, con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos y clientes.
texts.en:
Vacilia is a 44 year old woman, and has fought her whole life to be happy. Now, together with her family of a husband and their three children, she has been able to be at peace and happy in the home that she and her husband recently finished building. Working in sales was something she dreamed about as a young girl, and she was always drawn to sales. Since marrying, she has worked in many arenas, like selling clothing on the street, where she had many difficulties because of the danger and delinquency that exists in the markets where she lived. Nine years ago she had the opportunity to invest in starting a small store, and since then has been dedicated to maintaining her business, always trying to have the necessary products and to give her clients good customer service. In spite of having this business in the home, she does not neglect to sell clothing, and her customers make requests which Doña Vacilia works to fulfill. She is very happy to continue to grow economically as this will allow her to expand her business and change her store to one with a greater variety of products. Vacilia is new at MFP, and is very excited for the opportunity to achieve her goals by means of this loan, and, in time, to be a trusted client. The 3000 soles she requests will be used to buy the necessary merchandise for her store, with the purpose of satisfying the needs of her neighbors and customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia ANDREA; es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el distrito de chincheros en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, ella es casada y tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (18, 15, 13, 5) años; la socia también tiene algunos ganados como vacas y ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un par de ganados, para lo cual solicita el préstamo.

La socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo que le otorgan mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en pagar el total de su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
ANDREA is a native of the comunidad of Cruz Pata in the Peruvian departamento of Cusco.

She alternates her responsibilities at home with a farming business. She is married and 36 years old. She has 4 children (18-, 15-, 13-, and 5-years old, respectively). The member also raises animals such as cattle. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of a pair of animals.

The member is very grateful that loans can be borrowed in this way and commits to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock for farming business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Ann is a hardworking woman who has been engaged in the business of selling women's shoes for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more women's shoes for sale. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ylcia

texts.es: Ylcia es una mujer empeñosa y preocupada por el porvenir de sus hijos, a quienes trata de ofrecerles las condiciones necesarias para su completo desarrollo, y gracias a la casa que logró adquirir hace 10 años puede dar a su familia comodidad y seguridad. Con el empeño que le caracteriza ha llegado a ser muy conocida dentro del entorno donde vive, ya que todas las tardes es común verla salir con su carrito de comida que traslada hasta la esquina de su casa, lugar donde atiende desde las seis de a tarde hasta altas horas de la noche, tiempo que le toma vender sus deliciosas hamburguesas que ofrece a precios cómodos con el fin de obtener clientela que garantice el crecimiento de su negocio. A pesar que las ventas han estado incrementándose, Ylcia tiene proyectado abrir una librería en su casa, pues cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, quien está invirtiendo en el negocio de su esposa. Sin embargo, aun no han recaudado lo suficiente para la compra de algunos muebles y mercadería, por tanto tiene que seguir trabajando vendiendo comida hasta tener el capital necesario para su futuro negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de  mercadería para su próxima librería, en la cual tiene puestas todas sus esperanzas y anhelos para tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Ylcia is a hard-working woman worried about the future of her children, and she tries to provide everything they need so that they can fully develop. Thanks to the house she was able to acquire 10 years ago she can provide her family with comfort and security. She is very well known for her ambition within the area where she lives, as she can be seen every afternoon leaving with her food cart that she moves from her house to the corner where she attends to customers from 6:00 pm until very late at night. She works selling her delicious hamburgers at a reasonable price in order to attract the clientele to guarantee that her business grows. Even though sales have been increasing, Ylicia is planning to open a bookstore in her home, and counts on her husband's support, as he is investing in her business. However, they still have not collected enough money to buy the furniture and merchandise, making it necessary that she keep working selling food until they have the needed capital for their future business. This is her first loan with MFP, and the money will be used to buy merchandise for her upcoming bookstore, in which she has placed all her hopes and desires of having a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise to start a bookstore

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz Victoria

texts.es:
LUZ VICTORIA S. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Luis Escavino Nº 171, en el distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 36 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comida, de jugos y gaseosas, su esposo es transportista y tienen 3 hijos.

Ella tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar gaseosas y vender jugos, con el fin de contribuir económicamente en su hogar y hacer trabajar su capital. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200. Nuevos Soles, lo cual invertirá para surtir su negocio con la venta de comida, jugos, gaseosas y carbón, con el propósito de seguir haciendo trabajar su capital y contribuir económicamente en su hogar.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya como por medio de los créditos y las charlas que le brindan las promotoras, permitiéndola seguir invirtiendo y prosperando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Victoria S. S. belongs to the community bank "Las Margaritas", located at Jr. Luis Escavino Nº 171, in the district of Callería, city of Pucallpa. She is 36 years old and works selling food, juice, and soft drinks. Her husband works in transportation and they have 3 children. She has worked for 2 years with Manuela Ramos and the first loan she obtained was for 300 nuevos soles. She used it to buy soft drinks and sell juice, and the loan contributed to help with the economic status in the home and to grow her capital. This loan of 1,200 nuevos soles will be used to supply her business of selling food, juice, soft drinks, and coal, with the goal of continuing to increase capital and help her household out financially. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos because they support her through loans and discussions that help her develop her business, allowing her to invest in her business so that it prospers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy juice, soft drinks, and coal

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 49 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She sells provisions and bottles of wine. She has been in this business for a long time.She requests a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions and supplies of wine to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and supplies of wine to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 35 years old and is married with 5 children. She sells fruit like banana, oranges, mangoes, etc. She has requested a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more fruit to sell. She hopes to become a major fruit distributor in future. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for resale

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Ángela es casada tiene 49 años, tres hijos de 33,22, 18 años, ellos estudian y trabajan.
Ángela  puso una jugeria, pero el dueño del local le subió la cuota y tuvo que dejarlo, se puso a hacer chocolates, a tejer chompas, carteras, zapatos, también por las tardes se puso a estudiar marinera con sus dos  hijos  y enseñaba en su casa a sus vecinos, vio que también le era rentable,   la gente se  interesaba entonces. Decidió  dar clases de marinera con sus hijos, y seguir en el negocio de ventas de chocolates. 
Ángela necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de arreglos de flores, chocolatería para el día de la madre. 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como ahorrar para poder progresar, de las charlas que ha recibido esta prendiendo a administrar su negocio. 
El sueño de Ángela es implementar su academia de marinera
texts.en:
Ángela is a member of the Sarita Colonia Community Bank. She is married, 49 years old, and has three children who are 33, 22, and 18. Her children study and work. Ángela started a juice shop, but the owner of the place she was renting raised the rent and she had to stop that business. Then she began making chocolates and knitting sweaters, wallets, and shoes. Also, in the afternoons she began studying sailing with her two children and taught her neighbors from her home. She saw that this was profitable, and people became interested in her classes. She decided to give sailing lessons with her children and also continue to sell chocolates. Ángela needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy flower arrangements and chocolate items for Mother's Day. Since she has been a part of Finca she has learned to save in order to progress. From the discussions she is learning how to run her business. Ángela's dream is to start her own sailing school.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flower arrangements and chocolate items for Mother's Day

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo K. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Elle est propriétaire d’un magasin de distribution d’eaux minérales à Lomé. Pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, Adjo souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en alimentant son magasin. Ce secteur est très prometteur car les demandes sont importantes et il y a peu de personnes qui s’y opèrent.
texts.en:
Adjo K., age37, is married, the mother of a little daughter, and the owner of a store for distributing mineral water in Lomé. To satisfy the needs of her customers, she would like to use this loan to expand her business by stocking her store. This field is very promising because the demand is significant, and there are few people who operate in it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela cuenta 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos. Junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar papas y alverjas, durante estos meses de cosecha hay bonanza por lo que trata de acumular sus ingresos económicos, para utilizarlos como capital en los próximos cultivos de papa. A las 4.00am Adela inicia sus labores de ama de casa, después, a las 9.00am alista sus viandas donde carga el almuerzo de su esposo y el suyo para ir a trabajar a sus chacras. En esta época la siembra de papas les ha sido muy rentable, porque en el mercado les han cotizado a un buen precio, lo que la anima a seguir sembrando, las papas que nos muestra en la foto son de un tamaño seleccionado que tienen un precio mayor, y generalmente son enviados a los mercados de Lima por ser mucho más rentables. Adela está muy feliz con su actividad, tiene grandes anhelos de progresar a base de la agricultura y brindarles comodidad a su familia e hijos. Este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y que en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy eficiente y puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando es para mandar a arar con tractor su chacra descansada (sin producir) de hace varios años, y con otra parte comprará insecticidas contra los gusanos.
texts.en:
Adela is 32 years old, lives with her partner and father of their 3 children. Together with her husband they plant potatoes and peas, during these harvesting months there is enough prosperity to build their income, in order to use the capital in the next round of potato crops. At 4:00 AM Adela begins her work as a housewife, after, at 9:00AM she prepares food for packed lunches for her and her husband to take while working their farmlands. Right now potato planting is very profitable, because of the good market price, which encourages her to continue planting. The potatoes shown in the photo are of the selected size that fetches the highest price, and are generally sent to the markets in Lima to be more profitable.

Adela is very happy with this activity, and has high hopes to progress on the basis of agricultural and provide more comfort for her family and children. This is her 9th loan with MFP, and all this time she has shown that she is a very punctual and efficient customer in her payments. The money she requests now is to buy a tractor to plow her farmland that has been unproductive for many years, and the other part will buy insecticides against worms.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a tractor to plow their farmland.

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr:
H. Léontine est née le 23 mars 1977 à ADJOHOUN dans la Vallée du Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Léontine est mariée à SEGODO Roger déclarant en douane. Léontine est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Léontine est dans la restauration. En effet, Léontine vend devant chez elle à la maison la pâte de maïs, de causette d'igname, de manioc, du riz et du haricot. Léontine connait de fréquentes rupture de stock en maïs, riz et haricot. Pour parer à cette difficulté, Léontine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé sous forme de prêt afin de pouvoir constituer un stock important de provisions pour mieux servir sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Léontine was born on March 23, 1977 in ADJOHOUN, in the valley of Ouémé county, in southern Benin. She is married to SEGODO Roger, a customs advisor, and is the mother of three children, all in school. She works in the food catering business. Essentially, in front of her home, she sells cornmeal mash, chips made of yams or cassava, rice, and beans. Léontine used to experience frequent inventory shortages of corn, rice, and beans. To fend off these difficulties, she’s requesting financial support from Alidé in the form of a loan in order to be able to replenish her sizable stock of provisions, so as to serve her customers better.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, beans, cassava flour, rice, and condiments for making sauces

loans.name: Elías

texts.es: Elías tiene 65 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos que ya viven fuera de casa, vive con su esposa en su casa propia. La agricultura es parte de su vida, y le permitió educar a cada uno de sus hijos, pero él sigue labrando la tierra como cuando sus hijos eran pequeños; hasta el momento ha sembrado 6 hectáreas divididas entre papa, alverjas y maíz. Pero de todas las siembras que realiza la que le genera más ingresos económicos es la papa, solo que en esta temporada tiene dificultad con algunas de sus chacras a las que le afectó una plaga, las hojas se vuelven de color negro, y merma el desarrollo del producto, por lo que su actual preocupación es de salvar los cultivos. Aparte de lidiar con este tipo de dificultades, Elías se siente muy contento por sus otros cultivos, y cuando llegue la época de cosechar los podrá negociar a un buen precio, para que pueda comprarse una mula para llevar sus cargas. El es un cliente muy puntual, viene trabajando su 4to préstamo con MFP y en cada reunión de su banco comunal asiste puntualmente y siempre sugirió ideas para mejorar. El dinero que solicita es para comprar insecticidas para el controlar el mal de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Elías is 65 years old, is married with six children that don't live at home. He lives with his wife in their own home. Agriculture is part of their life, and has enabled them to educate each child, but he continues to work the land while like when his children were young. At the moment he has planted six hectares of land divided into potato, peas, and corn. Of all the crops the potato yields the most profit, but this season he has more difficulty because some of the land is affected by pests, the leaves turn black, reducing the development of the product. His current preoccupation is to save the crops.

Apart from dealing with these difficulties, Elías feels very happy with his other crops, and when the time comes to harvest he will be able to negotiate a good price, so that he can buy a mule to carry his loads. He is a very punctual customer, who is working on his fourth loan with MFP, each village bank meeting he attends on time and always suggests ways to improve it. The money he requests is to buy insecticides to control the bad parts of his plants.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de insecticidas

loans.name: Nelbi

texts.es:
La sra. NELBI, nació en la provincia de chincheros en la comunidad de cruz pata, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco en transporte público.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella tiene una combi y hace transporte público en la ruta Cusco, también es negociante, la socia compra mercadería de todo tipo, ropa, productos de limpieza, y demás para la venta al público en general, la socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y comprar mercadería.

La sra. Nelbi está muy agradecida con este medio y reitera su compromiso de cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
NELBI was born in Chincheros province, in the village of Cruz Pata, located 1 hour by public transportation from the city of Cusco.

She alternates her responsibilities at home with the business. She owns a "combi" (a small bus or van) and provides transporation services on the Cusco road. She's a merchant, too, buying goods of all kinds--clothes, cleaning products and so on--to resell. She is applying for a loan so that she can travel and buy goods.

Nelbi is very grateful to have this means to borrow funds and commits to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Kesina

texts.en: Kesina is 32 years old. She is married and has no children. She sells sarongs and lace by hawking it within her community of Warri, in Delta state, Nigeria. She has requested and hopes to get a loan of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and lace to sell

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en: Ejiro is a 38-year-old fashion designer who is married with six children. She also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She has been in this business for a long time. She has requested a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials for sale. She sends her thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Milca

texts.es:
MILCA O. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Luren”, su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Guillermo  Sisley Nº 495, en el distrito de Callería, ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 51 años de edad, trabaja haciendo manualidades, es muy creativa, su esposo trabaja  en el Magisterio y tienen 4 hijos que aun dependen económicamente de ella..

Ella tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para invertir en materiales para hacer manualidades y ofrecer a algunas amigas. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para hacer bolsos , carteras, y zapatos; además de financiar el estudio de tres de sus hijos, que la motivan día a día..

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la ayuda a tener un capital financiero con el que puede trabajar, beneficiando directamente a sus hijos.
texts.en:
MILCA O. A., belongs to the Village Bank “Señor de Luren”. Her residence is located in Jr. Guillermo Sisley Nº 495, in the Callería district, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 51 years old, does craftwork, and is very creative. Her husband works in teaching and they have four children who are still economically dependent on her.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. The first loan she had was in the amount of 300 Nuevos Soles, which she used to invest in materials to make crafts to offer to some friends. With this loan of l,000 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying materials to make handbags, wallets, and shoes; further, she will finance the education for three of her children, they motivate her daily.

She is grateful for Manuela Ramos, because they help her to have financial capital that she can work with, directly benefiting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to produce purses, wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris la couture et a ouvert son propre atelier, elle a associé à son activité le commerce de pagnes, elle veut agrandir son stock de pagnes pour réaliser plus de recettes. elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 8 pagnes  de  qualité PHOENIX, 8 pagnes de qualité HITARGET et 10 gripures. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de hedrzanawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Avec cette activité elle contribue aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew and opened her own workshop. She has included with it commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She wants to expand her stock of pagnes to realize more receipts. She's therefore requesting her first loan from WAGES that will enable her to buy eight PHOENIX quality pagnes, 8 HITARGET quality pagnes, and 10 guipures. She is married, the mother of three, and lives with her family in Hedrzanawoé, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. With this business, she helps to cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Fumi is 32 years old, married, and has no children. She sells drinks. Fumi is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos, los cuales viven independientemente. Se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa en chacra temporales, Epifanio nos comenta sobre los riesgos de sembrar en este tipo de terreno, pues si no llueve lo necesario, sus productos no desarrollan, pero su llueve demasiado, son afectados por las plagas, que malogran el producto, como nos muestra en la foto, unas hojas de papa enfermas. Epifanio se siente impotente al perder sus cultivos de esta manera, pero a pesar de eso, no pierde las esperanzas en esta actividad, aunque por el momento tenga que enfrentarse a estos problemas, ya que no cuenta con tierras de regadío. Aunque la siembra de papa es de mucha inversión, cuando la cosecha es fructífera, la recompensa económica es muy buena. Epifanio es un cliente muy inquieto, siempre hace intervenciones acertadas en su banco comunal, este es el 4to crédito que viene trabajando con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus cultivos y que sean resistentes a los fenómenos climatológicos.
texts.en:
Epifanio is 59 years old, he lives with his partner and mother of his four children, who all live independently. He is in agriculture for a living, planting potatos in temporary farmland.
