Epifanio says there are risks in planting seeds in this type of land, because if there isn't the necessary amount of rain, his products do not develop; if it rains too much, they are affected by pests that ruin the product, like the diseased potato leaves shown in the photo. Epifanio feels helpless to lose his crops in this way, but in spite of this, he does not lose hope in the activity. For now now he has to confront these problems, because he has no irrigated land. Although planting potatos is a big investment, when the harvest is succesful, the financial recompensation is very good.

Epifanio is a very eager customer, who always participates in his village bank. This is his fourth loan while working with MFP, and every time he has shown that he is a customer who is on time with each of his payments. The money he requests is to purchase fertilizer for his crops, so that they will be resistant to weather.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Osarugue

texts.en: Osarugue is 48 years old and is married with 6 children. She sells garri, in retail, to her customers (garri is a food made from cassava tubers). She hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Virginia es viuda tiene 47 años, tres hijos  de 25 23, y 13 años que esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Virginia empezó con un negocio de verduras en el mercado, pero sufrió un accidente, el carro donde viajaba se volcó quedando ella impedida de caminar, entro a rehabilitación por dos años y pudo recuperarse, ahora camina y  ha puesto una bodega en su casa.   
Virginia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosas surtidas, verduras, frutas y útiles escolares. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los préstamos le han ayudado para crecer en su negocio, le gusta la solidaridad entre las socias.
El sueño de Virginia es tener un pequeño minimarket.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of Bancomunal Sarita Colonia. Virginia is a 47 year old widow, with three kids that are 25, 23, and 13 years old. They are studying at the state school. She started with a vegetable business in the market, but was in an accident, the car she was in overturned and she could not walk. She entered into rehabilitation for two years to recover, and is now walking and has put a market in her home. Virginia needs a 3000 soles loan, to purchase beer, a selection of soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, and school supplies. Since she has been in Finca, the loans have helped her business grow, she likes the solidarity between members. It is Virginia's dream to have a small minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Virginia needs a 3000 soles loan in order to buy beer, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits and school supplies.

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese is 25 years old. She is single and has no children. She sells women's clothes and shoes. Ese started this business in 2008. She has requested and hopes to get a loan of N50,000 to purchase more women's clothes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells cooked food in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria to make a living. She is 45 years old and married with six children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa K. est revendeuse de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Agée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. le pagne occupe une part importante dans la confection de tenus de la population togolaise. c’est ainsi que la demande demeure très élevée. Pour faire face à ce besoin croissant, Akossiwa souhaite avec ce crédit se ravitailler en pagnes.
texts.en:
Akossiwa K. sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth) at the grand market of Lomé. She has been in this business for five years. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three. Pagnes occupy a significant portion of clothing manufacture for the people of Togo. Such is the reason why the demand remains very high. To address the growing need, Akossiwa would like to use this loan to resupply herself with pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with pagne cloth

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los que vive en su casa del campo. Se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras que compra por chacra, para ella toda planta es negociable, y lo hace semanalmente en cada una de las ferias de su zona. Cada martes corta y prepara las plantas o verduras que venderá en el mercado de Tarma, su esposo la apoya con el transporte hasta el mercado, y de ese modo, con esta actividad puede cubrir la educación de su hijo mayor que está forjándose en una carrera técnica en la ciudad. Leonor se siente muy feliz y dichosa por el trabajo organizado que lleva con su pareja, ahora están viendo la posibilidad de comprarse un terreno en la ciudad, para evitarse trasnochar y salir de madrugada de su pueblo cuando llevan sus productos, asimismo poder darle mejor comodidad a su hijo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy motivada de ingresar en su banco comunal, para aprender a manejar su negocio y sus ahorros, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente cada una de las cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de una chacra de alverjas, para después venderlas al por menor, así reunirá las ganancias para solventar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Leonor is 37 years old, is married and has 2 children who live at her house in the country. She purchases and sells vegetables that she buys for the farm, for her every plant is negotiable, and she does it weekly in each of the markets in her area. Every tuesday she cuts and prepares plants or vegetables to be sold in the market in Tarma, her husband helps to transport them to the market. Thus, this activity can cover the education of their oldest son, who is forging a techincal career in the city. Leoner feels very happy and blissful for the organized labor she does with her partner. They are now looking to buy a plot of land in the city, to avoid being out late and leaving early in the morning from their town when they bring in their products. At the same time they can give their son more comfort.

This is her first loan with MFP. She is very motivated to invest in the village bank, in order to learn how to manage their business and savings; they have made commitments to pay on time whenever due. The money she requests will buy farmland for peas, which she will then sell at retail and collect the profits for her son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland for peas.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana O. is 35 years old. She is married and a mother with three children. Her husband is a (galamsey) operator, that is he is gold miner and electrician. Diana lives in a mining community where most of the men are gold miners. This has created job opportunities for many youth in the community where Diana lives. 

She is a food vendor who sells fried yam and fried fish. Fried yam is enjoyed by almost every Ghanaian, especially for lunch. She purchases her stock of yam and fish in bulk, from the farming communities. Diana arranges the fried yam in a transparent showcase with fish and pepper. She sells mostly mostly through hawking. She has been in this business for a year. She requests a loan to buy more tubers of yam and fish to prepare her food. With the loan she believes she will have the increased resources to support her husband in providing a better education for her family. She therefore will be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua’ which literally means God’s family.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of yam and fish for resale

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Natividad es casada tiene 56 años, dos hijos de 29 y 30 años., ya están  son casados.
Natividad  hace doce años estudio manualidades en un centro especial y con el tiempo se puso a dictar clases y a confeccionar manualidades, se compro su maquina industrial, para poder terminar sus pedidos a tiempo.  
Necesita un crédito de 800 soles, para la compra de tela para sabanas.
Desde que esta en Finca ha a portado mucho a su vida, es un soporte para su negocio, aprendió la  camarería, el compañerismo y la solidaridad. 
El sueño de natividad es tener un taller de productividad de linia blanca.
texts.en:
Natividad is a partner of Bancomunal Sarita Colonia. She is married and is 56 years old. She has two kids, 29 and 30 years old who are already married. For twelve years Natividad studies handicrafts in a special center where she now gives classes and also makes her own handicrafts. She bought an industrial machine, so she can finish her orders on time. She needs a loan of 800 soles, in order to buy fabric for sheets. She has done well in life since she has been in Finca. It is a support for her business, and she has learned camaraderie, companionship and solidarity. Her dream is to have a workshop producing white linen.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs an 800 soles loan to buy fabric for sheets.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia
Catalina es casada tiene 48 años, dos hijos de 28 y 16 años este ultimo esta estudiando  en la escuela estatal. 
Catalina se dedica a ayudar a coser a su hermana y  a la decoración de fiestas infantiles por necesidad. 
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de tela para mandiles de colegio.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió la solidaridad, a  como crecer en el negocio.  
El sueño de catalina  es tener una tienda  bazar.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Sarita Colonia Community Bank. Catalina is married and has two children aged 28 and 16 - the youngest is studying at the state school. Catalina helps her sister with sewing and providing decorations for children's parties on order. She needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy material to make school aprons. Since she's been with Finca, she has learnt about solidarity and how to make her business grow. Catalina's dream is to own a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Catalina needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy material to make school aprons

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria cuenta con 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 4 de ellos migraron a la ciudad de Lima. Junto a su esposo siembra maíz, alverjas, espinacas y demás verduras, también cría animales que en momentos de necesidad, puede vender y solventar algunos gastos; como cuando los precios de sus productos en el mercado no fueron buenos, pudo pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos con la crianza y venta de su ganado. Por ello, Maria nos muestra su tierna becerrita,  que está esperando a su madre, la cual está sujeta en la praderas para que se alimente bien y pueda brindar de su leche, no solo a su cría, sino también a sus amos, pues María tiene varios pedidos para repartir, y con las ganancias de este negocio, compra los víveres para la comida del día.  Ahora su esposo está sembrando avena para alimentar a sus animales y que les sigan proporcionando su deliciosa leche. Maria es fundadora de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho cariño y estima, y durante este tiempo ha ocupado diversos cargos que ha cumplido con mucha responsabilidad, asimismo cada una de sus cuotas las ha pagado puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para preparar sus tierras con arados, así podrán aumentar su producción y tendrán provisiones para los meses de agosto, que son meses de sequía en su zona.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and married. She has six children of whom four have migrated to the city of Lima. Together with her husband she sows maize, peas, spinach and other vegetables. She also raises animals which at times of need she can sell in order to meet expenses, such as when the prices of goods in the market weren't good and she was able to pay for her children's education with the sale of her livestock. Maria showed us her dear calf who was waiting for his mother who is being kept in the paddocks in order that they she is well feed and can provide milk not only for her young but also to her owners. Also, Maria has various orders to fill and with the profits from this business she buys the food for that day's meals. Now her husband is sowing oats in order to feed their animals so that they continue to produce their delicious milk. Maria is the founder of her community bank, for which she has much affection and esteem and during this time she has occupied many different posts which she has fulfilled with a great deal of responsibility: she's also repaid every one of her installments punctually. The money which she is asking for is to prepare and plough her lands in order to be able to increase production and have provisions for August, which is a time of drought in their area.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prepare her lands for sowing

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul A. is married with 4 children. He received an education through junior high school. Paul works as an auto electrician, selling goods such as batteries, starters and car alarms in Elmina.  Paul has been in business since 2005 and his wife is employed as a trader. He uses his income to pay for school fees and bills. Paul will use the loan to purchase additional batteries and goods to expand his business. With his newly gained profits, Paul plans to use the money to further his children's education.

loans.use: Paul will use the loan to purchase additional batteries and goods to expand his business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama T. is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their four children. Currently the youngest child is breastfeeding and the older children are attending school in the community. Ama lives in the mining community called Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda, in the eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who cooks and serves rice with stew and banku. She sells at the community center and also sells at the field where they do mining. Banku is prepares from milled grains and is taking with either pepper or soup. She prepares her food well which has attracted many customers to buy from her stand. Ama has been in this food business for the last eight years. But currently she has been hit by inadequate funds to buy stock. She is asking for a loan to buy grain like maize and rice, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc. She believes her only help now would come from no one else apart from you. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua’ which literally means God’s family.

loans.use: To buy grains like maize and rice, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia
Lourdes es casada tiene 42 años, un hijo D. 25 años y otros D. 9 años que esta en la escuela particular.
Lourdes entro a trabajar en el Terminal pesquero con su tío por varios años, hasta que un día su tío la motivo a que comience su negocio propio, con los ahorros que tenía compro pescado y lo empezó a vender, los clientes le pedían que le llevara el pescado  hasta sus cevicheria, ahora ella distribuye 400 kilos D. pescado semanal    
Lourdes necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles, para compra D. pescado al por mayor.
DesD. que esta en Finca, aprendió ha sacar sus cuentas, hacer balance todas las semanas, aprendió a separar la ganancia del capital.  
El sueño D. Lourdes es traer pescado del norte para vender en el terminar.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Sarita Colonia community bank. Lourdes is married and is aged 42. She has one son aged 25 and another aged 9 who is currently at a private school. Lourdes started working in the fishing harbour with her uncle and continued for several years, until the day that her uncle encouraged her to begin her own business with the savings that she had. So she bought fish and began to sell it: customers would ask her to bring the fish to their cervicheria (fish restaurants) so now she distributes 400 kilos of fish per week. Lourdes needs a loan of 2400 soles in order to buy fish wholesale. Since she's been part of Finca, she has learn how to keep her accounts and make them balance every week and has learnt to separate income from capital. Lourdes' dream is to bring fish from the north in order to sell it at the port.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lourdes needs a loan of 2400 soles in order to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret D. is a 32-year-old trader. She is a widowed mother with three children. Her husband died three years ago after a prolonged sickness. She is still searching for her better half. She lives at Takroase in the eastern region of Ghana.

Margaret sells used-clothes in the local market of Takroase and has been in this business for the past two years. With income from her business, Margaret is supporting all her children in school. Selling of used-clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new items are very expensive for the economically active poor. She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods.

Margaret’s major business challenge over the years has to do with the availability of funds to scale up the business. She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her children’s education.

She belongs to a village bank called “Yesu Abusua” which literaly means “God’s family”.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is married with 5 dependents and has received an education through elementary school. Since 1990 she has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling an assortment of goods such as gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), maize, and utensils.  While Adjoa works as a trader, her husband is employed as a surveyor. Adjoa uses her income to help pay her family’s bills.  She plans to use the loan to purchase additional gari and maize for resale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to continue saving so that eventually she may be able to build a home for her family.

loans.use: she plans to use the loan to purchase additional gari and maize for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia Maribel

texts.es:
Cecilia  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Cecilia es casada tiene 43 años, dos hijos de 16 y 9 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Ella es maestra de educación primaria, enseña manualidades, y siempre que hacia le decían que sus diseños eran muy bonitos, hace dos años atrás tuvo la idea de hacer  joyas para vender, las mismas mamas de los niños son su clientas, también por las tardes  cose para la calle.  
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de materiales para joyas y telas para mandiles.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió la unidad, las ganas de superarse como persona y ha planificar  bien su inversión. 
El sueño de cecilia es tener un taller de manualidades.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Sarita Colonia community bank. Cecilia is married and aged 43, with two children aged 16 and 9 who are currently studying in school. She is a primary school teacher, who teaches handicrafts and who always used to be told that her designs were very good, so two years ago she had the idea to make jewellery in order to sell it. The mothers of her children are her customers, and she also sews on the street in the afternoon. Cecilia needs a loan of 800 soles in order to buy materials for her jewellery making and cloth for making school aprons. Since she has been in Finca she has learnt the value of unity. She has a lot of ambition to improve herself and has planned her investment well. Cecilia's dream is to have a handicraft workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cecilia needs a loan of 800 soles in order to purchase materials for jewellery making and school aprons

loans.name: Rossanna

texts.es:
ROSSANNA RODRÍGUEZ BARBARÁN, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Zavala Nº 349, en el distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 38 años de edad. Se dedica a la costura, su esposo es mecánico y tienen 2 menores hijos.

Ella tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar telas y otros materiales de costura, con el fin de mantener su pequeño negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200. Nuevos Soles, invertirá para comprar telas y otros materiales de costura (hilos, cierres), con el propósito de mantener y expandir su pequeño negocio.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya como mujer por medio de los créditos  y las charlas que le brindan las promotoras, permitiéndola solventar gastos en su hogar.
texts.en:
ROSSANNA RODRÍGUEZ BARBARÁN belongs to “Las Margaritas” community bank and lives at no. 349 Zavala Avenue in the district of Calleria in the town of Pucallpa. She is 38 years old. She is a seamstress and her husband is a mechanic and they have two small sons. She has spent four years working with Manuela Ramos and the first loan that she obtained was one of 300 New soles which she used in order to buy fabric and other sewing materials with the aim of maintaining her small business. With this loan of 1200 soles she will invest in buying fabric and other sewing material (thread, buttons) with the aim of maintaining and expanding her small business. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because they have helped her as a woman with the credits and the talks which the promoters offer, allowing her to meet her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.es:
El socio es el sr. DOROTEO; es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en chincheros perteneciente a la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio, alterna sus actividades agrícolas con la compra y venta de ganados vacunos, el socio es casado y tiene 47 años de edad, el tiene 5 hijos de (22, 20, 18, 16, 9) años, por lo cual pide el préstamo en razón de que desea invertir en la compra de un  par de animales vacunos.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
The member, DOROTEO, is a native of the village of Cruz Pata in Chincheros.

He alternates his farming business with another business buying and selling cattle. He is married and 47 years old. He has 5 children (22-, 20-, 18-, 16-, and 9-years old, respectively). He's applying for a loan because he wants to invest in the purchase of a pair of cattle.

The member is grateful to have this means to borrow funds and he commits to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Carmen es casada tiene 54 años cuatro hijos de 30,28, 25 y uno de 12 años que esta estudiando  en la escuela estatal.
Su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y para ayudar en la casa ella se puso a vender lencería compra en gamarra al por mayor, también ella cose en su casa quiere empezar a confeccionar lencería. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para alquilar un kiosco por el mercado y allí vender su mercadería.
Desde que esta en Finca  su economía ha mejorado, aprendió la unión entre compañeras. 
El sueño de Carmen es tener un negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Sarita Colonia.” Carmen is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages: 30, 28, 25, and a 12 year old who is studying in the state school. Her husband is out of work, so she began selling lingerie, bought wholesale at Gamarra, to help out with the house. She also sews at home and wants to start making lingerie. Carmen needs a loan of 800 soles to rent a kiosk in the market where she can sell her merchandise. Since she has been part of Finca, her economic status has improved and she has learned about camaraderie among friends. Carmen's dream is have a business selling clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para alquilar un kiosco por el mercado y allí vender su mercadería.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has one child, a son who is currently in junior high school. Her husband is a dump truck driver. Akua lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Akua is a beverage seller. She prepares and sells beverages such as Milo (a brand of malted milk), tea, and coffee and serves them with fried eggs and bread in the evenings at the truck station. She has been in business for ten years and desires to expand her trade. She procures the materials from big provision shops in Oda, a larger neighboring town. She hopes to give her son the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure provision
